description:
I've been coming to this place off n on for years. The past few years, the buns were bigger than the meat and all the toppings, so there was always extra bad. The fries had a seasoning that was too strong and put me off ordering the fries.
 I went today and all the 49er memorabilia was gone off the walls?!? New owners or changing up the interior.. I ordered the Old Jefe and fries and it was good!! The bun is to the equivalent to the size of patty and the toppings. No extra bun hanging out and the bun didn't taste old and stale as I've had in the past. The fries weren't overseasoned as in the past, but just salt and pepper. I actually enjoyed my meal and will be coming back..
 Staff was nice and very polite. Got some onion rings on the side and it was crispy and not too much batter or soggy. Nom nom..
author: V. P.

description:
I'm only giving this place 3 stars because the first chicken sandwich I ordered was raw in the middle.

I was given a replacement and holy smokes it was good! I had the Side Chick Sandwich with no chipotle and it was so delicious (when it wasn't raw). The cheese was melted, the roll was soft, and all together it was just a darn good delicious sandwich. I want to try this place again, but I will always be cautious of those first few bites of chicken.
author: Larissa S.

description:
Omg!  So glad I stumbled upon this cute little hole in the wall burger joint!  Their burgers are just perfect size, perfect taste with the most mouth watering fries with perfect seasonings!  Best of all, they have chipotle aioli and hot sauce in their condiments area for spicy lovers like myself!  Nothing about their food is overwhelming. 

I got the El Jeffe with their fries and a can of Dr. Pepper. It's a spicy beef burger with pepper jack cheese and bacon. I skipped the bacon and replaced pepper jack with cheddar...I'm still sitting here devouring every bite as I write this review!  Definitely a must go spot!
author: Me V.

description:
Ordered delivery via Grubhub. I ordered the italian stallion and my boyfriend ordered the OG burger (double patty add cheese) . Love the simplicity of the OG- your classic cheeseburger and super flavorful with a hefty bun to hold all in the ingredients intact. Double patty was a little too much might even settle for the single patty next time. 

The Itallian Stallion was delicious. Single patty with pepper jack cheese, marinara sauce, lettuce AND MOZZERELLA STICKS (add grilled onions and bacon). Also an extremely delicious burger. the bacon was thick and crisp and was in every bite, the mozzerella sticks were well seasoned and delicious and every thing just worked really well together. 

Also ordered side of mozerella sticks which we already established were delicious, and french fries. 
The fries are why this place isnt getting five stars. I dont know if I got an old batch or what happened but the fries were really dry and almost stale :/ Delivery also only took about 10 minutes once I got the notification that it was picked up from the restaurant so I dont know what happened but they arent worth ordering again imo.  

Overall- really delicious burgers and will be adding to the list of delivery options
author: Kathryn S.

description: THEY ARE NEVER OPEN. Food is fine. Don't need to go out of your way to try, but if you're in the area and crave a burger, it'll do the job.  BUT THEY ARE NEVER OPEN, so you might never get to try it. I don't know how they stay afloat in a town like this.
author: Mylinh N.

description: Great spot. Meant for pick up. Its really changed for the best over the years. Its definitely a pillar of this side of Balboa. Sometimes the cashier is moody, but it gets busy at times.
author: Stare D.

description: Hours are not as posted. Staff is very rude and said they were closed at 9pm, posted hours say closed at 10pm. Drove across city to a find help wanted sign and staff not interested in being there. Never again! Hope they close their business soon.
author: Gianfranco R.

description:
I had the worst delivery experience ever.
I paid for an extra patty in my burger and I didn't get it.
I ordered a Diet Coke and got a ginger ale (which I hate). 
When I told the delivery guy so, he opened the app, saw that I had ordered a Coke and told me that I should talk to the restaurant because that's what they gave to him. 
I tried to call more than 10 times but no one would get the phone, so I couldn't even complain about that.
author: Diana F.

description:
Best burger eveeer don't skip this place 
Classic 49er lunch stop
Hot sauce is always there fries are good quick service
author: George M.

description: This place is used to be good when the lady who originally ran this place would be around. Now they just get college students to run the place who don't pay much attention and forget about your orders or just mess it up. The food is meh and the service is down. Don't recommend going here. Go to native burger instead - better burgers, better service. Very disappointing...
author: Arcti C.

description:
Was looking for a burger place in the Richmond/USF area.  Uncle Boys popped up and looked good so off we went.  Located on a mostly residential Balboa street with plenty of street parking.

This place is really small.  Behind the counter is the grill.  2 people working - the chef and an order taker.  Was looking around and couldn't find a menu so the nice order lady pointed it out.  I was surprised at how many items they for such a small place - not only burgers, but chicken, veggie burger, wings, chicken tenders, and a host of appetizers.

I opted for the O.G. with cheese, Mom the El Jefe, bro the Chicken Tenders and Mozzrella Sticks.  All were combos with fries and fountain drinks.  The nice order lady helped me through the order.  Not more than 5 minutes later it was ready.  However, somewhere between the nice order lady and the chef they forgot our mozzarella sticks.  I asked for them and they were ready in 2 minutes.

The burgers were really good.  Fresh veggies, perfectly cooked.  Toasted bun.  Yum,yum, yum.  Mom loved the El Jefe and finished it off.  She hardly ever finishes a burger.  And bro had too much between his chicken tenders and mozzarella sticks so your truly poached some.  That chef is maestro with the fryer.  The tenders and stick where great.  Great flavor and perfectly cooked.  No limp tenders or sticks at Uncle Boys.

Great food, very reasonable prices, and nice friendly people.  Only issue is finding a place to sit and eat.  But we'll deal with that.  Uncle Boys, we'll be back.
author: Steve G.

description:
This place wasn't that great in my opinion.
It's tiny inside with only 3 stools to eat on. There's a few small tables on the outside to eat. 
I waited about 5 minutes before anyone greeted me. The cook was outside the Restraunt hanging out. 
The burger itself was average. 
It costed $15 for the bacon cheeseburger, fries and a drink.
In and out is better: taste, freshness and quality.
I would have to eat at least 3 of these burgers to get full.
author: Kevin S.

description: Burger taste like jack in the box ! Hella smoke in the facility! Over priced! Service is good but not great!
author: William Y.

description:
Hole in the wall burger place in an unassuming residential portion of Balboa.  Hubby always wanted to try Uncle Boy's since we've passed by it numerous times and he's a burger fanatic.  The burgers are a drunkie's dream.  And my hubby got one of them.  It was called the Italian Stallion and had marinara sauce, pepperjack with jalapeño poppers and lettuce.  I got the Nephews burger which had a slice of jack, lettuce, tomatoes and pesto sauce.  There were two  employees there, one female and one male.  Thank goodness that the female was making our burgers, as the male didn't seem to regard taking off his gloves when he was doing certain things.  He may have been newer too as it looked like she was showing him what to do.  

We took our burgers to go and it took about 15 minutes for us to drive back home.  The pesto sauce was delicious (store bought though). The burgers were a good size and at an affordable price.  However, I wished both burgers were juicy.  His sounds like the ultimate drunk food, but the jalapeno poppers were soggy.  The burger wasn't bad, it was just odd and we wouldn't order them again.  Fries were well seasoned and some were crisp.  Overall, it's not a destination spot, but a solid place in the area when the burger craving hits.  Gotta give them props for some creative items!
author: Cat C.

description: I go here a lot and I always leave a tip but this last time I ordered and waited 15-20 mins and people that came in received their order before mine and when I finally got mine my order was wrong and fries burnt . When I returned it , I got attitude from the chief so I got a refund and just wasted 40 mins of my Friday night and I'm not a complainer
author: Junior Jones E.

description: Situated in a quaint neighborhood, the burgers were generously proportions and delicious. I highly recommend the fries and the onion rings as well. The only downside is that they do not have a soda machine and the only sodas available are in cans.
author: JoAnn Y.

description:
Uncle Boy's i've heard of; 
lst time seeing them.
no posted menu. offerings just on 2 sided flyer. one side had chicken, other had burgers or so i thought.

eats: garden burger, medium rare (6.79)
-actually it's a vegeterian soy burger. cooked near medium rare.
-taste mostly veggies, seasoning, patty had no taste.
-taste just average, am sure the burgers or chicken would have tasted better.
-meters all around, didn't feed any.
-little seating inside diner.
author: Victor G.

description:
Consistent quality, reasonable prices, and quick speed. These are the 3 main reasons why I'm giving this place a 5 star review. 

Also... It's super convenient for me to get here. 

When I'm thinking "I want a burger" what I really mean is "I want Uncle Boy's". I honestly don't remember the burger names but it'll either have bacon or avocado in it. 

I usually order ahead of time and pick it up for dinner. 

Also, one time my friend's car broke down in this area around 1am. As we pushed the car by this restaurant a Good Samaritan ran out from here and helped us push the car to a parking spot. What a guy. 

Actually I'm super hungry right now and I could use a burger. Since these guys are open late I could just stop typing and head over there right now....
author: Jeff C.

description: I just placed another order from Uncle Boy's Restaurant and once again am thoroughly pleased with the all around experience.  They've got the best onion rings out there!! They really do; cooked just right with enough batter and onion to please the hungriest pallet!!! A great late night snack!!!!
author: Eric M.

description: Another work shift another burger. I came here after my day shift ended and I must say for a Ma and Pa burger joint this place really rocks. In this part of SF you get competitive restaurants and fast food places. This is the direct competition to Bill's place. I saw this joint on Check Please Bay Area and decided to drive my car here. It was no doubt the best burger that I had, it exceeded the the standard of food that most San Franciscans see. I love how they have burgers with some pretty out of this world ingredients AKA things you don't see on an In N Out burger. All the vegetables are organic. You can even some nice drinks here. The price is a lot lower than Bill's place but the food quality is the same and it lessens the competition between both places. The service is average but most other customer are SF natives. Thus the atmosphere is real nice. Good for any weekday like lunch!
author: Michael W.

description:
Used to love this place, but I really can't bring myself to come here any longer. Phone off the hook, alerting staff to this "nope, works fine." The service is god awful, they'd rather horse around and chat instead of getting orders accurately done. It's super insulting to ask 3 times for a meal, get charged for just a burger, then when you ask where your fries and drink are, to pay AGAIN. So 20-30 minutes for a wrong order, listening to the staff fuck around.

Keep heading this way, you'll do nothing but one time deliveries.
author: Tomas C.

description: nice spot with friendly staff and good food. was in the area and did a yelp search for burgers. glad i found it i'll be back
author: Tina K.

description: In San Fran for vacation. Stopped in for some burgers to take back to our AirBNB. After scouring Yelp I decided on Uncle Boy's based solely off the pics posted by other reviewers. Turns out I made the right choice. Solid burgers. Meat was juicy, buns were fresh, cheese was great and the bacon was crispy. I ordered my own combo that included: Meat, cheddar, bacon, grilled onions and BBQ Ranch sauce. It was perfection. The rest of my family enjoyed their burgers as well. Fries were solid too.
author: Alison A.

description: Ordered a few burgers via Ewwber Eats, really good quality burger, fries , bacon and onion rings. Way better than Bill's on Clement
author: Marat V.

description: A m a z i n g burgers and great fries. Friendly staff. Small, so there's not much seating but such a good place to go for a quick bite or to fill a craving.
author: Sarah P.

description: This place is so good and it's a great price!!! The only thing I would say is that there isn't really a place to sit so this is more of a to go restaurant but it's so goooood!!!! And the people were so nice and accommodating! Definitely a good place to go to and it's right by the park!
author: Mykel D.

description: These are the best burgers & fries! They are made to order and huge! I get the Cowboy and fries every single time. The cooks and staff are super friendly and when the kitchen gets slammed they are always apologetic and accommodating.
author: Allison T.

description: The Urban Cowboy with bacon and onion rings is where it's at ! They have mozz sticks, and everything is good for a big, fat, sloppy burger joint. Nothing here is good for you. It's not supposed to be.
author: Nicole S.

description: Not much to say about the service, they are friendly enough and they make damn good food. Super small inside with only a few seats. There are vegetarian, chicken, and beef sandwiches available. The fries are SO good. Probably some of the cheapest food in SF.
author: Carla C.

description:
They lost it.
No jalapeño poppers served here anymore. 
Burgers cooked to well done
They tried to clean up their atmosphere but truly lost there idea as a consistently satisfying burger spot. 

Sorry guys
Great customer service but that won't be enough for me
author: Victoria Y.

description: My 78 yo mom and 17 yo son voted to give them 5 stars, so you know it's good! The burgers and chicken sandwiches are delicious and huge, the fries are so yummy. Try with the cowboy or chipotle sauce. Service was great too!
author: Brooke B.

description:
The burger were big and the fries were ok.what turned me off was seeing them prep the chicken on the counter where they serve the food. 

The place is small but still people are walking in and out passing the counter and who knows what germs are flying around.

We ordered drinks and weren't told there was a soda fountain we only saw the can sodas 

The burgers are huge it got me full really fast
author: Brittany C.

description: Burgers are super tasty, highly recommend. Both the Cowboy and El Jefe are delicious. The people are extremely nice. Best burger spot in the Inner Richmond.
author: Lisa W.

description:
I live pretty close to this place and go regularly. I highly recommend it to anyone, especially those who live in the inner richmond!

A couple of things to note:
-Burger tastes are 9/10 ( my favorite is the Cowboy burger)
-Fries tastes are 7/10
-Not much seating (more for takeout)
-Average price for burger fries and drink ($15)
author: Anthony B.

description:
Not a bad burger at all. I ordered the OG - a plain cheeseless burger as I usually do (unless otherwise recommended) to judge the quality of the meat and other ingredients. 

The meat was definitely cooked to perfection and dripping with fat. The other ingredients definitely tasted fresh too - you can see the produce on the side counters.

The Yelp check-in offer was pretty sweet. I got a free drink (choice of unlimited fountain drinks or a can/bottle from the fridge), and the server accidentally gave me fries too, even though I didn't order any (he didn't seem to care though). The fries were m average. Not exceptional, but pretty hard to mess up. 

However, what killed it for me was a combination of the 20+ minute wait due to the large number of take-out and delivery orders ahead of us, and the bun. The bun was too thick and dry and didn't go well with the rest of the burger. Slimming down the bun would definitely go a long way in bringing out the flavour of the meat and toppings.
author: Sameer C.

description:
Erica is amazing. (God I hope that's her name) 
We sat outside waiting for our food and talked to the locals. Everyone is so worm and welcoming. 

Ps we loved our crazy burgers
author: Todd L.

description:
Dude did not use gloves till he noticed I was watching. He was in the phone for the whole time. You'd  think being new to try it out, he'd get off the fun. Did not have grilled onions as advertised. Burger is good but could be about $2-$3 cheaper. 
Overpriced service sucked.
author: Jana L.

description: I had the cowboy burger, onion rings and fries. Super delicious. I really liked this burger. Definitely coming back to this place. The service was super nice and helpful too. Great experience!
author: Theo L.

description: Uncle Boy's is our go-to burger joint in the Inner Richmond. It's nothing fancy but the burgers and fries will fill you up. Though it's a small restaurant, expect at least a 15 minute wait for your food. The Cowboy Burger is great if you're looking for something juicy and filling- can't go wrong with beef, bacon, and onion rings inside a bun. The Chicken-Bella is also a solid choice if you're not a red-meat eater. If you can order ahead of time and pick up, that's the way to go.
author: Grace L.

description:
3.5 onion rings

Perfect place for drunk eats.

Nice help.

Got a cheese burger and onion rings. Did it wow me? Not really but it fit the bill. I liked the atmosphere....In a sorta of funky dinghy way.

There a few places in the inner Richmond that serve fare like this and I sorta liked that. 

You might also consider buffalo burger on geary blvd and Tony's cable car...both are veru similar to Uncle boys.

Drink Up!!!!
author: David G.

description:
I struggle most with assigning a rating. This time, I want to say it's a 5/10. 
Uncle Boy's serves up burgers and fried things in a simple, no-frills, neighborhood spot. It's clear they're big fans of Manny Pacquiao.
They cook up the food on the flat grill right by the doorway. There is a small fridge for beverages in the back. There are just a couple of small tables, so it's mostly a takeout spot. The seats are usually occupied, so I just order for takeout, or call for pickup. The food is tasty, greasy, and messy.

I've tried the following...

APPETIZERS

$4.55 Jalapeno Poppers - 5 fried jalapenos filled w/ cream cheese
$4.55 Mozzarella Sticks - 7 fried breaded mozzarella cheese sticks - super cheesy
$4.55 Zucchini Chips - 10 breaded slices of zucchini
$4.55 Onion Rings - 5 battered onion rings, fried

Lots of fried items. They are mostly all crunchy & heavily breaded. The jalapenos are a little too spicy for me. The zucchini chips are hot and steamy inside. I couldn't even tell what they were until I bit through one.


FINGER FOODS

$6.59 Wings - 8 deep fried:
not bad chicken wings, a little petite


BURGERS
The burgers are pretty juicy & tasty and usually quite messy. I've seen them weigh out slabs of ground beef, shape & flatten them into thin, uniform patties. The cheese is always nicely melted over the patty. The buns are toasted, too. I don't like the shredded lettuce, as it becomes soft and wilted. Takeout orders are especially messy and often dripping with sauce.
Prices aren't too bad for a small business establishment.

$7.49 Nephew - grilled angus beef patty, jack cheese, lettuce, tomato, topped w/ pesto mayo in toasted bun:
good, basic burger with juicy beef patty. I can't really taste the pesto mayo though.

$7.49 Cowboy - grilled angus beef patty, American cheese, bacon, onion rings w/ BBQ ranch sauce in toasted bun:
crunchy, oily onion rings & juicy patty. I could definitely taste the BBQ sauce in this one.

$7.49 Italian Stallion (formerly Mamma Mia) - pepper jack cheese, 3 mozzarella sticks, lettuce, marinara sauce in toasted bun:
also crunchy & oily, with gooey, stringy mozzarella

$7.49 Hip-Poppin - grilled angus beef patty, jalapeno poppers stuffed w/ cream cheese, jack cheese, lettuce & tomato in toasted bun:
also good, a little too spicy for me, but manageable with all the cheesy ingredients

$7.49 Hot Mess - grilled angus beef patty, bacon, cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions, jalapenos topped w/ hot mess sauce in toasted bun:
good, way too spicy for me

They also serve chicken sandwiches, vegan burgers, and hot link sandwiches.

Now I've been pretty satisfied with most of the things I tried. How could I not be? It's high-calorie fried food meant to satiate grumbling hunger pains. It was a good fallback option when you're too tired to cook and need something filling.
However, I haven't returned in a while. I recall they had some serious management issues. There were many times I noticed Uncle Boy's only had one person working in the entire place; taking orders in person, taking orders on the phone, cooking, handling payment, and cleaning. Well actually, poor guy had no spare time for cleaning. No wonder it's hard to get through their phone line when placing a phone order. Need I mention sanitary issues having only one cook deal with cash payments too? 
After a couple of times of dealing with extremely slow service, I can't even call it fast food anymore. Nobody should have to wait 45 minutes for a burger to go. When other patrons asked why he was on his own, he replied that the owner was too cheap to pay more staff members. I was surprised that he was so blunt, but I would be disgruntled too. I don't know if they still deal with bottleneck problems during peak times (especially right around closing time), but it's worth mentioning for people who are strictly looking for a time-saving option.
author: Joy W.

description: Stopped in for a quick bite on our way out of San Francisco.  The family loved it!  Everyone had the OG and fries.
author: Sid K.

description: Delicious but I thought the chicken would be fried not grilled. Oh well guess it is healthier! Mozz stocks were great, fries were awesome. The staff were extremely friendly. We live around the corner so definitely be back!
author: Penny L.

description:
September 18, 2014: National Cheeseburger Day

On the way home, the roommate asked me what I wanted for dinner. Remembering that it was national cheeseburger day, I said, "A cheeseburger please?!" We decided to stop by Uncle Boy's since we've never been.

*Cowboy ($7.49) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco#LfZ2jAKg0gRL3BwUkI4ovA
*Hot mess ($7.49) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco#FV2dbqLFIDrqbAmMXEJV-A
*French fries ($3.25) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco#ex2RPXRePVhFmIi7Cx2unA
*Zucchini chips ($4.55) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco#Vb6vbjR_GIGYmsg8CqW7QQ
*Sauces: Chipotle, Ranch & Pesto mayo http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco#rGLwiSq5LcynFW4j6f2CBg

The burgers were pretty average. Nothing was really special or stood out about them. I hate to say this, but I thought they were similar to burgers from Carl's Jr. The cowboy reminded me of the bacon western cheeseburger. At least the price point here isn't too bad. The one thing I did like was that they offered different sauces to try with everything.

As with average places and middle of the road reviews, 3 stars it is!
author: Elena N.

description: Don't ever order delivery here, they use google express for their delivery drivers.  Nothing wrong with that, until something is forgotten. Eat 24 can only refund the forgotten item(s).  Uncle Boy's will aggressively challenge you to come to the restraunt to pick up what was left out of your delivery order. The management will support this order. Good luck.
author: Dennis A.

description:
It's truly superduper ;) 
I ordered the Tweety and porky w/ fries and it was fabulous. The combination of the sauces, cheese and jalapenos make this chicken burger so good. The fries were also perfect; steak fries just like I like him.
author: Tere C.

description: Classic burger that wont break the bank with friendly owners grateful for business, glad to have them in the hood.
author: Ashley G.

description: I live around the corner from Uncle Boy's and have always been meaning to try it but my wife was just totally not interested. She went out of town for a few days so I decided to finally give it a go. I was not disappointed! I just had the OG burger but it was delicious! Very juicy and tasty! Can't wait to go back!
author: Dave L.

description:
Came in ordered 2 cowboys on 1/27
At 11
Went outside and waited for 10 min 
Came back in 
Made eye contact with the chef/ cashier 
He instantly threw 2 patties on the grill
And told me he thought I left 
He tried ringing me up and taking my money 
So I asked if my burgers were done 
He said almost done 
It's on the grill now
I said no thanks 
And he kept asking you sure you don't want it ?
author: yoo s.

description: Missed my bus so I thought I would stop by and pick up food since I had never been here and they are in my hood. Well- their food is good but it's really unhealthy. Everything was deep fried this or breaded that. I also felt like I had to wait a while to get my food because they had so many online or called in orders. There weren't many people around when I ordered but I guess everyone called it in because they were busy, but weren't busy cooking my food and a lot of people came to pick up. So next time I know to call it in.
author: Julianna I.

description:
UNBELIEVABLY AMAZING BURGERS 
When I tell u that I came from the Midwest where burgers and BBQ are coveted it was so hard finding an amazing burger that could even compare to what I've had back home but I found a place better than anywhere I've had in the entire country! They cook it with love like a five star family cookout! The staff even called me after seeing my UberEATS order  to review it with me JUST TO BE SURE that my order was great! NEW FAVORITE PLACE LOVE YOU GUYS PLEASE NEVER CHANGE
author: Christian C.

description: Really enjoyed it. The lady who seems to own the place was so nice. The burgers we're great. Had the cowboy burger with onion rings and bacon! She have us Xtra onion rings and they were delicious. Fries were good not great. We took it to the park in front of the Disney museum and had a little picnic.
author: Charles W.

description: I got a cowboy burger, the onion ring was uncooked batter that was mushy and raw. There was literally a small 1 inch piece. That was it....  don't waste your money. Way over priced when at Carl's Jr. you would at least get what is advertised. Huge disappointment!!
author: Veronica R.

description: Delightful little restaurant. Stopped in for a quick afternoon meal and the burger and fries were an incredible surprise. The burger was perfectly juicy and the mustard and grilled onions completed a delicious burger. The fries were freshly fried, crispy and hot. What's best is that all of it was under $10, a rare commodity for this area. Hit this place up for a quick, delicious meal. I recommend the OG burger with grilled onions.
author: Bryan H.

description:
Lunch time coming up and since Uncle Boys was close to my place, I decided to try this place.

I ordered pickup from Eat24. I ordered the Cowboy Burger as a combo, which includes a drink and mozzarella sticks. The last item being a choice. You can chose between mozzarella sticks, french fries, jalapeño poppers, zucchini chips or onion rings. I also ordered a side of onion rings and the BBQ wings (8 piece). There are other flavors beside BBQ, but I just wanted that one.

I went to pick up my food then head on home to eat. The mozzarella sticks were okay, crisp on the outside. The onion rings were delicious.

The wings tastes good by itself. The wings were crisp and crunchy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside. The BBQ sauce comes in a separate container that you can pour over the wings. 

The burger...yum. I ordered with the beef cooked medium rare and it was perfect. The beef was so tender and the sauce! The onion rings was a great combo and the bacon, oh my. The bacon was two thick slices sandwiched in between the beef patty and the bun. It was soooo delicious.

Next time I'm feeling hungry, I'm going to get me that burger again. Maybe it was just my hunger talking but I'm pretty sure it was all my taste buds. Great food and close by, Uncle Boy is a great choice.
author: Jen M.

description:
How are you feeling today?  Kind of sad because you got another parking ticket and Dad asked you how your job search was going?  Not so good eh?  Well, go to Uncle Boy's and order up a Dog in Heat!  That dog will fill your mouth with such goodness that the bounce with return to your step and a satisfied smile will return to your face.  Uncle Boy's is comfort food on steroids.

I had the Dog in Heat.  A delicious Louisiana Link sliced down the middle and fried on a flat grill surrounded by chipotle sauce, lettuce and onion on a nice bun.  Nothing mysterious or hidden about this food - as real as you can get; juices dripping down your hand in spite of the nice paper wrapper that comes with the dog  - and you don't care because it's all emotion once the eating starts.  Juices dripping from your jowls, down your chin as that Dog in Heat disappears and all of the flavors of bun, dog, sauce and vegetables have a little taste sensation party inside of your mouth.  You want to scream, but your mouth is full of this amazing food!

Sofie had the Nephew Burger and when I asked her how it was, she said "It's good!" - but with a muffled mouthful of burger and not even bothering to look at me!  She was in attack mode on that burger, head down and focused.  She wasn't about to waste time talking about it.  Neither of us talked until our sandwiches were entirely gone.

The fries were "so so" - nothing special.  Others had onion rings and I coveted them mightily! Next time - I'm having the onion rings.

You know this place is good because it would not stay in business what for the locals who are addicted to the food.  There is hardly anywhere to sit in this tiny restaurant.  Looking into the eyes of the patrons I see a longing and a hunger that is a little on the scary side.  I mean, I'd not want to be behind the counter when someone comes in and wants a Dog in Heat and you have to say, "I'm sorry, we are all out."

Uncle Boy's - it's not better than sex - but it's close!
author: Steve S.

description: My hubby and two boys are burger peeps. And they have rated uncle boys best burgs in San Francisco. They grab a burg from here every chance hey can!!!
author: N M.

description:
A great hole in the wall burger joint. Tiny place with just a couple tables and some counter space. 

Sunday afternoon, the grill was manned by one person but our food was served up quickly. The high school girls behind the counter added to a great experience. Friendly, cheerful and helpful.

The OG burger was neatly stacked and wrapped, juicy and really good. Also tried the chicken tenders which were pretty much extra large chicken nuggets but they were crispy, moist and pretty tasty.
author: Jeany K.

description:
Old school greasy burger joint that serves good burgers and grilled chicken sandwiches. They also make good use of their fried sides.  Some burgers include cheese sticks or jalapeño poppers... gut-bomb or hangover cure... and so worth it.

This is a hole in the wall, so stay home if you're looking for ambiance.  Good food with excellent service.  We'll definitely be back.
author: Zoran L.

description: Chicken fritters is a must try. All white meat is always moist and tender.
author: Jen L.

description: My go to spot for lunch. Normally get the Italian stallion. Just the way flavors blast your taste buds with enough energy to naturally try and take another bite while you still have food in your mouth is a good sign to me that this place is legit. Now if you really want to your taste buds working, add another patty to that sucker and wash that down with a cold soda, chase that with some fries and you'll be slapping yo momma in no time. Great place. Call ahead for pick up to save some time.
author: Julius C.

description:
Uncle Boy's has delicious food and excellent people working there! My boyfriend and I enjoyed our combos along with pleasant convos with the cook and waitress. I had the "El Jefe" after asking the owner (cook) for a recommendation. I couldn't have had a more heavenly experience in my mouth and for only $10 and some change!  My boyfriend has the "Ain't No Punk" combo that is vegetarian! The fries were also really yummy with plenty of pepper for taste. There are burgers, chicken sandwiches, and vegetarian options along with sides like fries and onion rings. Don't forget that there's a free drink with the check in. 

We were very pleased with this friendly customer care and loved every bite. Definitely a must to stop by Uncle Boy's whenever in San Francisco!
author: Genesis G.

description:
Wanted to grab a burger because my friend and I were starving. Burgers seemed fresh and food was cooked directly in front of us. I got the chicken fingers, but wish I got a burger instead.

I would go back if i was in the area!
author: Bori B.

description:
!! Magaleng !! Won the belt back !!
!!...116-112, 116-112, 118-110...!!
!!........Pacquiao vs Bradley II........!!
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco?select=wAlHzR4Pg0dNQ8NxNWOe8w)

Heard of Tito Boy's after the fight.
Figured it was a fitting celebration.
Got the Purple Kowboy Burger.
True handmade middle of the road.

Didn't see lumpia on the menu.
Might return to ask for lumpia.
author: Dan B.

description:
Ok burgers. Good varieties but quality of eat and ingredients didn't seem top. Taste could use some work.

Could use a better drink selection. Good service.

Typical roadside burger stop type place...in a neighborhood in SF...
author: Ryan B.

description: This place had good reviews on Yelp and within walking distance of our doctor appointment. The Italian Stallion Burger was so tasty. My wife really liked the Cowboy Burger and my daughter said that these are the best mozzarella sticks that she's ever had, and she's tried many throughout the country. Very personable staff. Great prices. We will definitely return when we are in the area.
author: Jeff G.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend visiting from LA. Stopped for a bite to eat before hitting the museum. Such a great eating experience! The place is small but more cozy than anything. The two people working there were extremely polite and charismatic. They seemed genuinely interested in getting to know us and that's all before we ate! 

The food was delicious. $10.00 and some change gets you a hearty burger, lots of fries, and a drink.  I got the Aint No Punk Veggie burger which was fantastic! Moderately spicy and flavorful. My girlfriend ordered the "El Jefe" burger which was really spicy but great for anyone who's up for it.
author: Andrew A.

description:
fries were half cold and half hot...

burger tasted great, but it just melted to a mess half way through. very soggy for some reason.

service was slow, took 15 mins for a burger
author: Jason C.

description: Mmm, just had an OG burger with cheese and it was cooked perfectly, just the way I like it. This place is no fuss no muss with zero pretension. Tiny place without much charm but I think low overhead means their prices are extremely reasonable. I was going to eat in but because of the size and the less than Charming atmosphere I decided to take my meal to go and that's the main reason I'm giving 4 out of 5 stars because I would have liked the atmosphere to be a little nicer and more comfortable. And would it kill them to do milkshakes? That's what I was really craving with the burger! A big menu posted on the wall would be much better than looking at those little paper ones. Some small, thoughtful changes and this place, I think, would attract many more customers. But I went for a burger and I got a great one and that's what counts most.
author: Dee C.

description: This place is great. Shout out to Erica and Ariel for always making the best lunch everytime.
author: Eric B.

description: The food is pretty good! However, the customer service is so terrible that I will never come back again. They're not helpful, so rude, and have no respect for the customer. I'd rather go to Burger King in 2nd Ave or Richmond draught house on Geary and 7th
author: Alex G.

description:
your not- too- greasy grease spoon neighborhood joint. lots of varieties of burgers. the beef was juicy, and the veggies crisped. the staff was never idle and continuously tidied up the place when there were only a few customers. 

San Francisco prices, but portions are good. 

the pandora playlist was on point. top 40's and old school hip hop.
author: Chris L.

description:
This was the last place my wife and I wanted to try before we jumped on the New Year's cleanse - at least until her dance competition was finished. And goddamn, this is what you call an awesome last hurrah.

After a week of debauchery in Chicago for the holidays, we flew back home, bleary eyed and the following Sunday morning we were hankering for something.... something salty, greasy, and absolutely delicious. 

My wife turns to me in bed and says, "baby, I want a big ass burger."

I'm like, "that's why I married you, bitch."

I did unspeakable things to her afterwards, but the craving never went away. The thing about Uncle Boy's is that it's almost ALWAYS open when you need your fix. Screw the In 'N Out nonsense, and the rest of those chains. 

We called Uncle Boy's a second past 10:30am and they were ready to rock.

Two burgers - a Hot Mess and the Jefe. I got mine with extra meat because 'Murica.

We supplemented this with well done fries, jalapeno poppers, cheese sticks.

Boom. 

Five years off of your life, but it was an amazing way to ring in the New Year.
author: Byron E.

description: Little hole in the wall gem. Burgers are super yummy and onion rings melted in my mouth. So glad I found a good burger spot in the neighborhood.
author: Jessie A.

description: Hands down the best burger spot! The place is super small so don't expect to always get a seat; luckily golden gate park is just around the corner! Take your food to go and sit at the park by the roller skaters; it's beautiful!
author: Deena R.

description: Everything is fine so long as you don't come in 20 minutes after opening or before closing. Despite all the changes lately with the place they still love to open late and close early. This is unfortunate when you want a burger after getting your loose on at O'Keeffe's. I get that getting a customer 5-10 minutes before close sucks. But shutting down 20-30 minutes early sucks for the locals.
author: Houston H.

description:
I have too many great late night memories involving walking to uncle boys and for that you deserve your 5 stars! 
Am I right guys? 

This is the place you take your friends looking for an authentic burger spot in the city without all that snooty bullshit. 

I still stick by my previous review about the food, it's excellent!! I love my food gluttonous and you get that here with all the fried goodies on a lot of the burgers. 
mmM Bacon and fried zucchini chips!
author: Jerry S.

description:
Friggin legit burgers. Got the cowboy, added jalapeños, bursting with flavor. And can't possibly go wrong with fried zucchini, right? One of my favorites. One of my favorite burger places in the city (the other is thirsty bear, which also has great beer). 

There isn't much room inside, so don't expect to sit down in peak hours. It's a cute little place in the middle of a neighborhood. Open decently late too which is a major plus. 

Only downside is the pricing. It's not unreasonable, but these burgers ain't cheap either. 12 for a combo...I guess that isn't so bad. I've been spoiled by how cheap some of the Asian food in the area is.
author: Chris S.

description:
This little hold in the wall joint has some AMAZING burgers.  I think that this is one of the best burgers that I have had.  I got the hot mess, and what makes it is their sauce.  It has a vinegary/spicy kick, kind of like a Louisiana hot sauce but this has way more flavor.  I misunderstood the 'hot mess' part and expected a messy burger, but it is actually a very well constructed burger and holds up nicely - every bite is unique, but carries the theme...  The jalapenos are a nice addition, but I think it should be called HOT mess or something.  Still a very good burger.  Sadly, I cannot taste what I call the "meat/cheese combo".  You know that cheesy meat flavor that reminisces a burger mac or a hamburger helper.   5/5

The fries are eh.  Salted and peppered.  2.5/5

Overall I paid 11.52 for a burger, fries, and a can of soda.  I'd come back for the burger alone.
author: Anthony N.

description: I had Uncle Boy's delivered on DoorDash last week and it was so incredible!! I had the Hip-Popper Burger combo and it was soo good. The burger was stuffed with jalepeno poppers and came with fries and a drink. The burger was a nice size and totally satisfied my craving. Loved it!
author: Noreen C.

description:
Awesome burgers the hot poppin was deli
delicious. The seating was bad no room to sit but great for take out. Service was quick
author: Amanda A.

description:
Uncle Boys is a solid burger operation serving the Richmond district. Prices are moderate; food and service is great. 

Depending on the time of day, orders take around 10-15 minutes. They accept credit and debit if you order for pickup through the Yelp app, meaning you can walk in and walk right out if you want. Just order ahead en route. 

The Cowboy burger is my go-to. Highly recommend for those who've never been to UB before. The mozzarella sticks are wonderful, as are the fries.
author: James E.

description:
Generous portions for the price you pay and quick service. I had an excellent avocado burger and my uncle had the bacon burger that has more ingredients than can fit in one bite. Solid taste and solid experience. 

However, is it the best burger joint? No. Will you find Filipino flare as the name of the establishment suggestions? Just the PacMan photo at the register. Will I ever order this food because I'm craving a burger? Probably not. But, I was super full and the taste was good enough so that I was satisfied.
author: Christi D.

description:
Tried this place out for the first time. Very small and tight to move around. Enjoyed Uncle Boy's Pool Boy burger had a nice spice to it after each bite. No brews available; hopefully that could change in the future; burger and beers! TV on the wall for games and such; good plus!

Will definitely return to try their other selections.
author: Billy C.

description:
Damn good burgers, they don't serve alcohol.

Skip their fancy burgers; the "OG" ("original gangsta", their plain burger) is outstanding.  Why hide the flavor of a great burger with a bunch of fancy toppings?

They don't serve alcohol.  Did I mention they don't have alcohol?  That's the only thing that's missing here.
author: D D.

description:
My husband and I got the Cowboy Burger with fries. We're always searching for a great burger for a good price. Half the time, we don't need the full restaurant experience that jacks up the price. 

The only reason I didn't do 5 stars is I think the cook got overwhelmed and was messing up on the customization on a lot of the orders. I think it took us about 25 minutes to get our order.

We will be back when we're on this side of town.
author: Marie L.

description: Tastes good, definitely worth a go. Although it surely does not rank in my top 20 burger joints
author: Marc A.

description:
Today marked the 5th time I've eaten from Uncle Boy's.  Figured its time to write a review.  Always juicy burgers, always well-cooked fries (crunchy outside, soft inside.)  We usually get the basic, OG burger with cheese and sometimes bacon.  Today we got the hot mess protein-style and the Nephew.  Both burgers lasted aprrox 2 min.  They were super delish...as usual.

Its a great spot to have close by.  And its awesome that they are open on Sunday right about the time I'm feeling the need for day-after comfort.  Three burgers, 2 fries, $31.  A little on the high side but its the price to pay for good quality, fast & friendly service.
author: Pete M.

description: Their burgers and fries are great but mothing else really stands out. Their zucchini chips taste like oil and bad decisions while their nuggets feel premade and ordered from a grocery store but without the reliable taste. Back to their burgers though, almost every sandwich is a great choice and they have something for everyone. I don't eat beef and Ive found that their chicken sandwiches are so good! Not much for vegetarians or vegans though, sad to say. But the place is nice and small and the food comes out pretry fast!
author: Stephanie R.

description: My boyfriend and I went here when we were starving leaving GG park. It was close and had decent yelp reviews. The place is a tiny hole in the wall so I was hopeful. I ordered the "Hot Mess" burger, which had tons of jalepenos, bacon, cheddar cheese, and "hot mess sauce". My boyfriend ordered the "Italian Stallion" burger which came with jack cheese, mozzarella sticks, and marinara sauce. We also got onion rings and french fries. We've both had a lot of burgers but this place is definitely in our top five favorite places. Both burgers were so good we finished them entirely (they were huge too!). The mozzarella sticks were amazing on the burger and mine was so good with all the spicy jalepenos. The onion rings were probably the best I've had in a really long time. The food was all super good and I cannot wait to go back.
author: Shayne G.

description:
I wouldn't say my burger or fries wasn't good, but they certainly didn't live up to the lore of Uncle Boy's. 

I also HIGHLY recommend placing your order by phone and not ordering in person. The grill is small and their volume is high. My partner and I waited 30 minutes for our takeout. 

We were, however, treated to some high quality bickering between the cook and the cashier.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
On our way to UB's, the Missus bumped into a motorcycling friend of hers. We mentioned our plans and he was kind enough to warn us that UB's was under new ownership, and that it would essentially be a crap-shoot regarding our experience.

We were pretty set on eating burgers/fries/whatnot, so we thought we would take our chances. Hindsight is a bitch, ain't it?

As we stepped inside, we noticed it was pretty packed for being 45 minutes from closing. There was only one dude manning the place and he was backed up with about 3-4 orders. A few hungry patrons were waiting and they didn't look too happy.

It took about 15 minutes for us to be acknowledged, which eventually led to us placing our orders. I wanted a chicken sandwich, but they were out of chicken. So, instead of doubling up on beef burgers, we just got one and split it.

On top of them being out of chicken, they were also out of carbonation in their soda fountain, out of napkins, and out of ketchup. Surprisingly, I was not out of patience just yet. 

By the time we got our food, we were the only people left. The hot mess was actually a really good burger, but $11 for a burger combo is crazy considering the blase bun and Sysco bagged french fries. The lack of service also kinda ruined the experience. 

Some chap came in after closing and wanted a burger. His tardiness was rewarded with a free order of fries. Meanwhile, we didn't get chicken, soda, napkins, ketchup, and had to wait 25 minutes for an order. Where the heck is our reward? Makes perfect sense in the world of Uncle Boy's, I guess. 

I'd rather go to Super Duper and pay roughly the same amount, get napkins, ketchup, soda, great service, AND FREE PICKLES. 


To the Owner: You seriously need to have more than one person in this operation. You can't have the cook handle money and go back to cooking. That's not sanitary. You can't expect him/her to replenish everything while preparing food. Honestly, if you can't afford to have 2 people on the clock at the same time, maybe you shouldn't be in the restaurant business. Try the mortuary business, where the customers can't complain because they're dead.
author: Aren A.

description:
* Please note that this review is for a delivery order - I have not dinned at Uncle Boy's

You know how when you are craving something and no other item will satisfy that craving. Those were my exact feelings around cheeseburgers on Sunday night when I stumbled upon Uncle Boy's on the Eat 24 app. Uncle Boys' was highly recommended on the app and the user pictures looked mouth watering! I proceeded to place my delivery order for what I expected to be a 5-star cheeseburger experience. 

Given my need for meat and cheese, I went all out and ordered a Hip-popper, medium rare, with bacon. When the small, sad over-cooked and cold burger that had a half piece of bacon arrived at my doorstep I was truly at a loss. They must have gotten it wrong. Did I mistakenly order from the wrong place? Where was my mouth-watering burger that all the reviews spoke of? It was absolutely devastating. I was stuck eating a cold, soggy, dry burger that I had to drown in ketchup and ranch to mask the disaster of a burger that Uncle Boy's tried to pass off as a succulent Angus Beef burger. Coupled with the cold, soggy sides my experience with Uncle Boy's was a complete disappointment that left me hangrier than I was before I ordered. 

I do not recommend ordering delivery from this place - if you are feeling lucky you might try the food in person, I personally won't be making a trip to this restaurant.
author: Elisa P.

description: A-Ok- burgers, hot links, chicken fingers and the such.  Nothing fancy, everything as expected, fine quality and taste and reasonable prices.  Not a 'destination spot' but a nice place for a quick grilled or fried meal when in the neighborhood.  I'll probably return sooner or later.
author: Andy S.

description:
I was excited to try this place after reading reviews but was unexpectedly disappointed. 
In the end, they showed good customer service in response to our disappointment, but I still wouldn't eat here again.

1. I specifically called this place to order delivery as advertised on yelp. They said they don't deliver. 

2. We were told to pickup in 30 minutes. We arrived 45 minutes later thinking our burger would be ready. They hadn't even started so we waited 20 more minutes.

3. They burnt the Garden burger my friend ordered. The Cowboy burger was pretty good, but had very little of the sauce, making the burger dry. The meat itself was yummy but the whole burger wasn't anything amazing.

4. Our mozzarella sticks were cold.

In the end, when we brought the concern of the 1 hour wait to their attention, they only charged us $8 for 2 burgers and mozzarella sticks. They were also very apologetic. This was good customer service. Good luck, Uncle Boys!
author: Neil T.

description: $8.50 bacon cheeseburgers or about $10.50 combo ( including tax) w/ fries and drink. Don't miss the free drink check-in. Been here several times and never disappoints. Solid 1/4 lb. burger on a quality bun. Made to order with very good bacon. Basic atmosphere with limited seating. A little pricey but its amongst the best in SFO.
author: Scott S.

description:
What makes Uncle Boy's so special? Let's start with the name: Uncle Boy's. A Filipino slang term for a close family friend, Uncle Boy's tastes pretty much like a burger you'd get at a great family barbecue, instead of a giant gourmet burger or a frozen patty. 

Then there's the 49ers memorabilia, and the crowds that gather to watch Giants games, Judge Judy, Cold Case, or whatever the staff decides to put on the teev. 

If it's not a TV night, the cook might be singing along to sweet jams on an Earth, Wind and Fire Pandora station. 

Solid burgers, interesting non burger options (chicken burgers, hot links, veggie patties), combo possibilities. Totally solid inner Richmond grub, no frills, always funktified.
author: just-t H.

description: It's disappointing when a business doesn't respects his schedule, after walking for 20 minutes (closed 1:30 hrs earlier). Will never come back! Not a serious business!
author: Ivan T.

description:
I had last ordered a burger and fries from UBs several months ago. The burgers were always tasty and they did a good job of cooking them to order. The fries were average; previously frozen etc.

I had a taste for a cheeseburger today and UBs came to mind. Their 6oz burgers would provide just the right amount of meat I expected. I decided to peruse the menu even though I knew what I wanted.

The menu was the same except that, in the burger description, the 6 (oz) was crossed out and replaced by the number 4. The prices were the same. Also where there usually at least a few patrons, now there were none. I decided not to order. Instead I took a carry out menu and exited the building. If they decide to go back to their 6oz burger, I may reconsider.
author: Jeff W.

description: Good fries! Good service, but the place it's too tiny and the burger itself needs improvement.
author: Snail S.

description: The service was great, but unfortunately the food wasn't very good.  Burger was bulky and flavorless, fries a bit too salty.  If you're looking for lunch, there are a ton of other options in the area.
author: Dela P.

description:
Suuuuuuuuper good burger. I got the Cowboy and I was quite impressed. This is a nice little mom and pap shop with a cool feel. I was happy with the service and how delicious the burger was of course :). 

Thanks!
author: Spencer L.

description: Got a veggie burger with onion rings delivered, $24 with tip.  Bun was stale and special sauce tasted like burnt paper.  Onion rings were cold and whole meal was worth about $8 at most.  I could name 6 veggie burgers in the Richmond district that are way better and cheaper (2 within a block from me).  Two positive things:  the delivery guy was very nice and the pictures of the meat burgers looked good.
author: Jared J.

description: What a great place! It's a small restaurant so I would order togo if you have more than 5 in your group. What the place lacks in since makes up for in taste. I've been here a few times now and I've enjoyed the staff/owner and the food has been consistent. It's a place to grab a solid burger, fries, cheese sticks, and or onion rings. The have more options than that but that's all I've order up to this point. I do plan on getting a chciken standwihc too.. that will be my next visit.
author: Kyle G.

description: Great burger spot in a very unassuming space.  I got the Unhorsed Cowboy and my wife and I decided to eat our burgers in our car before heading home.  This is not something we normally do but it was so good and needed to be eaten right away. I'm glad we did as we got our burgers hot off the grill and they were delicious.
author: Blake B.

description:
Uhhhh holy buckets. 

Be warned: This review was for a veggie burger.  Don't judge me; shit was delicious. 

I actually had Postmates bring me food, because lazies. Food delivery is always a gamble with anything that may offer a race against the sogginess clock. However, I basically devoured this burger in 4 bites. (Super graceful image, I know.)

I got the Ain't No Punk which comes with a flame broiled garden patty, cheese, fried zucchini, chipotle sauce and the other usual produce suspects. I also added grilled onions because why wouldn't you add grilled onions. 

For the most part, gotta say this thing, along with the onion rings, held up on its delivery trek. Although, towards the end of me trying to take this burger down, the chipotle sauce stared eating through the bread. Oh and the fried zucchini chips, while amazing in theory, also lost their race against soggy time. 

For anyone complaining about the small portions of onion rings - HOW MUCH FOOD DO YOU NEED? I couldn't even look at those things after slamming down a burger. I may not be a growing college freshman but I can eat some fewds. I applaud you, Uncle Boy's. For at least taking a non-gluttonous stand on one of your menu items.
author: Kelsey G.

description:
We found this place on Yelp, trying to eat next to the park. 
The best place we could stumble upon, hands down. 
Little and cozy, nothing more than we needed. 
Excellent food, 5 star worthy for me, plus Pedro the cook offered himself to remake one of the sandwiches when we didn't like one of the sauces.
If you can, try the mozzarella sticks.
author: Santi G.

description: I would not come back. I ordered the cowboy burger for about $9. Not worth the cost or calories. I had burnt bacon and wish it came with more onion rings and sauce. There was a lot of bread not a lot of meat. Not what I expected. I do not recommend since there are better places in the area.
author: Lauren R.

description: Good burger spot by my alma mater. Have been here plenty of times and always am satisfied with the service and quality of the food. The menu is not to large but it also doesn't need to be for what it markets itself as, they have about 7-8 burger options that vary by a bit. I usually go with the pool boy, great spicy chipotle sauce that compliments the bacon and meat on the burger well. The burgers are made medium well so if you like them more rare make sure to let the cook know. The burger with fries comes out to about $10.50 which is a good price for the meal. You will leave this place full and satisfied with your experience, I recommend it for a lunch stop.
author: Josue V.

description:
Burgers are great. Chicken tenders are also good.
The place is very small and not intended for sitting.  Probably just to order take away
author: Johnny W.

description:
This place is super small but boy does it have yummy burgers. My BF and I came across this place while visiting relatives. I got the chicken burger with jalapeño poppers, it was pretty darn amazing and the BF got the hot mess. Both claimed to be spicy but ours were not spicy at all but that didn't bother us we enjoyed every bit of it. 

Also, we ordered one burger as a meal and the other alone. We shared our drink and fries and it was more than enough to feed both of us and have left overs. Cash Only! They do have an ATM inside but to avoid fees just bring cash.
author: Adriana G.

description: Well priced, great burgers with amazing options as sides. Took me about a half hour to decide which burger I wanted because they all sounded amazing (kept it safe with the Hot Mess). Ended up ordering two sides because I couldn't pick between the mozza sticks and the zucchini chips. Both were bomb. Would definitely come again to try out those rings!
author: Moe A.

description:
There aren't a lot of burger joints that are decent in the Richmond. I can think of two places, not the best but simply reliably good. There are better burgers in the city by far. But I'm into mom n pops type joints, and this fits the profile well
In the Richmond. Quintessential Richmond type food. No thrill no fuss, a counter to eat on and off the grid.
author: Elton F.

description: What the F**CK Uncle Boy!!!!! How are you so f'ing good and SO cheap?! I've lived on the same block as you for 4 months and just now discovered your beautiful, delicious menu. My roommate and I rolled in tonight with red eyes and full hearts and you certainly did not disappoint. I would like to give a special thank you to your kind cashier who so graciously walked me through every item on your menu, even offering me samples! We ended up ordering the jalapeño popper stuff burgers (combo, of course) and it was insanely good. 5 stars for dank eats, 5 stars for a staff with a beautiful soul and 5 stars for some chill ass vibes. Keep it 100, Uncle Boy
author: Allison D.

description: This place is a super small joint with only one person working... I tried the Pool boy burger and it had a hint of spice. The burger wasn't too bad, but it wasn't the best either. It was extremely dry. My friends order one of the chicken burgers and that was okay too... the only one we really liked was the one stuffed with mozzarella! Tasted like biting into a pizza. As for the fries, they come in very small portions. The regular fries were disappointing, but I would highly recommend the onion rings.
author: Michelle H.

description:
I get the chicken Bella which is absolutely scrumptious. The chicken breast is quality chicken. And the condiments compliment the burger well. The best part are the mozzarella sticks in the burger. 

Lastly, the chipotle sauce is delicious and varies each time you go there. Overall the staff is friendly as well. It's my favorite burger spot in San Fran.
author: Becky W.

description: Best burger for price, fountain drinks, kick ass service. Only thing this place needs is more  employees and a bigger store. Totally worth a 20 min bus ride.
author: Michael L.

description: Something has definitely changed at uncle boy's. For a quick neighborhood burger, this place was a great spot. But tonight, I ordered the "main chick", supposedly a 4 oz flame grilled chicken breast, and I ordered it without the bun. When I got home I was shocked at the size of the protein. I put it on a food scale...1.6 oz.  Not a typo!! 1.6 oz. Sad to say it, but this is one neighborhood joint we'll be skipping in the future.
author: Carissa M.

description: This place was amazing, like Ikes of the burger world. Me and my lady had a fantastic meal at a reasonable price! The el jefe burger has a chipotle aioli that will rock your socks off and the fries are seasoned really well. We will for sure be coming back!!!
author: Nick D.

description: The Chicken wings I ordered on 17th of July through UberEats were dry and chewy. There was no sauce at all.They could've been a bit spicier as I ordered the spicy option. I won't order them again...
author: Murali C.

description:
I randomly yelped a burger spot and this is what I stumbled upon. I got the Cowboy burger and it is by far the best burger I've ever had haha. Definitely coming back soon.

Friendly staff too!
author: Ron D.

description: Awesome people and fantastic food.  The burgers here could possibly be my favorite in the city.  Also, every time I come in, Seinfeld is on, which is a great bonus.
author: Steven D.

description: While I really enjoyed the food and taste, the quality of putting together the delivery order was lacking.  My order was missing items and no condiments or napkins.  The chicken sandwiches were great, just would of been nice if everyone got their food.  Disappointing in the end when everyone doesn't get their food from delivery.
author: Chad R.

description:
They seemed to have worked out their issues with their open hours. 

Great burger for the price and perfect for takeout when you're just not feeling up to cooking after work.  Fries are surprisingly good.
author: Dana S.

description: Their buns leave a lot to be desired. They are dry and completely affect the deliciousness of the rest of the burger.
author: Kristina P.

description:
As I was being handed my Cowboy burger, the chef told me "I might be wrong, but I think I make magic."  Um, Yeah You Do!  That might have been the most amazing burger I've had in the city.  I'm terrified because this place is 5 blocks from my house and I fear that I'll be eating every meal here.  Seriously.  I had a dream about the burger.

Can't speak to the rest of the cuisine; I opted to go with just the burger.  It was more than enough (this was a post surfing meal and I'd only had brunch prior to getting in the water so...)


You guys are the gods of burgers.  Keep it up!
author: Andi Y.

description: This place is solid. We had the OG burgers and fries, and the burgers were fine-- not great quality meat, but a decent burger. The fries were ok, very crispy, but perhaps tasted a little bit like old deep fryer oil.  The service was fast and friendly, and the place seemed clean. I give it two stars because I think it's overrated. Belly Burger down on Geary is much better! Strange to me that this place has a four star rating on Yelp. Also, be advised that there is essentially no seating. You order at the counter, there are a couple of stools and a bar along the window, and two tables outside, weather permitting, but this is a take-out place.
author: Heather G.

description: Ordered the Garden Burger with fries and the Ain't No Punk. Fries were underwhelming, as were the burners. Same generic veggie patty in each, the latter with ok-but-flavorless fried zucchini slices. They were both pretty dry. The bottom of the buns were weirdly dense.
author: Grant P.

description:
I can always rely on Uncle Boy's to be open when I'm craving a huge gourmet burger and don't want to travel far. A true locals burger joint, their prices are moderate and the guys who work there are always accommodating and friendly. 

I love The Pool Boy: perfect amount of spice and super juicy (I see where they got the name haha).
author: Fawn M.

description: First time here really great pesto on my perfectly cooked chicken which I had as a lettuce wrap.
author: John T.

description: I will never be coming here again. Terrible customer serve. My partner and I ordered burgers with grilled onions and fries. They basically threw my burger at me in a tray a few minutes after ordering (the burger was probably precooked) and said it would be another few minutes for the  onions and another 5 minutes for the fries. When I order dinner I don't expect my order to come to me in increments like this. The people behind the counter spent our entire visit yelling and swearing at each other. I also noticed them being very rude to other customers and treating everyone like they were an inconvenience. I would recommend taking your money somewhere else.
author: Natalie J.

description: The veggie burger was bomb! Great for a greasy fix.
author: Jenn F.

description: After finishing up an afternoon hike to the sutro baths my friends and I we're all craving burgers and Uncle Boy's came up on the search. I was super glad we chose this place, the burgers, mozzarella sticks and jalapeno poppers were all amazing and the chef was super friendly, will go again!
author: Thomas A.

description: Best $8 burger I've had. Good quality meat and vegetables. Nice sauces.
author: Robert S.

description:
Thus place is really average. Nothing too crazy, nothing to special. They make your burgers right there. And it is pretty good sized.

Can't really argue this place being more than 3 stars. It's a good place if you want a good burger for not Roam Artisan Burger prices.
author: Justin L.

description: Fast food pick-up place in the neighborhood for days when you are craving for burgers, fries, jalapeno poppers and all that good stuff. Reasonably priced and quick service.
author: Nitish S.

description:
College students know a good neighborhood burger joint when we see one - and this is it. No frills, not fancy. But it hits the spot. Every. Time.

It looks really sketchy on the outside, but just try it. You won't regret it.

Every burger I've tried is good - though I'm usually just a classic girl and get the OG. Also, who doesn't love mozzarella sticks?

Though if you're listening, Uncle Boys, I wish you weren't so expensive! Even without the drink and fries...

But I'll return... I'll always return...
author: Laura C.

description:
I've eaten my fair share of burgers in the city to be able to enjoy a good burger. & boy, this one was good. 

I love that the menu has a variety of different ingredients that they put in their burger. It goes beyond just your typical patty, cheese, and bun. The employees there are so courteous and nice when taking your order, I love it. 

I ordered the Mama Mia and, ugh, I did not expect the mozzarella sticks to taste so good in it. Their marinara sauce topped it. It was a bit messy but my logic is, if your burger isn't somewhat dripping, then it isn't a good burger! The fries were perfectly seasoned, which is just as important as the juiciness of the burger.

Also, if you check in on Yelp, you get a free drink!
author: Cathy N.

description: I'd have to say, this burger place was delicious. Ordered the hot mess burger changed the hot mess sauce to mayo and mustard. (Not a fan of hot sauce on a burger). Fries where a perfect crisp seasoned well, burger was juicy delicious and cooked to order w/ a drink. Decently affordable and good eatin' I would suggest going here And would definitely go again.
author: Bryan P.

description: Amazing food and service!  I ordered the main chick and the OG with cheddar cheese.  We couldn't decide on the sides so we ordered fries, zucchini chips and onion rings. All were delicious! Seating is limited so be prepared to stand for a bit-well worth it though! The staff were super friendly and sweet. I'll be back for sure!
author: Michelle A.

description:
When I'm in the mood for that great burger... The kind that is juicy, calorie dense, makes my mouth water, I go to uncle boys .

Food: Cowboy burger hands down. Get it with extra bbq ranch for the fries.
author: Benny L.

description: Seriously this place has some of the best burgers in the city , if close by give em a try they're awesome !
author: Joseph F.

description:
Service: 
although most restaurants have all their basic extra fixings easily accessible (like on the table....), 2 thumbs up to the only guy working today who was patient enough to deal with my need for having ALL condiments with my meal. mayo please. pepper please. 

food came really quick too. thank goodness.. because i was starving!!!!

Taste: 
GOOOD.. especially for the price.. still on the quest for the BEST BURGER in SF.. but Uncle Boy's def hits the spot... great for a hole in the wall, greasy spoon, burger joint.. my girlfriend and i both ordered the HOT MESS.. because it was just fitting to our not so happy positive moods today.

the patty was at your average thickness, not salty at all... and complete with bacon, jalapenos, spicy hot sauce, grilled onions, cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, on a grilled bun. it mosdef satisfied my "must eat my feelings in a burger" craving... we both ordered the meal.. which came with fries and a drink.. the fries.. YES. thick and crunchy, seasoned with salt and pepper.. and they didn't get soft or mushy for the duration of our meal. $10.99 plus my $2tip... for a combo meal?? this makes me a FAN.

Atmosphere. mosdef a hole in the wall joint.. not close to godliness when it comes to cleanliness.. but perfect for a casual psuedo/tinder/date or quick lunch with a friend. there's only about 3 tables which seat 2.. and then the barstools which face outside the store, which i believe seat 2-3..

Return?
Yes i would mosdef come back.. and try the pool boy... ;)
author: Lisa Marie N.

description: Another dirty hole in the wall with great food! Most customers got theirs to go. Not me... The Cuban music was a great accompaniment to my onion rings and burger as was the one guy working. He was super nice, pretty funny and running around like crazy.
author: El B.

description: Not much else going on in this neighborhood...but this tasty burger joint is an oasis.  Big messy, delicious burgers and fries.  Not too spendy - a huge burger, fries and a drink under $10.  Street parking is so so.  No real room for eat-in.  A yummy, no frills, burger hole-in-the-wall.  Worth a stop if you are in the area.
author: Ken P.

description:
OMG so delicious. The only reason I'm subtracting a star is because once I went and wanted zucchini chips and they were out and another time I went and they were closed to fix something for an unknown amount of time...but with that being said...

This is one of my favorite places for a burger in the city. I always get the one with bacon and ranch on it (I think the pool boy?). 

I love that this place isn't trying to be kitchy or hip...it's a burger joint and that's all. YUM!
author: Maggie F.

description: I love the OG burger. They are very accomodating when it comes to what you want on your burger. My whole family of 12 came in and we took up all the tables. Such a friendly, and great customer service. The next time we are in town, we hope to come here again.
author: Lainie P.

description:
5 stars for the service.  3 stars for location.  2 stars for the food.

Came here on a Wednesday lunch.  Parking on the street was easy to find.  Service was fast and friendly.  For a two people team, the cook and the cashier managed to greet everybody and inquire after all their customers.

Small place, but quaint. 

Food:  Maybe it's a fluke, but my burger was burnt!  Bacon was crisp black.  Meet was charred black in places that tasted bitter where it was burnt.  Had it been less burnt, I'm sure the burger would have tasted great.

fries.  I don't like chunky fries.  But that's a preference and not counted as part of the review.  However, the oil that was used to fry the fries in give the fries an after taste of ..something other than fried potatoes.  

I don't write off a place based on a one time experience.  I will give this place another try and update my review accordingly.
author: Xuan N.

description: The burgers are HUGE and very filling :) It's a good place to go if you're starving for some unhealthy comfort food and don't care about the ambience
author: Alene R.

description:
Very very good! I ordered the "Hot Mess" burger and it was amazing. The only down side was that it was kind of hard to eat because it got soggy. Other than that, everything was A1. Prices were okay, you'll spend about $10 for a meal or about $7 for just the burger. The menu consisted of much more than just burgers; they also offer finger foods, hotdogs, etc. 

I guarantee you that you won't regret eating here
author: Joshua G.

description: Our son Julian says, "We live so close to uncle boys it is our to-go place anytime we can. I think they have the best burgers and I love the fries and they have nice burgers. The people who work there are super nice and are not mean in any way. I recommend the cowboy burger cause its just so delicious".
author: Dean L.

description:
The is a small but delicious neighborhood gem. Love the variety of the burger's they have. My favorite is the Hot mess, a  perfection of spice and delicious bacon. 

Bonus for this place is you can do any of their burgers a veggie burger for those of you what have a vegetarian friend  as I do. By far one of the best tasting veggie burger I have tasted. I usually don't like them but this place knows how to make them taste wonderful. My fave is the Hip popper  as a veggie burger. 

If you are in the Richmond this is a stop you have to make.
author: Sheharyar S.

description:
Friendly, fast service with an impeccable burger that is definitely a bang for your buck! I had the pool boy combo because I'm a bacon lover and their bacon is also nicely crisp and they give you a great hearty amount in the burger!

The fries are so well seasoned and perfectly crisp. 

I definitely will be back and try the hotlinks!
author: Melissa V.

description: I was thrilled when we discovered Uncle Boy's after moving into the neighborhood. The burgers were tasty and what I would expect to pay for a burger of that caliber. Recently they decreased the amount of meat from 5oz to 4oz and the prices have stayed the same. We get it...SF is expensive. What I don't understand is why this now tiny piece of beef sits on bread that is about 4 times thicker than the meat. I was appalled when this first happened but chopped it up to a fluke as I was informed by employees that buns are sourced from different locations. This is however the 2nd time this has happened since this downsize in meat. Is the increase in bread supposed to distract us from the fact that there is clearly less meat in this burger?! Quite simply put, the most unsatisfying burger I have ever had. Unless you're on a bread diet, please don't bother going to Uncle Boy's....I know I won't.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Ordered delivery via Eat24. Even paid a $5 delivery fee.

After an hour they call me and claim they don't deliver food. One of the rudest encounters I've had in quite awhile.
author: Tyler C.

description:
The hot mes was Hot. And if you're careful, not too much of a mess. WHich is good, since you don't want to waste a smidgen of this most excellent burger.

 I'm late on this review, just saw that a couple folks said it was closed? Heavens to Mergatroid!
author: Art H.

description:
support your local mom n pop shops! This place was a little hole in the wall joint, they had only one person manning the whole joint (yes; cooking, ordering both on the phone and in person, and payment). 

normally, I get really irritated when I see this, as I know there must be a sanitation hazard that is bound to happen as the one man show gets flustered once theyre a little busy. But this guy handled it pretty well. I was impressed with his multitasking skills, (although my bacon cheeseburger took a little longer than I'd hoped.) My burger and fries came out reallly good! My only gripe was that it was about $8. But, again, I guess a couple extra bucks to keep our local businesses afloat isnt that bad. especially when mcDs is about that price these days... what a shame...

I will say; that I really hope that they start to deliver more often; (if they deliver at all) since I am in the neighborhood and would love to be able to order a burger to my door. ^_^
author: Lisa N.

description:
Gem in inner richmond that CLOSES at 3AM! That's right folks, after a night of drinking, clubbing, or just being up in the middle of the night, if you have a craving for a legit burger (not McDs or BK) with awesome zucchini sticks then this is the place to be.

Prices are reasonable for the quality of the burger. Nice and juicy and hits the spot. Fries are great and my favorite is the zucchini sticks. You can really taste the zucchini. They also have spicy chicken wings and yummy fries.

I've been here a couple of times after late night partying but I also find myself coming here whenever i crave a burger. They also have a bunch of other items which I can't wait to try whenever i feel like drowing myself in greasy self-loathing but oh so good food!

Only 4 stars because the space is tiny and when it's busy it's hard to get seating so a lot of times it's take and go. Wish it was bigger.
author: Linda L.

description: Bomb diggity! It's a classic hole in the wall burger joint that exceeds any expectations.  The food here was freaking delicious.
