I ordered the cowboy. it had crispy thick cut bacon, a juicy patty, tangy bbq sauce, and that sesame bun tho. My girl friend had the vegan veggie burger. She loved it. It had the right amount of kick in the Chipotle sauce and the Patty was delicious.   I also tried the mozzarella sticks and fried zucchini- that shit was hurting for a squirting XD. To top that all off the single staff Mora was a great  cook & host. He was quick and overall great. He greeted every customer that came in and was friendly.  Definitely coming here when I'm hungry or got the munchies.  Cheers!
author: Eleazar P.

description:
Overall verdict: burgers are solid, and the service is bomb!

Burgers are quite good. The SO got the Mama Mia and enjoyed getting to eat an appetizer portion of mozza sticks in his burger. I got the Hot Mess and enjoyed all of it. We shared hot crispy fries to make it a nice balanced meal.

The place was packed when I went at 3 pm on a Saturday. The staff was super nice and apologetic about our slight wait and made sure we were happy with our food. Only downside is that this place serves Pepsi products (whhyyyyy?!?!)
author: Han Z.

description: Pretty cool hole in the wall place! Great food too. I ordered the pool boy which had the best crispy bacon i've had in a while. The fries were really good to and the chef is pretty cool. Anytime I'm near Uncle Boy's I try to stop by for a burger. The pool boy is my favorite followed by the cowboy and then the nephew. The cook is really awesome, he gave me fries on the house one time and likes talking to customers. Their onion rings are hella good and the dipping sauces, pesto, bbq ranch, hot sauce, make the food better too.
author: Dan G.

description: Burgers are pretty good.  We took it to go and paid extra for cheese and bacon, but when we got home surprise no bacon or cheese
author: Jen J.

description: This place deserves 5 stars and then some! The hamburgers were perfection, and the fries were delicious! We also had the jalapeño poppers (yes, we run to eat!), and they were delicious as well--no yucky frozen, stale taste. Honestly, one of the best burgers we've had anywhere in the country but only a block and a half away from home--very dangerous! The staff was polite, friendly, and gracious--very nice guys! Plus, the owner is a 49ers fan
author: Carey C.

description: El Jefe burger was GREAT! Place is small and only street parking available.Service is not their forte so I will not go out of my way to return.
author: Lucy R.

description: An outstanding burger in a semi-divey, tiny little place run by a couple of regular dudes. Can't wait to go back for another meal. Highly recommended for a great inexpensive unique burger.
author: Tino N.

description:
As for the burger itself, very delicious, juicy, homemade tasting burgers. Handmade beef patties grilled to perfection on a sesame seed bun. Toasting the bun is definitely a good idea for the business. 
Lots of wonderful different options, including jalapeño poppers and zucchini fries! Onion rings and French fries as well of course:) overall a very satisfying meal. 
Groups are ok but prepare to be crowded. The place is pretty tiny but the food makes up for it ;)
author: Kristina N.

description: Came here because of the 4 star reviews. Got there with no one in line and ordered our meal then ended up waiting about an hour for 2 OG burgers with one Fries. What the heck?! Not to mention that in that hour about 5 people showed up with "pickup orders" ordered via phone or online and clearly their orders had not been started. They all got their orders before we did. Do they not know to check their online orders?! The customer service is terrible enough to never come back.
author: Amanda L.

description: Burgers are legit here.  Packed with flavor.  Wish I knew about this place sooner.  It's more of a pickup place rather than sit down.  Not too much seating but the burgers are outstanding. You can't go wrong with anyone of them.  Probably one of the few places I'm willing to pay $10 + for a burger.
author: Sharon C.

description:
Have been looking for a great, melt in your mouth, juicy burger since moving to San Francisco. This is not it. 
It's not a terrible hamburger but it's definitely not the best either.
author: Rachel E.

description: I'd use words to describe how tasty these burgers are, but all I can come up with are the sounds of someone getting their grub on. Love the O.G.!
author: Aida N.

description: Uncle Boy's is hands down my favorite burger spot in the city! I always go for the OG burger with cheddar cheese - which is your basic burger that comes with lettuce, tomatoes, onion, ketchup, mayo, mustard - and it never lets me down. Totally hits the spot. The buns are delicious and come from a local baker. The place is a bit small, so I usually take my order to go and walk over to golden gate park which is about 2 blocks away and find a nice little spot to eat there.
author: Kristina O.

description:
This place is the bomb, been here about 5 times and every time I go it is delicious. I normally get the Pool Boy which is super good and delicious. The Bacon is absolutely perfect. Was feeling more daring last time and order the hot mess. It was absolutely amazing.

Good price too!
author: Naeemah C.

description:
I don't know why I only just started coming here the past several weeks even though I live so close... Anyways!

- Hoorah for staying open so late! Great for me to come to after my 8pm class. 
- Not too expensive, alright for a burger. The meal might be a little too expensive for my tastes.
- I've only gotten the Mama Mia so far and I love it! Can't wait to try other burgers they got.
- It would be cool if they could let customers know how long your order would take. I had a dance thing to go to at 8:30, and I made an order at around 7:45, and waited for an extremely long time because there were so many called orders and I ended up getting it at around 8:25. However, the man working was very nice and told us ours would be coming soon. (After like, 30 minutes, aha!) It's great I have the patience but other customers might not appreciate waiting for so long.
- Hoorah for free water to go with my burger.

Otherwise not much of a complaint.
author: Samantha Y.

description: Great tasting food and cheap prices! However wait time is too long, had to wait over 30 mins for chicken tenders and fries. I would suggest ordering ahead for pick up. Staff are very nice.
author: Rebecca O.

description: Don't order through GrubHub. My food was cold by the time it arrived. I paid extra for onion rings and still received fries.
author: Bradley V.

description: Great food, good service, love the atmosphere. Amazingly good sandwiches and burgers. Good fires as well.
author: John R.

description: As far as the food goes, it is very good. However do not make a delivery order because they they mess your order up, and then ask are you sure said item is missing? Of course it is because its not in the bag. And then they will ask you to come to the restaurant to get the item. Why would I do that for a delivery order, the point is the food comes to you.
author: Jason S.

description: Have you ever seen Dean from "Supernatural" take the most appetizing bite of a burger ever? I've never understood how that felt UNTIL I had the Cowboy burger. When I was finished, I wanted to spit the burger and re-eat it. Yes... Like King Neptune from SpongeBob. It's really easy to drive or walk past this place without noticing it, but I am glad as hell I gave it a shot. I give this place 5 possums of awesomeness.
author: Terrance Z.

description: this place is ligit as burger joints come. The burgers have classy names and the service is all good. The menu doesn't discriminate, they are vegetarian friendly w a one two punch of flavor and colorful veggie options. Zucchini wedges, I'm sold. They are accurate w labeling a large order as well.
author: Isabel P.

description: Jeez, what did you guys DO to my to-go burger last night? I couldn't believe what I was tasting when I got it home. This thing was nothing but MUSTARD -- all I tasted was mustard. Now, a good burger should be a blend of different flavors:  I expect to taste the beef, the tomatoes, pickles, onions, lettuce, and bun, and sure, the mustard (I actually LIKE mustard, which is why I DIDN'T ask them to leave it out). But on this burger, the bun tasted like mustard, the burger tasted like mustard, the tomato slice tasted like mustard, the onion tasted like mustard, and yeah, the mustard definitely tasted like mustard. I've been here a few times in the past, and my burger was actually really good, which is why the 3 stars overall. I'll know better for next time, but holy mustard uncle boy wonder, you went too far this time!
author: Richard A.

description:
Oh BOY, this place is good. SO good.

I stumbled upon this place after a night of shenanigans with friends and we were looking to satisfy our drunk munchies. A burger stuffed with mozzarella cheese sticks sounded like it'd do the trick. And it did. 

The burger is pretty hearty, so I'm not sure it's the best thing to eat at 3am but it's sure damn tasty.

I came back a few days ago to try it again just to make sure it wasn't my blurred drunkness that fooled me but again, it was complete satisfaction. This time I tried the "Dog in Heat" hot link - mmm spicy goodness. 

The only thing is I think $7.25 for a burger/hot link is a little steep. Still, everyone needs to try this place if they're in the area!
author: V L.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever had. It was so tasty, juicy, and flavorful. And cheap. V impressed
author: Bianca P.

description: The food was very tasty. The burgers were juicy and cooked medium well. The fries were well done, and originally the cook gave us dome fries he thought weren't cooked well enough so he made us a fresh batch. The staff was very pleasant and very attentive. Thr cashier even offered to change the music to something we liked, but we didn't mind the music either way. On our way out they thanked us in a very non robotic, genuine, kind of way. This is my second time here and they've been nothing but phenomenal. Definitely  my favorite burger joint in the area.
author: Christopher C.

description: Visiting San Francisco for the first time I'd highly recommend this place. Some of the best burgers and mozzarella sticks in this town. Proportion was great as well.
author: Joshua L.

description:
Uncle Boy's is a tiny, no-frills burger joint...and it was a one-man show when I stopped in for lunch on recommendation. 

I ordered the Hip-Popper (cause I hate myself), and it was a delicious cheeseburger complete with Jalapeno Poppers. And I loved every bite of it, dammit!

Their fries are also seasoned to perfection. Just like the fries I remember eating at  the small, family owned & operated burger joints I grew up with back in Los Angeles. Fried to a good crisp and just the right amount of seasoned salt!

I'm envious of people who are within walking distance of this place. While it's a good thing I'm not, the Haight is seriously hurtin' for a decent burger place, and Uncle Boy's reminded me of all the goodness I'm missing out on.

Do yourself a favor and try Uncle Boy's at least once. Sure, there are plenty of high-end burger joints making a name for themselves in SF, but they ain't got nothing on Uncle Boy's. Just don't let the creepy name deter you.
author: Katie S.

description: I am always surprised by this unassuming spot.  I get their standard OG burger or chicken sandwich.  Both are good.  I don't love their more complex burgers but who cares.  The food is always hearty, fresh tasting, and reasonable.
author: Courtney C.

description:
I'm done with this place. Done. I finally realize that I deserve better than fucked up orders, burnt burgers, and bad service. And my food wasn't anything complicated. Two burgers. One veggie. I even called it in, because I know they can take awhile. when I get there, they tell me that they're out of veggie burgers. Strike one. I order just a grilled cheese. They have no idea what I mean, so I have to tell them how to make one. Strike two. 

An hour goes by and I'm still sitting there. Strike three, four, five. Then when I asked about it, they realized they gave my food to the wrong guy. 

What the fuck. I was fuming, but I still didn't say a thing. They finally gave me my food, threw in fries (which I didn't even want) and gave me a discount. Why am I even still trying?

I get home and all of the food is burnt to a cinder- I couldn't even eat it. I called and chewed them out (which I never do). They we're apologetic and offered to make me another, but I didn't want to wait another hour. 

Get it together, guys.
author: Roman H.

description: I eat here way more often than I should. I really like the cowboy and the dog in heat. When school is in session this place can be overrun by college students, so expect a wait on occasion.
author: Ryan L.

description: Excellent and friendly service great food reasonable $. I highly recommend this place. In the words of Arnold "I'll be back"
author: Darryl D.

description:
I have to offer two stars here. I have NO problem with food. It is well okay. I enjoy 'Nephew Burger' (with pesto sauce) and their prime specialty mama-mia!  (With salca and cheese stick.)

Now that being said, I have to say that in response to one commentary who complained about roof noise at 0100 hours of morning, it is in fact ILLEGAL to do any sort of work that involves noise after 2200 Hrs. - 0600 Hrs.  (That is translated to ten o'clock at night until six the following morning).  There so happens to be ordinance here in City & County of San Francisco #49 'Noise Abatement Ordinance'.  In fact which makes it ILLEGAL to disturb with noise caused vocally, electronically, mechanically, or in any other manner that would cause disturbance to other people between these hour. (I wish this was made more known to general public).

Now my problem with place is that they really need to know how to read clock and to update their website to correct and current business hour.  On site it states that Friday and Saturday they are open 'til 0300.  In actuality they have only recently changed their hour until 2200 (ten at night) -- uh... daily!

Further I have been busy with homework as there are midterm at CCSF following week from when this was written. I wanted dinner. So normally they do take order over phone.  I rang up at 2145 and NO ANSWER!   This is BAD business practise as to not operate until POSTED closing times!  So in my situation as they are now among all other place open until this 'witching hour' no other restaurant are open after 2200 in WHOLE Inner Richmond area near Balboa St.  So I had to go without dinner that night!

San Francisco being major city has been closing up and rolling their pavement up at very early hour (so much early as 1800)!  This 'truck stop' town mentality!  This is major international urban centre!  Ridiculous!

Uncle Boys, if they are to remain in business and gain more customer (other than just many sports nut!) they MUST comply with city code and operate until posted closing time, not fifteen minute early!  I tried to call at 2145 and no answer, that is unacceptable!  Grill should be left on until ten o'clock (or whatever one's posted time for closing is) not one minute early, and certainly not one quarter hour early!  This is why only two star here!  Sorry Uncle Boy, but must do business the correct way!  Respect clock!  Update your website!

Thank you!
author: Tatsuhiro S.

description:
Really good, I will be back. Its a damn fine burger.  

It is however small so you likely will have it to go but its worth the wait. 

Its all good.
author: Justin S.

description:
Great Burgers! The owner, chef, counter staff really take pride in making wonderful burgers!

Even how they wrap the burgers to go -- show you they care about not only how the burgers taste (excellent) but also how they look (beautiful)!

Very cool neighborhood place for casual food!
author: John G.

description: First impressions are hard to shake off and this place did everything right. Simple components done really well. Buns, patty, fries, the bacon. Come here for the nonstandard fixings. Mozzarella sticks, zucchini chips, jalapeño poppers, the list goes on. Docked a star cuz patty was nothing phenomenal. Still a well crafted burger. I got the "Pool Boy" Can't wait to try the rest of the menu. Workers were really friendly and encouraged social media promotion which tells me they like the place enough. EAT HERE NOW!
author: Matt M.

description: Raddest down to earth local burger joint. And killer fries.
author: Kiiya S.

description:
I'm addicted to this place.  Every night I try to talk myself into making something at home, but who can be bothered when they can walk down the street for an amazing veggie burger and fries.   The employees and owner are super nice and accommodating.  Try it, you'll be hooked. 

Yum! Yum! Yum!
author: Cynthia R.

description:
This place was alright...I had their original burger, which also arrived with fries and a drink.  The burger had some decent flavor and was pretty juicy.  I also ordered mozzarella sticks, which were very good and perfect for satisfying that craving for fattening junk food.

I would go back if I lived in the area since the options for this type of food are hit-or-miss and price is great...very cheap!
author: Ken G.

description:
The good thing about Uncle Boy is that they have great, yummy, juicy burgers almost on par with Super Duper which is tops in my book.

The bad thing about Uncle Boy is that they don't ever pick up the phone to take to-go orders so your left double parking and hoping you don't get a ticket while you wait for your food. 

Remedy: get a parking lot or answer your phone every once in a while.
author: Alex A.

description:
This little hole in the wall in the Inner Richmond packs a great big punch. Great burgers with delicious fries. I ate the cowboy burger with bacon and it was delicious. Their seasoned fries need no extra salt and were absolutely finger licking good.
Their special sauce is fantastic with the fries. The staff was very courteous and quick to accommodate my request.
I would definitely recommend you trying out this place if in need for a yummy burger :-)
author: Cheeky Monkey A.

description: A True Gem in the Richmond District.  They keep it simple and serving size are just perfect.  You get your money worth.
author: armando t.

description:
This place came to my rescue with perfect timing. It was on that weird weekday when I forgot to eat lunch. It was at that weird hour of 6 PM before an evening show at the Regency. Uncle Boy's, a few steps from "home base" looked unassuming from the exterior with its large (and what could have been homemade) banner. Meat. Cheese. Grease. Onion rings. Bacon. That special sauce. All engulfed in a sesame seed bun. Washed down with an ice cold Anchor Steam.    

+ Great location for a neighborhood burger joint
+ Simple menu that can satisfy a range of tastes
-  Having only one cook can be a bottleneck
author: Michael Paul C.

description: Was pleasant surprises by this spot! We ordered from EAT24 for a last minute dinner, expecting it to be typical burger but, it was delicious! We both ordered the OG with cheese and thought it reminded us of bbq'd burgers from home (a good thing)! Everything just went together very well, including the toppings, sauce, and toasted bun. Not to mention the prices were very reasonable. We also got a side of onion rings and had mixed feeling about them since they were on the cold side (delivery related). Will definitely be going back!
author: K T.

description:
I thought their burgers were reasonably just OK for a reasonable price closer to the higher end. There wasn't anything in particular that stuck out to me. I had a regular cheeseburger with ketchup and lettuce and a side of seasoned fries. I actually prefer my fires plain-Jane style. I like how everything is made to order, when ordered. That way I  know things are freshly prepared.

Also, they can seat about 9 people and an infant.
author: Jess W.

description:
I judged you wrong, Uncle Boy's!  You can thank BUFFALO BURGER for that though - Ever since I suffered bouts of diarrhea from Buffalo Burger in the Richmond (do not go there - see my review), I've had doubts with dingy burger joints...  So I was skeptical.  I am a student in the midst of finals, so I'm not about to put myself through stomach pains over a burger.

But WOW!  I ordered the Boy's Niece (grilled chicken with pesto sauce), and it was delicious!  The chicken was super tender, and they actually put just the right amount of pesto, which is surprising, since most places LATHER the bread with pesto.  They make the burger right in front of you and fresh, so the wait might be a bit longer, but definitely worth it.  Not expensive either - $5.75 for a huge, satisfying burger!  I don't usually have a huge appetite, but I finished the burger easily.  :)  FAN!

Extra points for having the SF flag over the counter.  :D
author: Christine A.

description: Super dry burger(way overcooked) on a stale bun. If you want a Western Burger stick to Carl's Jr. Cheaper and tastier. This place is mediocre at best.
author: rich f.

description: Ordered the hot mess burger, mozzarella sticks and wings. Delivery was plenty quick, 20 minutes of eat24's tracking. Burger was a great kinda mess!! Mozzarella sticks had a ton of flavor, and the wings are exactly the way they should be, hot and crunchy!! I'll definitely be ordering again.
author: Curtis A.

description:
U sually tough to find a decent late night burger
N ice to have Uncle Boy's around
C owboy Burger is a mouthful, and tastes amazing!
L oaded with cheese, bacon, onion rings and a special sauce
E very ingredient works well together 

B etter to skip Nephew's burger -- pesto sauce lacks flavor
O rder of Fries could be better
Y ou can skip on the Corn Dog, too
S tick with the Cowboy, and play it safe
author: Anthony N.

description: This place has classic character. Not bougie. Not foodie. Just really good grilled burgers with fresh ingredients. The guys that work here are super friendly and attentive. No hipster attitude. No irony. Just good good.
author: Gnat C.

description:
It's a burger joint. I'm not quite sure why people like it so much.

If it helps, I come from the East Coast, so I like (1) Five Guys (2) Shake Shack (3) In-n-Out - all in that order.
author: Kevin C.

description: Best damn burger I've had in a LONG time. Had a long day and man that comfort food was bomb! It's called the OG for a reason. Dudes that work there are kind, professional and gave great customer service!
author: Miranda C.

description: Get the seasoned fries with any of the burgers. Maybe I'm old fashioned, I prefer the OG. For the thrill seeker, you can add onion rings or mozzarella sticks to any burger.
author: Robin L.

description: I've been here many, many times because their burgers use to be so good. There was always these two guys I saw when I would go, and they were super friendly and made the best burgers. Recently I went and there were two guys I never saw before (not sure if they were new or just it was a different day). They weren't as friendly, and the burger wasn't great. I usually rave about the burgers, but this time was different. There wasn't enough sauce, the bacon was almost burnt and super hard, and the cheese wasn't melted. I guess the other two made my expectations high. I'll be back of course, but probably only if it's the same two I usually see.
author: Shira S.

description: I been coming to uncle boys for a long time the owner Jon he's a nice person the food is great the staff are wonderful I will continue to come to uncle boys until I die
author: Tycoon B.

description:
Pretty good food but ordered a combo for delivery and they don't deliver your drink.
Rip off, if I pay for something I expect to get it even when ordering delivery. Would suggest not expecting to get a drink if you order delivery as I noticed some other reviews say the same.
author: Greg N.

description: Just OK. Great concepts, good ideas, bad execution. Nobody bothers to ask how you want your burger done is always a red flag. Also, if your going to have an open kitchen and storage, try not to show that everything comes out of a bag of Kirkland branded everything - read: nothing here is homemade. All that said, palatable.
author: Steve H.

description: Just visited Uncle Boy's with my family as we were headed out of San Francisco. It was very reasonably priced (cheapest we ate at), with combos costing only $11. The burgers were delicious and the fries were cooked very well. I definitely recommend Uncle Boy's to anyone looking for good, affordable burgers!
author: Madison M.

description: The cowboy is the best burger in SF reminds me of those old time genuine great flame broiled burger spots from my childhood in LA
author: Danielle D.

description: Yo, jalapeños with the hot mess sauce is on point! Definitely the way to go. Wife and kids had the OG and even that was perfect. The freshness of the meat is hard to beat. Only lost a star because the fries are just pretty good and not "perfect". Will be back, multiple times.
author: Edmondo R.

description:
While traveling you learn not to let location and first impressions of a place fool you; Uncle Boy's is  one of those places.

I ordered the cowboy burger - onion rings, cheese bacon, chargrilled Angus burger on a toasted bun.

Hands-down the best burger I've had in the city and by far the most underrated burger joint in SF.
author: Chris F.

description: Boy o boy is this place fire! If you live in the inner Richmond you've got to check this burger place out! Not to expense and very personal, I would recommend the pool boy but only cause it's on the spicer side of things!
author: Jacob W.

description: Friendly service and great food. The chicken burger was to die for and I was fighting with my daughter over her chicken fingers. Great little neighborhood place.
author: Kent C.

description: I will never eat here again!! Their customer service is ridiculously bad. Whom ever the short man with long hair is needs to be fired! Unnecessarily rude for absolutely no reason. All I did was walk into a restaurant. Not to mention, the burgers aren't great. Taste like poor quality meat and fries taste like they haven't changed the oil in years. NEVER EAT HERE!
author: Shay D.

description: I really enjoyed eating at this place. The food here is bomb. I recommend the Jefe burger and the customer service is on point
author: Luisa O.

description:
I love Uncle Boi Burgers.  I live just 5 blocks away.  But when it gets busy, all coordination can sometimes breakdown here like tonight.  I called in an order and had to wait 15 minutes while they caught up on orders before they'd even help or look at someone.  10 minutes later, when I get to the front of the line, they scare me by not knowing where my burger was.  Turns out, it was sitting there the whole time.

Now, I have a burger that's been sitting or 30 minutes and it's frigid, much like the service guys.

I want to love you so much but you make it so hard...
author: Matt M.

description: Tasty burgers and chicken wings; friendly service. Our to-go place after sport team practices or games with the kids. Yum!
author: Joanna B.

description: Ain't no punk!! Delicious veggie burger- get it with added jalepenos. French fries have the right amount of crispness = perfection. The place is small so get it to-go if you have a big group.
author: Simran K.

description: Came here on my lunch break and had about a half hour to sit and eat. This place is really good. Everything is cooked up and done in front of you. Fast, friendly service. The food was hella good. I got the chic popper, chicken burger with jalapeño poppers inside! I love little hole in the wall spots.
author: Sofia F.

description: Knocking it down a star, repeated visits have proven they can be somewhat inconsistent with quality. Still awesome, but occasionally the freshness is missing depending on the day and the chef. The times I've been there and they are making the patties right on the counter seem to be their better days...
author: T J.

description:
Do you ever notice how some places treat you like a 2nd class citizen once they find out you have a Groupon?, and then glare at you even worse when you try and not over-spend on the Groupon amount...

NOT THIS PLACE, if anything, they went the extra mile to make you feel MORE comfortable and welcoming (and isn't that the point of Groupons, to make you want to go back and generate positive word of mouth?)

I went with a $10 Groupon. I am "trying" to eat less, so 2 of us went to split a burger and fries.  we ordered one cowboy burger meal (including fries well done & a soda).  When the nice griller was plating up our burger and fries he couldn't fit all the fries in the basket with the burger... I asked him to cut  the burger too, and when he did, he placed it into 2 baskets and added all the "extra" fries (which filled an entire basket). He also made sure to mention that we could have as much fountain soda as well liked. 

The other nice touch was the offering of BBQ sauce for the fries.

I will go back based on the delish and huge burger/fries, BUT more importantly I was to patronize a business that is clearly all about customer service.
author: Amy W.

description: It's my first time here. Very good food service and the place is very clean. My Bacon cheeseburger was cooked to my perfection
author: Marta L.

description: The burgers were great but this place has the best fries
author: Will H.

description: The Poolboy Burger had a nice spicy kick with the chipotle aoli.  A combination with fries and a drink was on the expensive side but I was not disappointed.
author: Richard M.

description:
Well I work in the City now about 5 minutes from this Burger joint.  Initially i thought I found a good burger joint close, so whenever I wanted to indulge, this would be the spot.  The first time I went there, I was juiced, i got the OG combo, fries were piping hot, the burger's bun was soft and fresh along with all of the condiments on it.  The meat was great and no tiny pieces of grissle throughout the meat......

However, I went a few months later got the same thing and when I got back to my employee parking lot to chow down, i was shocked.  The burger was luke warm, fries cold and the bun was hard as if the buns were sitting out to get stale!  I chalked it up as a place I would not return to.

Working on a Sunday, I had another taste for a good burger, knowing that Uncle Boy's was only 3 to 5 min away, i decided to give them another shot.   Same scenario, got back to my care at parking lot and burger, cold, bun hard and fries cold!!! i couldn't believe it, I called them and they said bring it back, i did.  They apologized and gave me another burger and fries, well got back to the parking lot again and the burger was somewhat hot and fries warm...I'M DONE! They should change the name to Uncle Nephews!
author: Troy G.

description:
This place is great! Since it's so close to my house, I had to try it out. I took my whole crew here (my guy and 4 of our friends, so 6 total).. We half-way filled the place up but the service was courteous, fast, and the food was great!

We all had the "Hot Mess" burger, and someone had the Bacon Cheeseburger.. and they were really good. The fries were also fried to perfection. We tried the jalapeno poppers which were also delish!

Everyone loved their food. We will be back!
author: Tay R.

description: This place makes me have dreams of their burgers. It's that good! I've definitely gotten burger cravings after eating here. I also like how unpretentious it is. Better and more consistent then fast food as well.
author: Giancarlo S.

description: Great burgers, friendly service. One of my absolute favorite local stops. The people there are great, got to know them as a regular. They know my order when I come in (get the Cowboy burger).
author: Michael S.

description:
I love this place, but came here last night at 8:00 and it was closed! For no reason! No note on the door, and it was within their normal hours...

Moral of the story, I was upset. The food is good, but not worth it if I'm going to go out of my way and they will be closed...
author: Erica W.

description: Uncle boy's is definetly a great spot to eat. Very reasonable and great service.
author: Austin-Ace T.

description: Unassuming burger joint that makes a damn-near-perfect specimen. A brioche-y toasted bun, well-seasoned patty and fresh veggies. Highly recommended!
author: Ben G.

description:
Found this place randomly browsing the deals on scoutmob. The burgers here are perfectly cooked - charred and crispy on the outside, warm/juicy in the inside. After reading a few reviews, the cowboy seemed to be the #1 seller, so we tried the Cowboy and the Hot Mess. 

Service: Excellent and very friendly

Losers: -1 star for not honoring the full  50% (up to 10$) scout mob discount.  Somehow the 50% was only applied to the first $10. 

Winners: hot mess, cowboy

Overall: 8/10

I'll definitely revisit, thanks Uncle Boy
author: Thomas L.

description: Late review... Checked this joint out a couple of months ago and it is hands down one of the best burgahs we've ever had! Burgers, fries, chicken wings - take your pick or get em all and you'll be haunted to come back for more. Can't wait to go back!
author: bombi r.

description: Great burgers, it's also pretty awesome that you can sub any of their appetizers for your fries with a combo (and their apps are all really good too). It's a little on the pricy side, but well worth it when you're craving a good burger!
author: Hunter S.

description:
I've been on a diet for the better part of 3/4ths of my life. I usually start off well, but then something happens: I wake up with a hangover. The day dawns painfully bright, my stomach is in turmoil, and my mouth seems filled with the unmistakable flavour of partially chewed cigarettes. When I can peel myself from bed (usually at around noon), I hunger for grease, and often find myself lurching, with zombie-like gait towards any restaurant that will help cure my ailment. 

Today, Uncle Boy's was my choice. I ordered the Hot Mess meal, and for about 10 dollars, I received all the Cola I could stomach, about a pound of french fries and a giant sized burger, with bacon, cheese, hot sauce and Jalapenos. The burger itself was cooked well-done, and fresh off the grill. While the Jalapenos added some nice spice, the star of this show was the meat: not only was my burger unobtrusively seasoned, but clearly a high grade of beef, the bacon (two thick slices) was large enough to attempt to escape the confines of the burger, despite arriving folded over. The vegetation on the burger was fresh, and played its supporting role with grace and aplomb.

French fries were simply seasoned, slightly spicy, substantially sized, and freshly fried. While they could have used a bit more time in the fryer, I couldn't find anything else about them I disliked. As mentioned earlier, they were provided en masse, which is certainly not anything to complain about, especially considering that they are probably the only vegetables I'll be eating today (if my mother reads this, I'm just joking, Mom!).

The space is...intimately sized, has a classic tile floor and sports memorabilia plastered to the walls. Service was quick enough, my food came within 7-8 minutes after I ordered, pretty impressive considering that it was a one-man operation.

I walked out with my hangover all but cured, and for that alone, Uncle Boy's is worth the four stars I'm giving.
author: Casey U.

description: I love this place. If I could come here everyday without going broke or gaining weight I definitely would! My favorite is the cowboy Burger and their onion rings with the cowboy sauce. I had a week where all I did was drive all the way from bernal heights to the inner Richmond district just to get some burger and I even took my cousin here and she loved it too. The staff is great, great customer service, burgers are delish, fries and onions rings are theeee bomb and everything is made in perfection. I went to Burgermeister the week after I had my week of Uncle Boys burgers and I was so disappointed because it wasnt the same. Uncle Boys is definitely way better than Burgermeister! I think Jon should get add another chain all over bay area cuz Uncle Boys needs to be known by the whole bay area.
author: Raina J.

description:
Uncle Boys is a little burger joint hidden in the Inner Richmond Dist. that has one of the better burgers in the City. OK, the burgers are not in the same class as a $15 grass-fed blue cheese spice dusted carmelized shitake gormet burger...it's a good, classic handmade burger-joint burger.

Original hot sauces are available here in a number of burger forms, but I prefer the O.G. with hot sauce on the side. Great sauce!
Descent fries, and onion rings. Their poppers are of the cream cheese variety, so not to my taste. If only they were cheddar cheese, I'd give 5 stars.
Fast service, take out, wide screen TVs are great for a food run durring the game.

HUGE plus is they are open LATE, until 3AM on weekends, and midnight I think weeknights. One of the FEW places to grab a burger in SF late, and by far the ONLY place to get one on the west side of the City. Try them out, can't beat it.

Late night burgers in SF: Uncle Boys, Grubstake

My top 5 best burgers in SF: Chez Mama, Grubstake, Uncle Boys, Jenny's, Cable Car.
author: Enoch K.

description:
Uh... someone!  PLEASE, if anyone knows what happned?  Yesterday (Sunday 2013-02-24), I stopped by in person as to order some food at about half five or so (17:30 Hrs) and the place was closed up!  Today (Monday 2013-02-25), I phone over there around 15:00 hrs. (3pm) and still NO answer!

Has this place suddenly 'bit the dust'? In other words are they suddenly without any notice closed down?  Something ain't right here folks!

Please leave a comment below if anyone knows what happened!

(If they did for one reason or another close down -- or worse, were forced to close --  that would be a real shame!  I surely will miss them)!

Thanks kindly.
author: Akinato K.

description: The chicken sandwich was good. My sister loved the french fries a lot. We're absolute going back at Uncle Bob's.
author: Dante E.

description: Uncle Boy's confirms that a hamburgers quality is often inversely proportionaly to it's messiness.
author: Dirk V.

description:
Were the ratings for Uncle Boy's not so high, I never would have had the pleasure of eating a cheeseburger and fries here. It's in the Inner Richmond and is open past closing time on Friday and Saturday....this combination screams "inexpensive" or "value" burger, not "really tasty" burger. Uncle Boy's is worth the trip.

However, this burger was juicy, enough that each comes with a paper wrapper. And the fries came out salted and peppered in advance - nice! 

I wouldn't call Uncle Boy's divey, but rather casual. To me, divey implies a lack of cleanliness, which is definitely not the case at Uncle Boy's. Instead, they make a real effort to keep everything clean and to maximize all available space in the restaurant.
author: Mike H.

description: Decent burger and nice portion size.  Also have jalapeno poppers and it's easy to park within the area.
author: Christina S.

description:
Today, my pregnant wife says, "I want a burger."  So onto yelp we go, looking for something decent. That's how we ended up at Uncle Boy's -- a four-star review looked pretty solid.

This place is a total dive. If you're drunk and looking for a greasy burger laid out comfortably on a bed of french fries, this is the place for you. These burgers are big, juicy, and both of our burgers had thick slices of bacon that added an excellent salty crunch. Not a bad burger if you have a big appetite.

So why two stars?

For one, our two meals came out to twenty two bucks. That's kind of a lot for lunch, especially when you consider alternatives like Super Duper, In-N-Out, Umami Burger, Tee Off Bar, HRD Coffee Shop, and Five Guys Burger... really, the list goes on and on. If a burger's gonna cost that much money, it better earn every penny. And not just the burgers, but how the place is kept -- all the tables were freckled with crumbs. It was just kind of gross.

For two, as we were eating, the guy behind the counter goes outside for a smoke. It's a windy day, the door's open, and we're sitting at the counter next to the entrance. As an ex-smoker, I was always aware of when there were kids or pregnant ladies around. People should know better, especially the guy handling the food.

I can see the charm of a place like Uncle Boy's. But a four-star experience, this was not.
author: Tony L.

description: Was really looking forward to giving this place a try while in town for Labor Day weekend we arrived around 920, a good 40 minutes before they were going to close. When we arrived the employee let us know there was a 25 minute wait hoping we would say no it's too long, and leave . But when we said it was fine he sighed and made us feel very uncomfortable like it was a problem for us to stay, so we decided to leave and not eat there. Didn't really like the atmosphere there.
author: Ashley Z.

description: My BF and I give you guys a 5 STAR! Walked in and was greeted and told where the menu's were. I wanted the O.G Meal for $7.75 came with soda and fries. Soda has free refill guys :)! Bf got the Ma Ma Mia which was $7.25 he said it was mouth watering. He ofc ate too fast so he has to come back with me next week for sure! I refuse to eat any where else. Fries were sort of salty but I had the ketchup to balance the taste BF thinks its Perfection. He also got a water which was $1.65. He paid about $18-$19. YUMMY! See you guys soon
author: Victoria T.

description: The burger was delicious! I had the pool boy and the bacon was big and tasted amazing! My friend had the og and thought it was delicious, she had raw onions and I had grilled, go raw, the people are super nice and have a good style and menu, location is tiny for eat in, fries and can of soda for 3 and change more seems a little much, but a great experience, I'm good at 3 1/2 but you can have four
author: Travis B.

description: I've tried like four different burgers from this place so far and they were all very delicious. My favorite is the spicy Pool Boy. I always do take outs because the place is so small, and has like three tiny tables. I often see two people working here and sometimes even one. So when the place gets a little bit busy, the service becomes a little slow but what can you do. It's a very casual place.
author: Sara S.

description:
Since opening up 4 months ago, I have decided to give this place some time to get themselves acclimated. 

I really love their concept, it is very simple. The problem is.............it might be too simple, as a matter of fact, a little boring. We ordered 4 burgers, one a double, 2 orders of chicken lumpia, and zucchini fries. 

The bun on this burger was very thick and dense. Although the bun is made from a local bakery and is made fresh everyday, it was just way too much bread. The patty was thick which I loved. There aren't too many patties like this out there. It was charred/grilled perfectly. You know the person making this had some experience behind the grill. 

Though they forgot my order, it was a blessing in disguise. Why? Because they had to rush my order and the burger came out med to med/rare, which I loved. It was juicy, charred perfectly where once you bite into the burger the juice comes oozing out. They prepare their burgers one way, which is close to well done. Having burgers made to order would make a ton of difference. 

Lumpias are good. Nothing to write home about. 

Suggestions: 

The helper should either use gloves or a tong to get the lumpias and fried zucchinis out of the fryer to the basket. It was very unappealing when he was using his hands after we saw him smoke outside. 

Use different buns, have lighter buns or an option to have different buns. 

Menu is too boring. Spice it up!!!! Do a different size burger. Since you already have a baker helping you guys out. Do an oversize burger with an oversize bun. That would be fun!!! An oversize lumpia?!? Just some ideas. 

Price point is good. 5 dollars for a burger is a great deal. Great for the UCSF students. I think it would do well here if they just tweaked it just a bit. They are already open up late which is great...........til 2 am. 

Total cost 46 dollars.
author: jason g.

description: Super good hamburgers. Small pace. Service was awesome though. The two dudes at the counter were very nice. They made my food with LOVE.
author: Gloria L.

description: Super friendly staff. They gave me extra fries because they had given me a few to start off with. They treated me really well and their food was amazing.
author: Alex L.

description: This place is a classic to-the-point, burger joint. The staff takes care of every customer request with ease. They are a staple of this part of the Richmond District neighborhood, it's a must go.
author: Jordan M.

description:
Yummy! food! I was really craving an in-n-out burger but didn't want to travel so far to get it! this was a great alternative! The fries were VERY yummy they are lightly  seasoned (: My roommate got the jalapeno poppers...she said they was good but nothing to go crazy over. 

I really liked the 'Hot Mess' burger which had mild cheddar cheese, bacon, and jalapenos on it! it said it was suppose to be spicy but it wasn't that spicy to me.   

Also bring your own hot sauce if you plan on eating there! ....theirs isn't hot at all.
author: Raquel H.

description: Nice people... Having a burger and a nice talk with  the people. Burgers are freshly made. Mead is well grilled and everything is fresh
author: Koen A.

description: This place is very good if you want a burger and soft drink. The fries are amazing, seasoned, and the burger grilled to your specifications. The staff was very friendly and helpful in deciding a burger. I got the El Jefe and it was amazing. I would highly recommend this burger place.
author: Shaneel A.

description:
FOOD:
chzburg = good

SERVICE:
Order at counter... 

ATMOSPHERE:
Tiny place mostly just an open grill and like 4 small tables or so.
author: Angela L.

description:
Man, after a night of drinking, this place has saved my life many times.

Edit: I'm done with this place. Done. I finally realize that I deserve better than fucked up orders, burnt burgers, and bad service.
author: Boris Y.

description: Ordered the Momma Mia Burger and the Hit Popper Burger and loved it. I've never seen a burger with mozzarella sticks and jalapeño poppers in it. Great idea and great American meal.
author: Phil L.

description: Friendly staff and very good food. Ordered Cowbow Burger, it was delicious! The place is simple but it doesn't have influence over the quality of the food.
author: Fernando N.

description:
I thought almost everything is suppose to taste good when drunk...WRONG!

I love supporting local businesses and mom and pop type establishments, but MAJOR improvements need to be made to the taste and quality of Uncle Boy's food (or perhaps it was an off night?). All the YELP reviews rave about UB's tasty food and great customer service; NONE of which we experience when we came here on Saturday, 3.26. So, I'm going to go against all the 4 and 5 star reviews and give it the rating it deserves...1 STAR!

I first heard about UB back in January 2010 when I was at Kent Cleaners around the corner. One the customers were telling us how they opened a Fast Food joint opened till 3 AM. 3 AM?!? Perfect especially after a night of partying, so I put UB on my list. 

My friends and I came here this past Sat at around 2 AM. 

FOOD:
*Lumpia ($3.95 for 5): AWFUL! The lumpia came fresh out of the freezer from a large plastic bag. Although the wrapper was nice and crisp, the filling was very dry and tasteless. If you're expecting authentic lumpia made with pork, do NOT order the lumpia at UB. Who makes lumpia with white chicken meat, lima beans, and corn? Perhaps, they are trying to make a "healthy" version of lumpia? But, we all know everything is fried is unhealthy, so if I'm going to eat it something bad for me, bring on the pork fat please!

*Chicken Nuggets ($4.85 for 7): Over fried, dry, AND rock hard! One bite was all I needed to throw the chicken nuggets back into the basket. Some parts were burnt, so it left a nasty after taste in my mouth.

*Chicken Wings ($7.95 for 8): The wings were heavily battered and was over fried producing an extra hard oily crust. The crust was inedible, so I had to peel off it off and just ate the meat with which was relatively moist which was the only positive thing about it.

*Burger w/ American Cheese ($4.95 + .85 for cheese): One of the WORST burgers ever. All of our burgers were burnt, overcooked, dry, and flavorless. The patty was charred to the point some parts of it was black which left a disgusting charcoal/lighter fluid after taste in my mouth. 

*Fries ($2.85): When cooking hand-cut fries, you have to soak the fries in cold water to draw out all the starch and sugar, so that it fries to a crisp. I highly doubt UB did this because the hand-cut fries arrived room temp, undercooked, dry, and were NOT crispy. It was also unseasoned, so it literally tasted like eating cardboard. 

In summary, everything was overcooked and/or burnt, dry, and unseasoned which left an unsettling aftertaste in my mouth which had to be washed down with tons of Sprite. 

SERVICE:
Some of the Yelpers mentioned friendly service that goes above and beyond. Umm, I didn't see any of that. We ordered our food at the counter and paid. Then, the cook would just call out our order(s) when it was ready and handed it over the counter. We were suppose to have an option for sauces for our lumpia, nuggets, and wings, but was never asked as to which ones we wanted. We were given the sweet and sour for the lumpia, bbq for the nuggets, and ranch for the wings. I know we were probably suppose to request it upon ordering, but we all know when you're buzzed/drunk, our judgment is impaired, so if they truly had such "great" customer service they should have asked. 

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:
UB is small and simple. You walk in and the kitchen is to your left, 2 tables to your left, 2 tables in the back, and 3-4 stools near the front window. The back tables had a laptop and bags on it the night we went, so there were only really 2 tables avail that night with 2 chairs each.  

PARKING:
Difficult because UB is located in an residential area of the Inner Richmond. There isn't much metered parking avail like Geary and Clement which is normally plentiful in the wee hours of the morning. 

Sorry UB, I really WANTED to like you but when I'm hungry and  can't even manage to take more than a few bites of any of your food that's a big problem.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Came here after walking the 6 mile AIDS walk and got the hot mess burger...oh boy! I finished it in 10 mins. I wasnt even hungry but it was way way way too delicious. Will be back :)
author: Shiela V.

description:
I really love their burgers, but I just stopped by and they were closed during their normal business hours. This is definitely typical for this place, and as good as their burgers, and it's almost even more disappointing when this happens. 

Good food, but low rating because they literally are never open when they say they are.
author: Alexess N.

description: This place is pretty small, its not the fanciest looking place and inside is pretty dark. Staff was nice and friendly. I think I got the regular hamburger or something and a side order of mozarella sticks. It was quick to order and they made it pretty quick too. The bacon was too salty. The mozarella sticks were flavorless and I think the buffalo sauce was bad. They have a box for suggestions which was nice. Needs improvement.
author: Carmen L.

description: This was a last minute stop but I heard of them from a friend and decided to drive by, I ordered the "Hip-Popper" it was good, it came with 2 deep fried crispy batter which was deep fried with jalapeños and cream cheese inside, the patty was fat and cooked just how I asked, medium well. The buns were big as well. It was a juicy burger however it felt a bit dry because of the fried stuff. I wish they added more sauce and mayo. And thumbs up for the free drink that I saw on yelp and they totally accommodated me, staff was nice and friendly.  Parking is a tough one though since its in a residential area...
author: Kyli J.

description: Wtf. I called. They put me on hold. I wait almost 5 minutes before I give up. Then I try and call back several times. Obviously they didn't remember and didn't hang up. Over 2 hours later still. This is in no way the first time this has happened.  How hard is it to use a phone!?
author: Mark A.

description: We enjoyed the hole in the wall atmosphere, but what really loved was the awesome juicy fat burgers.  After a long day of up down all the hills in SF on bikes, a good burger is just what is needed and Uncle Boy's satisfied that need perfectly.  I had the one with jalapeno poppers on it and my friend had the hot mess one.  Service was very good too.
author: Bryan B.

description: I stopped by on the walk home from the bar late one night and the guy served us even though he was about to close up. Excellent burgers and great service! I'll have to go back when I'm in better shape! Thanks for saving my night, Uncle Boy's!
author: Lauren C.

description: Great classy burgers. Don't e fooled by the ultra-basic space, it's all substance here. The tell-tale ere is the menu flier, not only pretty but filled with enticing choices like the Jalapeño Poppers burger and the Pool Boy with crispy bacon and chipotle ranch. The beef is all Angus so it's got real juicy flavor (but they have a large selection of veggie and chicken burgers as well); the chipotle ranch was exactly spicy enough to add kick and interest but not so much to cover the other flavors. A must try!
author: Diana C.

description:
They do make a tasty burger.

The Mama Mia is a freakish thing of awesome.  Comes with the burger, three mozzarella sticks and marinara.  And it's amazing.  Ordering a meal comes with a drink and a ton of fries too.

Plus they're open until 3am on Friday and Saturday.  Super rad.  I ate here the most when I was visiting from Portland and I wish I could take this place back with me.
author: Daniel H.

description: Nephew burger was just ok for $10 combo. Fries were great!! The staff was really nice but when the owner came in he was pretty rude.
author: Jess B.

description:
I was suffering from need-a-burger-right-now-itis. I found a spot to park practically right out front and strolled in ready to get my craving cured. There was one guy running everything when I got there, so I waited, patiently, smelling the burger goodness that was already cooking.

A few minutes later I put my order in, read from my book, and was gently informed that my food was ready. Hot damn, are those fries good. Don't get me wrong, the burger (I got the OG with grilled onions) was good too but holy wowsers the fries were a nice surprise. They came preseasoned and perfect. I usually prefer steak fries but these babies are fine just the way they are. 

I had to remind myself to ease up on the fries to leave room for the burger. Once done, I continued on with the fries. So glad I came, ordered, and ate.
 
Burger craving officially satisfied.
author: Loli L.

description:
This place is just fantastic. You can thank San Francisco for being good and reliable for having good eats open late on the weekend. 3AM!!!

Anyhow, uncle boy's is a tiny burger joint that offers a great variety of different burgers and finger foods. (They even have lumpia??) Many specialty burgers with specialty sauces, along with my favorite fried finger foods such as zucchini fries, mozzarella sticks, fries, chicken wings etc. Prices are decent, it's not expensive and for less than $10 you can get yourself a pretty good meal.

The last time I was here, the bestie and I shared an unhorsed cowboy burger which had all the fix-ins (lettuce, tomato, onions) and on top of that 2 strips of bacon and onion rings with their cowboy sauce, which I assume to be some sort of southwestern chipotle of some sort. We subbed the meal deal with zucchini fries AND got mozzarella sticks, whew. Their burger patty kind of reminds me of the whopper from BK or Carls Jr., and IDK if that's a good thing, but I know some people dig that. They make their patties fresh from what I saw the last time we were there. They took the ground beef and formed patties right before our eyes! But they cook them nice and well done so there's a bit of a charred/crisp. I suppose you can ask them not to cook it as long if you don't like that? I prefer mine well done though, so it doesn't matter much to me.

Tons of food and a drink for about $15. Everything was really good, and now whenever I'm taking the 31 past Uncle Boys I'll be thinking of those burgers...Definitely recommended! Not many other burger joints in this area (that I can think of?)
author: Stine H.

description: Came on a Saturday and was a great decision. The place was packed and I had to wait a while to place my order. It is a small cozy looking place with great food and amazing people, the staff was super nice and helpful. I ordered a cowboy with onions, pepper and zucchini. It was pure bliss to have that burger; perhaps one of the best burgers I have had in a long time. The price was not unreasonable but was a bit high as compared to other restaurant, but overall, I had a great experience and would definitely be coming again.
author: Pocho G.

description:
I'm proud to give this place my first 5 star review.  I had the OG and it was above and beyond delicious.   Seasoned perfectly (and by that I mean seasoned almost not at all, the way a burger should be), insanely tasty ingredients, not greasy or messy at all, the French fries were perfect as well, seasoned mostly with pepper instead of salt.  Sort of a different take on something we're all so accustomed to seeing passable, pedestrian versions of.  

I paid a little over $8 for this delicious hamburger/fries/meal.  You pay about the same at all the mega-corporate fast food chains like BK and McDs and you get awful food without the added bonus of helping out a small business.  

The guy working the register could have been a little bit more affable and welcoming, but in the end the food is so overwhelmingly good that I'm willing to gloss this over
author: Eric F.

description:
Just wandered into this place today and can I just say...YUM. No, it's not a gourmand's burger. It's a greasy, yummy creation. I had the Mamma-mia. That's a cheeseburger with four mozzarella sticks and marinara sauce. Make it a meal with fries and a drink and you're all set! They also have one with jalapeno poppers. Sigh. I definitely see one of those in my future.

PS, it was a gorgeous day today and we had the stroller with us. The guys at the burger join said we could take a table and seats to the sidewalk and enjoy our burgers in the fresh air.
author: Adrienne C.

description: Mama-Mia burger. Nuff said. Dudes behind the counter were super friendly, the yelp business times are off though..we got there around 9 and were the last customers.
author: Steve L.

description: Stopped by here when I was leaving the de Young Museum and was on my way to the Legion of Honor. I ordered the Main Chick and it was pretty much a basic chicken burger. The aesthetic of the joint is pretty much a local burger joint so it's pretty small with a couple of seats on the inside. The people are very kind so service is great. Food is pretty basic for a burger joint, nothing too spectacular. Fries could have been a bit more crispier.
author: Lola H.

description:
Not the cheapest, nor the best burger in SF, however, very satisfying if you're ever on a hunt to get rid of that "burger craving!" 

I live very close to here so I decided to try it out since ratings were pretty high.

I opted for the "Hot Mess" because I love everything spicy. Good-sized burger, very tasty, juicy, and a nice spicy kick. It's about $10 for the burger alone, and I'd say its almost worth it. But I guess I'm just one of those cheap-o's that doesn't like to spend more than $7 on a fast-food type of burger.

I have yet to try their fries & I will, yes I will one day.
author: Junel S.

description:
Great burger joint! My favorites are the "unhorsed cowboy" (Bacon cheese burger with onion rings) and his side chick (grilled chicken with spicy sauce). The prices are very good considering the amount of food and quality. 

I'd say one downside is if you want to go with a group of people, the seating is limited. Just a few small tables along the wall and some seating by the window. Also, i've been lucky enough to go when it wasn't really busy so service has been really good, but I can see how people have to wait awhile because there is usually only one guy working there at a time.

If you're in the inner richmond area, these are the best burgers you'll find.
author: Nate C.

description: Sorry, I actually didn't eat here to review appropriately.
author: Carolina P.

description: Great place. Place was clean, food was delicious, fresh and reasonably priced. Pleasant staff, too. Would definitely come back if in the area.
author: Ian W.

description: I went for the Mama Mia and was not disappointed. The burger was tender and cooked perfectly.
author: Jeff D.

description: Best Burgers in the city? maybe, you really need to be lucky to get that.  I have to say 90% of the time you will get a burnt burger with bad service.  Today  I made a phone call to order something for pick up, they told me to wait a min and then never came back, I was able to hear them chatting, laughing in the phone but they never ever came back.  I live in the neighborhood and I normally go there 2-3 times a month, but this time I have to say I am done with this place.
author: V X.

description: Uncle Boy's is pretty expensive but there aren't many places that serve fresh burgers in the city. This explains why I spend $10.89 on the Main Chick combo. Their fries are a tad bit over seasoned most times but I just shake off the salt n pepper and deal with it. I'd give them 5 stars if they didn't randomly close!!!! All in all, this is my cheat day spot and I'll keep going here forever.
author: Tania C.

description:
Sorry Uncle Boy's, you did me wrong Friday night after I've been drinking.  Like Cherylynn N. said, "I thought almost everything is suppose to taste good when drunk...", I guess you were the "almost" exception.  

Friday afternoon, Cherlynn N. mentioned that you were open until 3am and after I saw the menu, I immediately got excited.  However, you let me down.

Me and three friends got here around 2am Saturday night after our Friday night Fluid ritual.  There wasn't a wait so we walked up to the counter and ordered.

FOOD:
-Chicken and Veggie Lumpia ($3.95) - Umm lima beans and peas in lumpia?  Never had it like that before, but i did not like it!  It was not authentic at all and the flavor wasn't there.

*Chicken Nuggets ($4.85) - I had one and it tasted like the kind you buy at Costco.

*Burger ($4.95) - YUCK!!  My burger was so dry and burnt to a crisp, adding additional ketchup could not even save it.  After each bite I needed to gulp down sips of Sprite to keep my mouth from completely drying out.

*Chicken Wings ($7.95) - I LOVE wings, but sorry Uncle Boy's, yours were not great.  I will admit, it was the most decent thing I ate all night, but it wasn't great.

SERVICE:  The workers did not seem customer service oriented.  As the food was done, they would pass it over instead of bringing it to our table.  As we ate, we noticed we still haven't received our lumpia, but the workers were standing around.  They forgot, but promptly made them when we mentioned that we still haven't gotten it.  

Uncle Boy's accepts cash or credit cards.  

Uncle Boy's, your prices are right but your food is not. I'm sorry, but I will not be returning.
author: Nicole S.

description: I got the Cowboy and it was great! Had a variety of burger styles! However, service wasn't that great and it took forever to get our food. They also messed up orders and appeared really unorganized. Maybe I just caught them at a bad time, but the customer service was sub par.
author: Kevin S.

description: Great little hole in the wall fast burger joint! The staff was extremely friendly and courteous! Excellent spot if you are craving late night snacks!! I'll definitely be back!!
author: Annika O.

description: A once great burger joint sliding down the slope toward mediocrity. It was never anything fancy, just burgers, fries, onion rings, and sports. They used to be open till 3am which was great. They used to have more than one guy working there at least some of the time. These days their slogan seems to be "primetime lunch/dinner rush? **** it! lets have just one guy work the register, cook, and take phone orders!" 3 stars because the food is still pretty good. The service always was slow but it's getting borderline unbearable, think 45 min and up for a cheese burger and fries.
author: Tomas K.

description: I'm glad it's in the neighborhood!  I like the Main Chick and Fries are not bad.  I would like them to commit to natural, no antibiotics or hormones for the prices they charge.
author: Ben M.

description:
I rarely give out 5 stars, because I rely on Yelp so much that I feel that the 5 star rating is something sacred, only given out to the establishments that truly deserve the rating so others who are looking at the star rating, can make an accurate assessment of how the place is.  Of all the places that Yelp has recommended to me, I can only say Phils BBQ in San Diego and Uncle Boy's truly deserve the 5 star rating.

A tiny hole in the wall type of restaurant in the middle of apartment buildings in the inner Richmond, Uncle Boy's is very unassuming.  A hint of Filipino inspiration, from the name to the Pacquiao pic inside show what the owners were thinking.  There are literally only 3 tables, each a 2 person table inside with a bar counter.  The couple times i've been there, there's only 1 guy working.  He takes your order and cooks it to order right there in front of you.  Cups for drinks are all laid out on the counter for you to help yourself because the employee can literally see if you take a cup and hadn't paid for it.  It's the the type of tiny restaurant that makes you a believer in small business and how someone can get it so right.

Food wise, I've tried many burgers in San Francisco, most recommended to me by Yelp and this burger is by far the best.  In the Inner Richmond, others might say Bills Place or Buffalo Burger but Uncle boys far outpaces them.  I've had the Pool Boy and Unhorsed Cowboy, both amazing burgers.  Perfectly juicy patty, toasted bun, condiments and sides at the right proportion to meat and bread.  The burger is something that comes together perfectly and one you just can't stop eating.  The fries are very crispy and amazing compliment to the burger.

Don't let the unassuming curb appeal detract you from Uncle Boys, this place is legit and something everyone should try.
author: Brian C.

description: If you are a fan of juicy burgers, then this is your place. Reminds me of east coast burger joints. good food + Great prices and somewhat friendly service. Yes, they can get overwhelmed at times but with a campus so close to cheap food...i understand!
author: Tavo P.

description: This is a little gem in SF for a great burger. Every time I come here I leave full and satisfied. The burgers are juicy even at well done and the seasoning they put on the fries, delish. Love this place and will always be coming back.
author: Joe S.

description:
We did not receive our entire order (meaning our fries/zucchini sticks were missing) because the fryer was broken. HOWEVER, they ddi give us our burgers and then a 'free meal' coupon for the next time we came in! Great customer service!
Hopefully this coupon thing works!
author: Cara G.

description: I couldn't tell you a thing about the food because Uncle Boy's makes it impossible to even ORDER the food. A few weeks ago, I tried to phone in a to-go order on two different days. The phone just rang and rang over the course of multiple calls from 4:30 until almost 6:00 (and yes, I checked to be sure they were open on those days). There's no one answering the phone at dinner hour? Then tonight I called to order a chicken sandwich and was told that the place was totally out of chicken. Out of chicken at 6:00 on a Saturday night?!? Half the menu is chicken. Three times I tried to patronize Uncle Boy's, and you can rest assured there won't be a fourth.
author: Steve M.

description:
This review is a little late, but my boyfriend and his grandparents and I went here at the end of January.

We were heading to the Conservatory of Flowers for the afternoon, and we needed to stop for lunch before we actually hit the park proper. My boyfriend found this place on Yelp and thought it would be a good choice. When we walked in, I was definitely side-glancing at him for not picking a place with more seating, as his grandparents aren't really very spry. We got lucky that the take-out orders that people were waiting for came up pretty fast, so we took two of the two-person tables.

The food itself was really good. I got the Pool Boy, and the burger was juicy and well flavored without too much extra stuff, everything was really well balanced, with nice crisp veggie toppings. The fries were deliciously seasoned with just a touch of salt and pepper.

My boyfriend and his grandpa both had the Cowboy and they both really enjoyed it, and though I can't recall what his grandma got, she finished the whole thing, which surprised us all.

For the price and quality of the food, this is definitely a great joint to stop by when in the area.
author: Aimée S.

description: I was starving in the area and found this place on yelp and decided to give it a shot- GREAT decision! The place is totally a hole in the wall which I loved because you don't find many burger places nowadays that aren't trying to be hip or fancy. This place is not trying to be anything other than what it is: a place to get an awesome burger. They have all kinds of burger options and they cook them right there in front of you. I would definitely recommend this place and will be going back soon to get my burger fix.
author: Jessi G.

description: Got a burger to go with some onion rings (VERY SMALL PORTION ON THE ONION RINGS BY THE WAY) and when I finally arrived home and bit into my burger it was raw..I asked for medium rare. Oh, not to mention, it was the wrong order..pretty hard to mess up a hamburger this badly.. I couldn't even finish it. Will not be coming back and I do not recommend this place if you are looking for a good meal.
author: Mika E.

description: Great food, awesome service! The boys who work here were super sweet and helpful! They went out of their way to provide great customer service. This is a good place to get delicious food at and awesome price!
author: Kara R.

description:
One Ting, and One Ting only....  Jalapeno Poppers!!  BOOM!!!!!!   More FYAH!!!!!

Well, I lied, another ting, Fries!  Holy Fahqing Good Mon!  And another, Onion Bumbo Klaat Rings!  Good Lord has saved me!!  Fried like a mofo!

When ya'll creeping on the late night come up, Uncle B's is where its at, latest Thug spot in the hood, come strapped or my homies may jack you for your pager.

Thug Life, Oaktown to Richmond, We be banging blocks!!!!   BOOM!!!
author: Ubique K.

description: Decent, quality food. Still, the service is lacking. The prices could be better considering it's a hole in the wall.
author: Grey Z.

description: Make sure you say "well done" if you don't want a mouth full of raw meat.
author: Morris R.

description:
A no frills burger joint with great service, free delivery, and is open til 3:00AM!   

$10 minimum for credit card transactions.  With that said, I only had enough in cash to get a cheeseburger, but it was pretty good.  The patty was cooked a little more than I would have preferred, but the owners were so friendly and accommodating that I know it would've been perfect had I requested otherwise.  They seem very keen on the likes of regulars and are constantly asking for feedback.
author: Jenn C.

description: AMAZING! SCRUMPTIOUS! ORGASMIC! The "hot mess burger" was true to its name, but the staff was so sweet and not only provided a plethora of napkins and utensils, but they also tossed in some complementary fries and a drink. Overall I thought that it was the perfect place for a burger lover to find an extremely filling burger in San Francisco.
author: Maritza M.

description: Tried the cowboy burger and it was good but a little too meaty and greasy for me.  I liked the onion rings a lot more than my actual burger.  I do wish that they served burgers with mushrooms or avocados though.  That way I feel a little less greasy after.
author: Tina L.

description:
Pros:
- You can tell the meat is hand-prepared. Do you guys mix onion with it? 
- The unhorsed cowboy (bacon, cheese, onion rings, sweet bbq sauce) is the BOMB
- They cook their bacon in the deep fryer, making it super crispy!
- Their fries are crispy, well-seasoned, and a perfect complement to any burger you order. 

Cons? 
- I drunkenly stumbled here late this past Halloween night and they were packed (usually it's never too overly busy). They only had two people on deck. Not really their fault though.
author: Ronald T.

description:
Great burgers and friendly staff!
I'm not sure if it was just a one time thing, but I had my Giants Debit Card and they gave me a discount for it! How nice!
author: Jessyca M.

description: Quick lunch with my niece, who ordered the Nieces sandwich, which she loved.   I had a burger (can't recall which) but it was a shining example of the greasy griddle burger - sumptious. Staff was attentive and nice and the chef even cooked up some zucchini fingers to sample, which were excellent.  If you're in the Golden Gate Park area, give this place a try for lunch, you won't be disappointed.
author: Michael M.

description: The wings are Awesome. Couldn't stop thinking about them, so got them two days in a row. My kids loved them too. It's close, convenient and it's own little deal. I like the feeling that someone opened that little place and is making a living serving yummy food.
author: Tara U.

description:
I love spicy food, and if you can have spicy burgers...count me in!!! I had the pool boy -- beef patty with bacon, jack cheese, and chipotle sauce.  It was pretty good, but I think it could be made even HOTTER.  Also tried my bf's hot mess -- beef patty with bacon, cheddar cheese, and jalapenos...and I think tapatio sauce, but I could be wrong.  That was SO HOT and SO SPICY and SO GOOD.

On top of the great burgers, the onion rings were delish!  I wish I had asked for a side of ranch to dip them in...but I had them bare and it was still good.

Def want to go back and try their hot links!
author: Liz W.

description: Burger pretty good but nothing you can't find anywhere else in the city.  The real treat was going there with my 9 yr old daughter on a slow day.  We sat at the window only to start eating and having to watch the guy who made our food stand outside, smoking and spitting on the ground talking on his cell phone.  We're were fortunate enough to not have to guess what he was taking about because shortly after he came inside to continue his conversation about "diapers" and "car seats".  Good food, ridiculously bad service.
author: Jeff S.

description:
I read the reviews and I thought we should give this place a try. Sounded pretty good and we were pretty starved for some burgers and fried food!

So the five of us walk in and realize that there are only like 8 seats in the whole place. So we sat 2 at a table and 3 to the counter by the window. My friend and I each ordered a burger, then split the wings and onion rings.

Onion Rings: Pretty good, standard rings.
Wings: More than 8 wings, like described on the menu. Good with a bit of kick.

The disappointing part was the burger. I don't remember the name of the burger I ordered but it had jalapenos and some spicy sauce. The burger was dry and overcooked as was the burnt bacon. I ended up taking the bacon out of the burger because I couldn't taste anything else but the burnt ass bacon. 

Granted, I might give this place another shot because of the good reviews and because that poor guy was OVERWORKED. He was the only guy. This guy was doing everything, taking orders, making burgers, fries, wings, rings. He had to take 5 orders while making 5 people's food, and took a phone order too!  Hire another person!
author: Wilson T.

description: Solid burgers, no attitude we left the California academic science center and we were starving, helped up this place and we weren't disappointed. I recommend it if u want a great burger.
author: Victor B.

description:
Oh Uncle Boy's... you are perfection. 

Burgers are made to order, any substitutions are totally fine with them, they hand prepare everything and it's usually just the one chef!! I discovered them this summer while living in the Inner Richmond, and just moved back and have already gone twice. My only beef is all the Giants stuff....I'm from LA...but I would gladly eat my Dodger's hat in order to eat here. Yum yum yum. Get the Mama Mia or Unhorsed Coyboy...and get onion rings. And french fries. Just order everything.
author: Marina H.

description: Uncle has the best burger. I love the place.  They have great worker like Morgan and Zach.
author: Jeff T.

description:
I finally got a chance to get parking during dinner time! I went in here and there was only 1 customer in front of me. I ordered the unseated cowboy and the OG burger[me and the gf]. They were good. For $2 more you can get a soft drink and a good amount of french fries (they put pepper in their fries). Then all of a sudden a big swarm of young adults came and they place was packed. They only had 1 worker servicing all these orders and cooking up the burgers.

The decor inside was similar to what my room would be decorated like back in high school. Bunch of 49ers posters, SF Giants posters, and a Manny Pacquiao photo at the register. I was thinking to myself maybe the owners are Filipino? because every Filipino person has an Uncle Boy. lol
author: Jeff C.

description: I'm not a burger person, if I do have one it's usually in n out.... In my opinion Uncle Boy's is so much better than in n out!
author: Monica A.

description:
Came here yesterday to use the Scoutmob deal with some friends for lunch. The motto is "small menu, big taste" which is pretty much true. The menu is straight forward like Ike's Place but less extravagant. The burgers are similar but with a difference of one or two items/sauce(s).

The burger meal includes a 21 oz soda and straight-cut fries for $8.95. The burger itself is $6.95. Since the Scoutmob deal has a maximum $10 discount, I opted to get a hotlink sandwich as well.
