Price for sandwiches are flat $6.95 for all varieties and $8.95 for meal. I got the "unhorsed cowboy" burger meal and the "bacon link" hotlink sandwich. To make the most out of the discount, add jalapenos and other extras! I wish I did since jalapenos are only $.50 more.

There are only 2 tables to sit down so count on taking orders to-go or if you are comfortable standing then there is area for that. It didn't take long for the food to cook. I ate the burger first and it was quite tasty. I really like sticking fries into my burger rather than eating all of them supplementary so you might want to try that. I really like the crunch to almost every bite, yummy. Add pepper for more taste too.

The hotlink sandwich was also yummy but I preferred the burger. I have been craving a hotlink for weeks and I finally got a good fix here. Even with my huge appetite and high metabolism, I wasn't able to finish the last 1/4 of the sandwich but I did in the car after I left.

One complaint is that there is no compost bin. Coming back from Berkeley, seeing a compost bin is almost a must anywhere, especially in SF where it is mandated. We'll definitely come back if we're in the area.
author: Dominic T.

description:
If it's wrong to love a fry-a-lator, then I don't mind being wrong.  This narrow corridor of an establishment is little more than a grill next to a fry-a-lator.  It's in the inner Richmond.  And it gets frequented by all sorts of coming of age youths.  The person working here might even be a coming of age youth.  He looked awfully young.  

The burger combos read like a pregnant woman's list of things to consume during a serious craving.  Fried mozzarella, bacon, BBQ sauce and onion rings in a burger, at the same time?  Sure.  The burger patty is not the centerpiece of the burger, so it lacks flavor and originality.  But stack on some serious toppings, and it is perfect.

My BF and I each had a burger.  Well, we each ordered a burger.  But the burger turned out to be so CATASTROPHICALLY big that I couldn't finish mine.  I had about half.  (Bar results in 3 days!  Massive Brain Failure!)  I loved the fried mozzarella sticks inside the burger.  

Oh.

Just give me a ... a moment.  Alone.  

Nearly done.  

Slooobber.  Drool.  Mozzarella sticks.....oh you gorgeous piece of fat fried in fat, covered in carbs.  

The BF disliked it but, surprisingly, was unable to articulate why.  I seriously question his credibility.

It is cheap, dirty, fast, slightly nasty, but a little bit of all the right flavors.  Deconstruct it.  Eat it how you want.  But you know that there's a little bit for everyone.  

Put on your eatin' dress with the elastic waist before you come here.
author: Christina C.

description: After dropping off my clothes to soap box dry cleaners down the street came across uncle boys burger joint. Decided to yelp before heading in and decided to give it a try. Looking at their menu it had a couple of good burger and decided to try the Mama Mia burger which had : 1 grilled Angus beef patty, 1 slice of jack cheese, and 4 mozzarella sticks, lettuce, and finished with zesty marinara sauce all in a toasted bun. My Girlfriend tried the OG(original) burger. We got our order within 5-10 minutes. Took a bite of my burger and fell in love very tasteful and the mozzarella cheese sticks went well with the burger. The french fries were really good as well. The only thing i would recommend is that the Grillmeister should ease up on the mustard on the OG burger because it over powers the taste.
author: John B.

description:
I LOVE UNCLE BOY'S!!!

I believe I have to thank one of those Groupon/Living Social Deals that introduced me to this place... because now it has created a lifelong friendship of where I want to get my awesome burger fill.

There are so many good burger joints in the city, but this one is truly GREAT.  Small place with a few tables and usually a Giants game on in the back, you are greeted always by the nicest guys who just want to give you a damn good burger.

Favs:
-unhorsed cowboy- this is how a burger should be eaten... with bacon, onion rings, and cowboy sauce/bbq sauce
-his side chick- for your chicken needs, please match it with chipotle sauce (or that pesto sauce is pretty damn good too!)

Match that up with their lovely thick fries and a drink.... MMM... that is one tasty burger!

Parking situation is not bad.  Bring your friends, because they will love you for it.

P.S.  I'm guessing their lumpias are ridiculously awesome only because I have NEVER been able to order one!  Probably because I find myself here after work or too late in the game.  If they are there, you should probably order some.
author: Christine K.

description: Great little shop in the Inner Richmond. A nice find. Seats maybe 20. Large selection of beef burgers, chicken burgers and garden burgers. French fries are great. Service was fast and friendly even though it was busy.  The Hot Mess is the best.
author: Coral H.

description:
Went here for a late night burger.  It seems oddly located in a highly residential area but it had a surprising amount of traffic for it's location and the hour.  The inside is cozy with 3 tables and a unisex bathroom and the counter to order from and the grill behind it.  The picture of Manny Pacquiao by the cash register was amusing to me but I guess it should have been expected for a place called Uncle Boy's.

I got a burger with bacon onion rings and cheese in it.  I like the fact that the burger is freshly grilled so waiting at the table was no problem.  Everything seemed to be made to order including the fries.   The size of the burger was pretty big.  It was juicy and tasted great.  It also was a good deal at under $10.  

I recommend this as a great late night burger place if you're in the area.
author: Ian V.

description: Oh uncle boys! Amazing burgers, good fries and a creative menu. It's a greasy, dive-y hole-in-the-wall kind of place and that makes me happy. Consistently good food and solid service, you can't go wrong and uncle boys. Try the dipping sauces. They are wonderful.
author: Alicia M.

description: Good people, decent burgers, but nothing spectacular.  Small place, plan on a to - go strategy.
author: Bill S.

description:
3.5 stars. 
Hubby & I've been wanting to try this place. After visiting the Union Street Fair and avoiding the overpriced vendor foods, we headed to Uncle Boy's which for some odd reason, I keep calling "Uncle Bob's" and persist in my erroneous ways despite the endless corrections administered by Hubby.

Hubby had read that the Yelppies like the fries. We ordered 2 burger meals (comes w/fries & huge soda) for over $8. I liked how the meat in the " Nephew" burger was cooked (cheese, lettuce, tomato & sauce). The meat was tender, tasty and not over done, a slight pink to it. We also bought the "Cowboy"but didn't get to try it as it was purchased for the Jr. Yelpers as a late nite snack. The burger was big and I certainly couldn't eat the whole thing alone, esp w/fries & big soda.

Didn't care much for the frozen fries (saw him cook frozen onion rings too). I like my fries really crispy, these were cooked OK but I think I'm just going to try the burgers solo next time. There were 3 others waiting for their orders while the poor guy worked alone as cashier and cook. He was really nice and polite. We forgot to wear our Giants attire, so no discount this time. :(
Street parking, all metered.  They have 2 TVs - one with the Giants game on.  Yay.
author: Ry T.

description: Great burgers! Fries and mozzarella sticks are awesome too. Only downside is that they take forever since there is usually only one or two employees at one time. Try to phone in an order in advance. Seriously good food though. Probably the best burgers in the area. Decent prices too. Oh and they stay open quite late on the weekends.
author: Ron D.

description: I don't know what all the hype is about this place.  I had the hot mess and the patty was over-cooked and bland.  I was very surprised with all the good reviews.  Oh wells, on to the next burger joint.
author: Jocylyn P.

description:
Tried this place out from a Scout Mob deal. Whaadupp...

I had the Mamma-Mia - burger w/ 4 Mozzarella Sticks in it and the bf got the burger with Jalapeno Poppers in it, fries and while having cheese sticks in my burger wasn't enough, let's went wild with more cheese.. Another order of Mozzarella sticks ($3)! 

Overall.. the foods not bad though I can't say it was great. If you got a Scout Mob coupon then use it cause then it'll be TOTALLY WORTH IT.

Mozzarella sticks - good, their usual. Nothing different
Chicken Wings - ordinary. Their good but nothing special
Fries - YUM! Definitely, you'll want Fries with that.

BURGERS..When I think of a burger.. I think juicy, messy and sauces dripping. You know.. like a Carl's Jr commercial. When you bite into a Uncle Boy's burger, it feels like your eating a turkey club sandwich. Nope, not even from Ike's. Sorry but homeboy is dry :( Even with a grease baby like the mamma-mia... dry like a desert. 

They have really cool sounding burgers, sounds delicious though the one's that I have tried just haven't met up to the name. If you don't like juicy burgers then you'll love this place.

Service was really good so I hate to sound so harsh, if it's coming out that way. The server is nice, the place is clean and they open late, 3AM on weekends so I'm sure this will be great after one too many haha.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
I'm Filipino and I have an Uncle Boy so when this place opened up I had to stop in for a burger. I'm not sure if they still have lumpia on the menu, but that and the picture of Manny Pacquiao at the register are the only things linking Uncle Boy's with anything Filipino.
The OG burger is pretty awesome and the assortment of other burgers & chicken based burgers with various topping mixtures should suit pretty much everyone.  If not, then go ahead and augment one of them to your liking.
Burgers, burger-like sandwiches made with chicken or veggie-patty, and various fried items are all they have on the menu, but they make up for it by being open till 3AM.  Way better that Jack-in-the-Box after leaving the bars.
author: Joel F.

description: Decent food at a good price but the staff is a joke. Very rude and I've never gotten hot food. Even when I order inside for pick up.
author: Garrett R.

description:
I ordered the O.G. and added an extra pattie and cheddar cheese.  This burger really hit the spot and the fries were flavorful and ample. I slurped my afternoon meal down with root beer and called it good to go. I share with other reviewers the 'feeling of being in a daze or coma-like state' after supping at Uncle Boy's.

If you're in the mood for a burger and sport on television, you could do a lot worse than Uncle Boy's.
author: Jay D.

description: Was looking for a good local burger. Saw this place every time I drive by. Decided tonight was the night. I had the Pool Boy Burger and my wife had the Cowboy! 100% a really good burger! Definitely returning!
author: Eric B.

description:
To set the record straight these guys have wifi!

They really know how to cook a burger here and not make it complicated. My first time here i ate the O.G. Burger and it was delliiccious. The fries are fried perfectly (crispy on the outside and soft on the inside). They have all of the condiments for a burger lover (thousand oaks and hot sauce) and the variety simple and nice. 
Over all its a really nice atmosphere and a really unexpected experience! 
(it also has two flat screens for all the sport lovers out there)
author: Alice K.

description:
My sister bailed on me for dinner and needed to find a place to get food.  I looked on yelp at a couple places and than found Uncle Boy's and saw they were right down the street!

Called in my order and less than 10 minutes later it was ready!


Super cheap bill, 2 burgers and 2 fries plus onion rings for like 20 bucks! 

and yes, we were super high during this excursion


Food was awesome, none the less.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Great burger joint. Hole in the wall, limited seating. Awesome burgers and fries, friendly staff. Perfect lunch place. Definitely recommend.
author: Justin H.

description: 911!!! The cook was cutting chicken and washed his hands with dish water that he splashed on when handling cooked food. I saw this and walked out ASAP.. What happen to his place??? The owner needs to get back in the kitchen and review all the areas. It's not clean and everything is in the temperature danger zone.
author: Joseph A.

description: If you ever want anyone to order anything from this place for pick up I would suggest answering your phone occasionally. I have called this place on multiple occasions to order food and have eaten here often. I would probably be one of its best customers if they would answer there phone. But after calling 10 times today at different times of the day and not getting any answer I am pretty much done with  this place. Thanks uncle boys it has been swell.
author: Natalie T.

description: The burgers were just ok, they were overcooked and so were the fries. The ambiance is quite bad and it is not very clean inside
author: Lauren W.

description:
How did I not try this place sooner?! I've lived 2 blocks away from this establishment for a year now but have never had the privilege of eating its food until today.

It's super affordable and tasty - its menu has tons of variety and there are some delicious burger combinations. I had the burger with bacon and onion rings. There's one with mozzarella sticks inside the burger (delicious heart attack waiting to happen), and another with jalapeno poppers inside! The french fries are seasoned perfectly and have a good crisp to them!

It's definitely not one of those gourmet burger places you find in SF but it's still a great find. Great food for a good deal, and it's open until 3AM. 

I'm scared to live so close to here.
author: Nami S.

description: great burger, great zucchini chips--hot and fresh
author: Quincy S.

description:
The manager of Uncle Boy's send me a message.

John E. Manager's comment on your review:

hello nobu, I really want to thank you for your most honest opinions, and Manny Pacquio is the savior of the decaying sport of boxing. (Needs a true heavy weight superstar) Anyhow Some of my cooks seem to be folding under pressure when its busy from what your saying, I will need to look into this because as you have said it is an art to make good burgers. The patties should never come out dry our puck like at any time in any situation. Thanks again for you opinion this will help us improve. John E.


So, I replay the message:

nobu k. 42 hours ago
Hi John,
I must say, Thank you for your kind message. I don't know what to say but I would love to come back again.
But, I have a question if I may.
Have you ever had the other burger like Pearl's Phat Burger, Hall of Frame Burger?
If so, What do you think the difference between yours and them?
As  I wrote, I was Uncle Boys for 3 times.

I really hope your burger gets better though.
I really do.

Nobu


He sent me another message:

John E.
Manager

25 hours ago
hello again nobu,

Its my mission to make sure my shop becomes a success and serving burned burgers wont get me there so I have to take all opinions and some how find a solution to all the problems. So the thanks is all to you and others who have taken their time to form an opinion for us.

As to the question I really have not tried either place but now that you have mentioned it I should get around to looking into it.

thanks again and I hope if there is a next time that you come in, that our burgers wont come out burned for you again!!

John

----------------------

I am really appreciate the message from John the manager of Uncle Boy's.
I think the place has potential.
Potential to make a GOOD BURGER!!!
I hope he does, I really do. If he find the difference, the burger will change.
So, I'll go back there again, to review it again.

Sincerely,

Nobu
author: Nobu K.

description: Love this place! I got Ain't No Punk. It's the best veggie burger in SF. It super spicy and yummy. I love the fries too. Only two things need improvement. The drink selection and the seating. Customer service is great.
author: Gretchen L.

description: Ok that was one delicious, straight forward burger.  Well played.
author: David S.

description: This place was great! It seemed like a hole in the wall from the outside. But it was pretty nice inside, and the bathroom was very clean. The guy behind the counter was nice and friendly. The food they made was so fresh. The bacon and burgers were cooked on the spot, and buns were freshly toasted. The fries were also very good.
author: Don M.

description: So the burger was decent. Standard good burger, and the fries were your average frozen fries. But the onion rings were a bit soggy... and the buffalo wings were a bit soft... I prefer my wings crispier.
author: Nancy C.

description: Pretty awesome burgers, though just a tad on the small side. I did not try the fries this time, but I will go back and try them next time. Interesting selection of burgers, and friendly staff.
author: Peter C.

description: Tonight was my third time here and still SOOOOO GOOD....I ordered the O.G. burger with fries.  The burger was good but the fries were AMAZING....they were hot and fresh....perfect seasoning...and they were thick..  My roomie also got a side of fries which she agreed were bomb.
author: Valeh K.

description:
I have eaten a few burgers in San Francisco and so far, nothing has been better than Uncle Boy's. 

I decided to revisit Uncle Boy's for dinner and was thinking about my burger for most of the day. I kept checking the menu to decide which burger I'd try this time. The Hot Mess was my choice and boy was I glad I choose it.

The Hot Mess is a spicy burger, with cheese, bacon, jalapenos and hot mess sauce. It is so spicy, but so good!! 

What sets Uncle Boy's burgers apart is how tender they are. The meat is cooked perfectly and falls apart in your mouth. It's not dense or heavy and there is a very satisfying meat to cheese to bun ratio. Their french fries are also really good and stay crispy for a long time. I really need to try the rest of their menu, I seriously doubt I'd be disappointed.

The atmosphere of Uncle Boy's is great; the guys behind the counter are really nice and when I came in they had the Giants game on. It didn't care at all that I had to wait a few minutes for my to-go order, I got to watch the Giants! 

Overall, they serve pretty awesome burgers. I'm done bothering with the other Richmond burger joints, Burgermeister, and Bistro Burger--they can't touch Uncle Boy's!
author: Sarah M.

description: Most if their staff is really friendly, but all the food is awesome! My favorite burger joint in Richmond, and open to odd hours. Whole place is kind of hole in the wall, and there's only a couple of seats, but it's never very crowded. Pro Tip: eat in, burgers are always better hot off the grill!
author: Hybridchemistry I.

description:
I like that Uncle Boy's stays open late.  It definitely satisfied my burger craving after drinking one too many cucumber gimlets on a Saturday night.  After reminding my boyfriend and friends (sorry guys) that I wanted a burger about 20 times, they finally gave in.  I don't remember what we ordered...I think it was the OG burger?  With Bacon?  Oh yeah.  A great, filling burger with DEEP FRIED BACON.  So yummy.  The fries are yummy and crispy too!  Oh yeah.

The service was great...One of the owners of the place was running the register and he was super nice and welcoming, despite the various amounts of late night eaters and drunkies walking in (ahem...by drunkies, I guess I meant me...)

Another "Good Eats" in my hood!  Woohoo!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Good hole in the wall. I mean hole in the wall. The place says 49 people but if you get 15 people in here you're pretty much having sex with your clothes on. It's hamburgers and dry humping. It's that small. 

 Let's start by saying I hate Filipinos food but this is not. It's a Filipino interpretation of the burger and hot link sandwich. The guy that took our order was really cool. I asked him what was popular and he told me but said I think man's best friend is the best. Let me get it i told him. he hooked it up. the sandwiches was really good and filling.  the menu is very minimal which is cool. its out of the way but not close to anything cool so if you're driving than you might find a parking spot.
author: Paul T.

description: Staff was friendly and the burgers were great, especially the Cowboy burger.  If you like small places with a great food and a great feel, this is the place.
author: Eric R.

description:
My sister and I were craving hamburgers after a rough Saturday night and we used Yelp to find Uncle Boys (Yelp reviews were pretty spot on - thanks!):

Service: this is a one man operation! The guy rings you up and then makes your food on the spot. This might be an issue if it was crowded but we went on a Sunday morning right after they opened and he was friendly/helpful. 

Food: I ordered a jack cheese burger and my sister and I split the $2 'meal deal' which included fries and a soda.  Burger was juicy and well put together and the french fries were hot, crispy and tasty.  Fries are always better right out of the fryer!  It was plenty of food for us to share (my sister got her own burger).

Atmosphere: this is a hole in the wall - as advertised on the menu, 'small place big taste' - that caters to a quick bite and to-go food.  There are a couple two person tables and a flat screen on the wall to watch football on a Sunday morning.  There's nothing fancy or new about it but it is well kept and clean.

Go for it! :)
author: Kerry P.

description:
I moved to the Inner Richmond about 6 months ago and as my boyfriend and I continue our hunt for nommy food in the area, I gotta give Uncle Boy's props. They've only been open for under a year and are still working out the kinks with their menu options, pricing, etc., but every time I go in there the staff are always really nice and get the job done quick. My go-to is the "Unhorsed Cowboy," and really anything with their deep fried bacon is amazeballs. The fries are on the thicker side but seasoned very well. Discount for students and Giants fans. Good dudes doing good business.

(Suggestion - any chance y'all will get some avocado? I'd be all over that.)
author: Allison R.

description:
Uncle Boy's! what a name!

Much like the other Inner Richmond burger joint, Buffalo Burger, the storefront for Uncle Boy's shows exactly what you expect- cheap on price, food in baskets.  It is a narrow place, with small tables that fit 2-3 people at most.  Not idea for big groups.  We hoped up to the window-bar.

At first I thought their prices looked expensive- a burger for $8.95 at a hole in the wall?  But then you realize that the combo comes with both fries and a drink.  On the counter, I could see the handmade patties, a testament to the freshness.  Our server/griller was friendly enough.

I got a Hot Mess, which had hot sauce and jalapeños and slabs of bacon.  For the name, I was expecting an explosion of messy sauce that would make me regret not owning a bib.  (lets be honest- owning a bib makes you regret owning a bib...)  It didn't live up to it's name, as it came neatly wrapped and not that saucy- but was still big on flavor, and huge on size. Also- the burger was beefy bliss!   The meat was flavorful, and the crispy bacon (SLABS i tell you) can never really go wrong.  I could do with a bit more zing, but the burger was still top notch.

The fries were golden and crispy, the inside tender but not mushy.

For a complete meal under 10 bucks (combo w/ tax came out to $9.80), it hit all my requirements.

As we left, the server said, "thanks a lot for dropping by!"

To which I responded, "Oh don't worry- I'll be back."
author: Richard Y.

description:
Things I learned on Saturday August 7:

1. France produces some pretty rocking DJs (Mr. Sam)
2. It's as foggy in the Mission as it is in the Richmond
3. The 38 Geary is no place for multiple bags from Trader Joe's
4. Uncle Boy's make an awesome grilled chicken sandwich

Let's talk about that last one.

It's a small joint, and the guy running the place clearly takes pride in his talent. Simple set-up: pick your meat (beef, chicken or veggie), customize as you please, grill.

Spending only $5 was a nice surprise. Eating it later and discovering this was some of the best chicken I've ever had was an even better surprise. It's about as good as it gets.
author: Jason B.

description:
The name "Uncle Boy's" seems like it should be an establishment on Arrested Development.

My new favorite burger place.  The "Hot Mess" was pretty good, but misnamed, not hot and it wasn't a mess at all, but damn tasty.  Fries were some of the best I've had recently.  I'll definitely be stopping back.  Awesome they are open late too.
author: Andy B.

description: This place is a hole in the wall and I had no idea it was there until the other day!  I got the Mamma Mia and it was delicious.  Definitely give Uncle Boy's a try!
author: Alicia Q.

description:
my boyfriend and i came here recently, and our experience was beyond horrible. it was also extra sad because i was really excited to finally have found a good burger place in the richmond (what are these other reviewers thinking??)!!!

our burgers were cold and overdone, complete with overcooked bacon, and missing the jalapenos. the fries were also cold, yet the zucchini chips were burned. worst part--i think we paid about $30 for the whole mess.

i feel bad because the guy cooking/handling cash was obviously overwhelmed, but maybe they should employ another person or two if he can't handle it solo.
author: Molly E.

description:
Great place to grab a quick burger or bite to eat if you're in the Inner Richmond.  Definitely get the "meal."  I had the O.G. burger meal with onion rings.  They followed my request exactly and we got our food within a few minutes.  
It's a casual place to hang out during the week to get a solid lunch at a good value.  I'd definitely go back.
author: kristen h.

description: Was excited to try this place after finding out about it. Its located on Balboa so its a very quiet and peaceful street. The interior isn't anything nice, but they have a few tables you can sit at. The service was friendly I guess but they were in a rush and didn't really greet us when we walked in and didn't acknowledge us until we said something. Anyways the burgers are good, I got the chicken burger, my friend had the same. My chicken breast was very soft...I usually like tender, but this was too soft and it didn't have the texture of meat, and it wasn't that filling basically. I would return if I was in the area but I've had better. But overall it was filling and at best a 3/5.  Idk about their beef.
author: Natalie Charlotte W.

description:
This place is my after hours go to.  The Mamma Mia is the best!  Burgers are on the larger side and usually stuffed with interesting goodies (mozz sticks, bacon, jalapeno poppers, etc)  They also have chicken alternatives for you non beef eaters.  The staff is always so nice to me and my order is always ready in less than 10 minutes.
It can get pretty busy in here when the bars close - and gets full of rowdy college kids - so plan to call in advance and pick up after 2am.
The menu is pretty basic: burgers, chicken sandwiches, hot link sandwiches, fried sides and lumpia (when it is available).
My favorite thing to do is check out the Giants calendar while waiting for my food - or peruse the beer choices in the small fridge.
Love this place!
author: Carmel U.

description: Their staff is always nice. I always get their vegetarian stuff, as a vegetarian, and it's always great, clean, fresh tasting.
author: Sahil V.

description: These burgers are big, juicy, hot, and delicious! My favorite has always been the cowboy with bacon, cheese, bbq sauce, onion rings. The fries are perfectly seasoned too! The place is pretty small, maybe 10ish seats and is very...casual. Come hungry!
author: Britt T.

description:
I...think...I'm...going...to...have....a....heart attack.

I ordered the Hip-Popper,  a 1/3 lb. of angus beef topped with jalapeño poppers, cheese, and lettuce with jalapeño spread on a toasted bun. The thing must weigh about a pound and I couldn't even wrap my mouth around it. I had to whip out the knife and fork just to get through the burger. The burger is flame broiled, and you can taste that in the burger when you bite into it. The good thing about this burger is the juiciness, but the bad thing is that it's because of the fat that's still in the burger. My burger was cooked medium well (the way I like it), so props to the cook for not overdoing it.

Overall, the burger is pretty heavy, and if you have high cholesterol and watching your weight, you might want to avoid this place. However, if you're looking for something guilty to indulge yourself with, you should come here and get a burger.

The prices are okay...not cheap but not expensive either. It was about $8 with my college ID discount (10%).
author: Winnie T.

description: So easy. So tasty. So good. This place is legit. Good food. Friendly people and a chill atmosphere. Can't get much better. Burgers. Fries. Chicken strips. Boom! Get some. Cash only though! Yelp says credit allowed, and they is wrong. Word up! Enjoy
author: Ezra B.

description: The bugers here are amazing! Great little spot with awesome service, a great menu and tons of great SF Giants stuff up on the walls. I just moved into the area and this is my new burger place! Give it a try if you are at alll in the area, you won't regret it!
author: Tyler L.

description: Unimpressive looking on the outside but a hidden gem (or close to it) on the inside. The SF memorabilia adds a nice local touch and makes me feel nostalgic for a time I never experienced. Service is good, but as a warning, they supposedly close at 10 pm but when we went in at 8:50 pm, they changed their sign to "closed" and were only really taking phone orders, so I would call first if it's late in the night. We ordered the hot mess and pool boy burgers with fries. Fries I would pass on; they were too "potato-y" if you know what I mean.. not bad but I like my fries thinner and crispier. But damn, my hot mess burger was amazing. Perfectly indulgent, juicy, and the right amount of spiciness. Bacon was perfectly crisp. The hot mess was a lot fluffier than my bf's pool boy burger though, so I had to use like 20 napkins to eat my burger since it was so big and dripping all over the place. Perfect place to stop by if you want some fast, good quality grub.
author: Jacqueline K.

description: Great burgers & amazing fries with some kick ass chipotle. Friendly and very accomadating staff...
author: Craig T.

description: Came here on a late night hype because I didn't want to go to jack in the box and the burger was fat, tasted fantastic and just was a good deal. I got a double cheeseburger for 10 bucks and it was huge!!!!! Completely worth it.
author: Johnny Q.

description: This place is amazing!!! Best burger and veg burger in SF. For veg lovers the ain't no punk is incredible!
author: Maya G.

description:
Food is great, the food is for the people not for profit.
Burgers were great, bacon is real full sized bacon, fries were well seasoned, and prices were reasonable. 

Atmosphere feels man cave-esq, sports memorabilia on the walls, a two TVs, a PS3 (I've seen them play 'Hey Arnold!' at 12AM on Netflix).

Location is small, humble.
Maximum capacity is definitely not what is says on the sign (I think it may have been 50?)
author: Steven L.

description: F*** you uncle boys maybe you should stay open if you actually f****** were open on the f***** actual hours that you said you were. Here is starving at 2:15 a.m. When you should be open till 3 a.m....that you're not so f*** you
author: Cliff L.

description:
It's been over a year since my first review of this place. Since then, I have been here at least once every two weeks for an entire summer and at least once every month when I'm flown into SF for work.

Still. Killing. It.

If you have doubts, don't. Everything is good. Everything. The only sandwich I have yet to try are the sausage ones, and I'm sure those are good as well.

Protip - ask for a little cup of pesto to have with your fries. 

Uncle Boy's, I want to thank you for satisfying my burger cravings whenever I'm in the area. There's nothing quite like enjoying a hot mess with fries and sprite after a long day of dealing with 12 screaming 10 year olds.
author: Jae S.

description: This is one of the best burger places in SF. Seriously. The burgers are amazing - fresh, flavorful and good portions for your money. The fries are great too (sometimes you'll like a burger joint but the fries suck but not this place). There's a TV to watch sports, staff is very friendly. Parking is easy the few times I've been. They accept credit cards too which is nice. I'm super happy and impressed. It is a small place - 3 tables and a bar and some Giants/ sports decor. The kitchen is in plain view and super clean. This is my new burger place!!!!!
author: Alyson M.

description:
This place is really close to where I live so location is great. The place it self is a bit on the small side. But, they make up for it with a couple of flat screen TVs, esp. if you're  trying to catch a game or two. Originally a cash only establishment, they now accept cards. Not too sure if there is a minimum.

WIth all the choices of burgers and others mentioned on the menu, I played it safe and ordered a veggie burger and got some chicken wings on the side to go. Burger was good. Not too dry. The wings, on the other hand, were a bit on the salty side. The ranch dressing kind of helped to rid the saltiness. 

When I visited, it was manned by only one person. It wasn't completely busy, so people didn't mind waiting for their food. At least it comes out fresh and the guy took the time to prepare it well. 

I'd still go back...to try the other clever named burgers on the menu. I think the place is also semi-Filipino. They carried lumpia before. haha
author: Shall P.

description:
I didn't think I'd like Uncle Boy's, but I actually do.  A stopped by last week to pick up a burger to snack on.  I believe he got a nephew burger or something.  It's pretty much a regular burger, but with pesto inside.  I love pesto!  He also got an order of fries.  I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE their fries.  I think it's the seasoning they put on it, but it tastes so good!

Anyway, we went back again this week because A liked his first burger so much.  This time he got the OG burger, which I think is just like his nephew burger, except without the pesto.  I got the Mama Mia burger, which had fried mozzarella sticks in it plus marinara sauce.  It was huge.  And it was filling.  He also got two orders of fries.  Ah, the fries!

If there's a lot of people, expect a wait.  The two times we've been there, it's just been one guy running the place, so he took the orders, collected the cash, and made the burgers and fries.  Even though we were the only people there both times, we still had to wait a while.  But was it worth the wait.

Oh yes it was!
author: Kris L.

description: Was in the neighborhood and my son wanted a burger and fries. The worker said that the fryer was broken so all they had on the menu to offer was burgers.  I asked for a bacon cheeseburger nothing on it. The cashier asked about condiments and I said light mayo light ketchup only. He read my order back twice after writing it down. So when we get the burger it had everything we did not want on it... Extra mustard, onions, pickles tomato, lettuce. Did not even see any ketchup or mayo. Never mind that we were the ONLY customers in there at the time...still could not get the order right. ..oh well...gave it a shot.
author: Cookee L.

description: I honestly am surprised to see this place have 4 stars. Despite playing good music and displaying all kinds of niners memorobilia inside, the food was average at best. For one, I was disappointed in the fries which were tasteless and soggy. The Niece chicken sandwich I ordered was also subpar as there was to much mayo and not enough pesto. The chicken was slightly rubbery as well. Maybe I should give the burger a shot...?
author: Eric B.

description:
In theory I should have loved this place but in reality I can only say that I liked it. I mean this place has got a great neighborhood feel, extremely friendly staff, and a convenient location for us inner richmond dwellers. AND well, it's a burger place that delivers and is open til 3am. So I guess what's not to like ... right? The menu encompasses all your late night needs: burgers, corn dogs, wings and all the fried accompaniments! But I think the one thing that left a bad taste in my mouth, literally and figuratively, about the place was the lumpia. I mean this place is called uncle boys ... I (and I'm sure all the other Filipinos who actually have and uncle/ tito boy) expect this place to have better mastered the art of this filipino delight! 

After weeks, if not months, of talking to my roommates about this place we finally made it in on a night, starving and looking for that perfect comfort food after a long day. And like I said it's got all your late night needs, so it definitely hit the spot. The portions are big enough to incite a bit of a food coma in a 'Im pretty satisfied' way. I can only speak for the cheeseburger ... and the bread was a bit of a standout (its baked fresh by a local city bakery, which is a sure way to get points with me), nicely toasted but pretty overwhelming given its proportion to the actual burger and all the fixings. The meat itself could have been juicer, but if your looking for that outdoor barbeque flavor its there! 

Overall this place has okay food and quality service. And although i'm sure they didn't set out to be a SF culinary jem, there's just no denying that they could step up their game in the kitchen.
author: Dominique C.

description: Drove by this place a few times and decided to check out what they had to offer and was the thing that caught my eyes were the interesting names they gave the burgers. The poolboy was pretty good with the fried mozzarella cheese sticks that I wasn't expecting. The place itself was kind of small, but the staff was really friendly.
author: Jackie L.

description:
Excellence. I first walked into Uncle's Boy moments prior to the shoppe's closing time. They helped me with my biggest problem-my bellowing belly. Besides enticing signage and a reasonable spaced bathroom, I noticed some decent looking girls in there eating big and filling looking hamburgers, so I knew I'd enjoy my meal. I asked the counter Uncle Boy what the females had ordered and told him to fry me up the same thing. It was delicious and made the girls think I had good taste, because I'm pretty sure they saw that I bought what they were eating. I'll probably fill a 'missed connection' after this review.

Booty Line: Good, crispy, lots of tasteful sauces and decent other customers.
author: Merland S.

description: This place keeps it simple, and I like that.  They give you fresh, high quality burgers and fries for a low price.  This is where my husband and I go when we're craving a burger and I don't feel like cooking.  The space itself is modest, very small and low-budget.  The people get your order out quick, but they aren't terribly friendly.  Regardless, I'm a fan!
author: Jade F.

description:
I will accept no other burger place. 

They have gotten even better since they have expanded their menu. When they first opened it was pretty bare minimum stuff, now they have added a number of specials (including a vegetarian one) with names like "Ain't No Punk" etc. Awesome. 

The only thing I can say about uncle boys is that they used to be open later, so they lose a star for that unfortunately. Uncle Boys is local and it rules. I can't ask for much more.

On a side note, the staff are awesome. For example, one time I was kind of drunk and decided I needed some UB. So I went, ordered to go and tipped the guys and left. When I got back to my friend's house 2 blocks away I realized that the 20 dollar bill I thought I had in my wallet was gone. I thought immediately of the supposed 1 dollar tip I had left in the jar.

 I went back sheepishly and asked if I could check and see if I left a 20. Instead of giving me shit or even just refusing like many would, they said "No problem man, of course!" and let me go through it. When I couldn't find it, they offered to REIMBURSE me. A stranger. With an admittedly fishy story. I said no, it was fine, thanked them and left.

 Only the next morning did I realize that I had used the 20 to pay a debt I owed to my friend earlier that night. The experience sticks in my head though, those guys are excellent and I wish them nothing but good times in the future!

Edit: one more star for the reply
author: Jay C.

description:
LOL. Came here after a heavy night of drinks. 

The guys here must love me, I think I tipped them like $8 for some lumpia.

Mmmm. Lumpia.
author: Pamela R.

description:
Seriously, what's not to like about a local burger joint? Tightly packed inside a paper sleeve, the standard hamburger is cheap, tasty and made to order with fresh toppings. 

Not only are the hamburgers good, but the staff are really friendly. Unfortunately, it's cash only but they do have an ATM inside, but for a fee. 

 There is nothing fancy about it and that is just fine with me. Uncle Boy's is just another fine example of what makes the Inner Richmond great.
author: William S.

description:
I pass this place on the 31 Balboa , and because its a friday night, end of the week, did't want to cook. Decided to try it out. I  order cheese burger and a side a fries.  You can really have it your way here. The fries were hot and tasty and the burger was yummy!. Everything fresh.  I was confused by the name , I was told that the Filipino owner named the place. Apparently everyone that is Filipino has a Uncle Boy in their family. I'm still not sure what the connotation of this explanation means? But it was said ,so that i took all is good. It's a small place , but clean. A USF Student work behind the counter and customers are also students.  I will definetly be back, the prices are very reasonable.

 So hold the pickle, hold the lettuce, special orders don't upset us, All we ask is that you let us serve it your way.
author: Susie S.

description: i love this place, its small but it has real neighborhood character and the Hip Popper burger and staff keep me coming back all the time.
author: Sylvie M.

description:
open late with tasty fries :D
Burger was cooked right.
Price is worth it.
definitely coming back during the late night hours of the summer.
author: Jason L.

description: Solid burger and chicken sandwich joint - nothing over the top.  Solid menu of burgers and chicken sandwiches - small little place and worth sitting down (haven't tried to go yet) to eat on site - can't really play in the Umami Burger realm, but that is not their intention here.
author: Richard D.

description:
We had eaten here a few times when it was under the old management- food was always good, but it was a nasty experience. The staff was always bickering, yelling at the delivery driver, barking at customers. Just awful! 
Not so on my recent visit.  The new management kept the food delicious while  treating the customer AND one another with respect. Somehow my food tasted better. I'll be back!
author: Corrie C.

description:
Uncle Boy's is so homey and comfortable, especially on a winter evening. The staff is personable and makes me feel at home. They recognize their loyal customers well and treat everybody like family.

Forgive me for being redundant in the previous paragraph; that's just the impression I got when I visited earlier this week. I went for just some lumpia since I wasn't too hungry. The lumpia was basic, but the great service magnified the delicious flavors in the rolls.

There's room to sit either at tables or along the window; might be nice to stare out onto Balboa after a long day's worth of work.

Last night, I made my brother go to Uncle Boy's and get burgers to-go since I wanted to try the burgers at least once before we moved out of the Richmond. The hamburger buns are fluffy and large; the burgers themselves are chockful of patty, lettuce, tomato, and condiments. Not overly fancy, but hey, Uncle Boy's does not disappoint, especially adding the atmosphere and kind service into the equation.

The prices are reasonable, and, if you'd like, you can order the burger meals, which I believe come with fries and a drink (I can't quite remember). They're open until late (3am on some nights); soon they'll have beer, so Uncle Boy's should be a destination for all you nightowls.

They accept credit card as well, which is a plus. Overall, I like the place a lot! I just wish I weren't moving out of the area since Uncle Boy's is relatively new. Oh well; will just go out of my way to get a burger now.
author: Helene K.

description:
No fancy schmancy stuff here. I like that.

Most places in this city make a huge deal about how great their burgers are, and I'm always left feeling jipped. Sure, they used some kind of crazy cheese, or unusual bread, but it's still just a burger. What was it my uncle used to say? "You can put an evening dress on a hog, but it's still just a hog." Something like that.

Uncle Boy's doesn't make any claims about being awesome. It just is awesome. The staff is friendly, the customer service is great and the burgers are solid. The ambiance of the place is a bit "white walls meet neon lights" but that's ok, just get  your food to go.

Oh, and as someone who was spoiled at a young age by the onion rings at the WI State Fair, let me tell you, Uncle Boy's has good onion rings.
author: Dan W.

description: I got the hotdog and I was less than thrilled. It was really dry and completely fell apart in the first bite. If you're looking for a good hotdog place this wouldn't be my first choice.
author: Yana B.

description:
I specifically joined Yelp so I could review this place. I live literally a block away, and I've tried to give tis hamburger joint the benefit of the doubt time and time again, but the food is not worth the price. A cheeseburger meal is almost 10 dollars, and for that you get a (usually) undercooked hamburger patty with a disappointing serving of fries. Also, as of 09/04/2010 they've raised their prices (again!), which hardly makes this place worth the trip.

If you're looking for a mediocre burger within walking distance, then go here. But if you'd like a decent meal at a decent price, then you might as well walk to buffalo burger or drive to in-n-out (essentially the same quality food at half the price)  or some other burger joint - believe me, this place will disappoint you, save your appetite for someplace worth it.
author: Alex H.

description:
1. Excellent customer service, I came in and was greeted with a cheerful, "How you doing today?" and was immediately asked for my order. He double checked my order and immediately passed it off to the cook.

2. While the burgers were cooking I was given a free drink while I waited, and the owner asked me if what was on TV was OK, or if I preferred a different channel.

3. When I left, the people working there wished me a good night. The entire time the owner was chatting with customers and being very friendly to everyone in there.

My only complaint was that my hamburger was undercooked, but that happens when you're cooking your burgers by hand on a flaming grill.

Oh, and the fries are flippin' awesome!
author: Allison K.

description:
I read about this place in the RichmondSF Blog and the wife agreed we should check it out. It was a very good decision.

We parked and walked in and noticed right away it's more of a diner, than a restaurant but we found a way to make it work.  I mean, we were coming for the lumpia and the hamburgers, not a candlelight affair so we weren't too worried.

We ordered a hamburger meal, a chicken sandwich meal with a side of Lumpia and an extra side of fries for our daughter (who is very picky, and learned that night she likes Lumpia.)

The hamburger was simply amazing. The meat was fresh, soft and you could taste the seasonings, but more so, you could taste the meat. The char was an extra gift, it gave it that rustic flavor. The bun was a bit disproportionate to the size of the burger, only meaning it had way more bread than the burger had meat. The chicken sandwich was juicy and my wife enjoyed it very much, but the bread ratio kind of made it drier than it should have been.

The Lumpia was very nice, but the vinegar sauce that came with it, was epic. The fries are apparently soaked then fried to order and were amazing as well. The pepper is nice, but I think maybe on the side would be better or just some warning. My daughter and wife aren't the pepper fan I am, but again, not a big deal.

We walked out that night with full tummies and a sense of pride that we ate at a restaurant wherein the cook was very thankful, honest and humble. I haven't seen very many business owners on Yelp actually ASK for input to make their food better, or even care about what the diner eats. Here in the Richmond, I think we can say we are very aware of what is good and bad and eat accordingly. Uncle Boy's prices are great, and in-tune with what they are feeding you. You want a named celebrity burger that has no real personality, then go to Bills.  If you want a great burger made by people that really care about what they are feeding you, then go to Uncle Boy's.

Update - We ordered delivery a few weeks later. I probably wouldn't do that again. Hamburgers need to be hot as well as fries, and they both came lukewarm. The food tasted great, after the toaster oven did it's magic. Just be ready. It's probably easier to just order ahead, double park and run in.
author: Edward P.

description: Best walking distance burgers in san francisco
author: Tyrod B.

description:
It all started one morning on my way to my morning carpool. I walked down Balboa instead of Cabrillo and came across a spot that sold both burgers and chicken wings. Could life be any more better? More convenient?

The food is tasty, oh yes. I love the chicken wings and the Bacon Link Sandwich, which has a very unique taste. I really wanted to love and to support a local burger business.

Turns out that I got my hopes up though...every one of the three times (over the course of a month) I have called for delivery, it'll either take too long (over 45-60 minutes) or there are problems with the driver, thus no service.

The other day, I call to inquire about delivery and get (for me) the traditional, "sorry, no delivery today." Okay, fine, I will go for pick-up in that case. Before I had the chance to say that I would come in for pick-up, the phone goes dead. 

That's right, someone hung up the phone before I had the option to say that I could pick up the food. That just completely turned me off from ever ordering from there again. I didn't even bother trying to call back because just hanging up (no matter how busy you are) is just bad service, not to mention rude.

I know the Uncle Boy's folks OBSESSIVELY read the Yelp reviews, so please note that you have lost two local customers.
author: Jules M.

description:
my husband started his business in the same area at about the same time.  I wanted to support and patronize.  also, i have been close to pinoy culture all my life. the food is fine.  it's not freaking burger bar, but ideally, so much better, you know? i want to support my local peeps. 
but check your order when you get it, make sure its legit.  i had a few mistakes on my order from them, and wow, they got clueless and ugly fast.  no accountability.  gosh, i feel so bad because over all the food and their vision is great.
author: yayoi s.

description:
This place is awesome... It's tiny inside - so we got take-out. The owners are the nicest guys ever.

It's like if you went into your backyard and ordered the perfect burger... The bun was great - the patty hand rolled, it's more of a burger bar made-to-order, and the fries even better.

The best part about this place is they're open super late, and they deliver. HELLO. Who needs pizza when you can get Uncle Boys at 230am?? Thank god.
author: Chelsea D.

description:
I really love this place. Ok, I've never actually *been* to this place, but when they were delivering, gosh was it good. You could have burgers with bacon, sausage with bacon, bacon with bacon. Oh yeah, Sunday football with fries, onion rings, a sausage/bacon sandwich and a big ole' burger. Wow was it good. I use the past tense because they seem to have stopped delivering, so I haven't had it in a few months. If I'm ever in the area, I'll certainly consider eating there, but I just never get to over there. 

If they do start delivering again, I'll likely be their best customer and you'll all see me running frantically around the city to burn off the calories.
author: erin s.

description:
Open till 3 am.

That is all you need to know. What else matters?

Order the hamburger rare. They overcook it. 

On a hamburger scale I give it a 6/10. I'd do it and tell my friends but I wouldn't brag too too much.

The fries are great and the sauces top notch; pesto, chipotle, and other spreads.
author: James B.

description: No fancy burger to be found here.  If you want your standard, backyard burger, this is the place to go.  I had the regular cheeseburger with fries and was very happy.  Too many restaurants in SF these days are obsessed with "grass fed," "organic," "sustainable," etc...  but what if I want something simple?  Uncle Boy's provides just that.  A burger without the frills but is oh so satisfying to the taste buds and belly as long as you're not a foodie snob.  I went during the daytime so I have no idea what it's like at night.  It is open very late so if you are ever craving a non-bougie, tasty burger at any time of the day, whether it's at lunchtime or into the wee hours of the night, come here.
author: Justine L.

description:
So good on so many levels.

Usually burger joints skimp on their veggie burger prep - I've had a ton of soggy, burnt or bone-dry veggie burgers from places famous for their excellent hamburgers. But Uncle Boy's prepares your burger perfectly - whether it's vegetarian or a meaty bacon cheeseburger. 

My boyfriend and I decided on Uncle Boy's for lunch one afternoon because it was conveniently located, budget friendly and he was craving a cheeseburger. When we walked in, I was immediately impressed with the clean, gimmick-free facilities. Uncle Boy's is definitely NOT trying too hard to be hip. 

One man was working at the time and he did an excellent job of preparing food for the other patrons, taking our order in a timely manner and serving our orders quickly. As he was cooking our food, he double-checked with us to make sure he was preparing things correctly - I appreciated that a lot. 

When we finally got the food, I was in heaven. A couple of SoCal friends were going to just stop by and say hi, but I suggested they try a burger and they too were pleased.

I got a veggie burger with jack cheese and onion rings. It was  excellent, and after a few hours, I didn't have the usual greasy stomach pains that often follow such delicious fare.

My boyfriend got a bacon burger with american cheese. It smelled so delicious that I had to sneak a bite... It was good. Real good. If I wasn't afraid of a horrible meat-induced stomachache later, I probably would have nommed his burger as well. (When you've been a vegetarian for a long time, suddenly eating meat is very difficult on your stomach, although my tastebuds would not have complained...)

Last, but not least... that evening, when I went home, I excitedly told my dad about Uncle Boy's. To you, that may seem meaningless, but to me, that's the mark of a perfect burger.
author: Christine K.

description:
I have been to this place a few times, and it has been great each and every time I have gone. It's easily accessible by the 31, and it's not hard to find. 

I usually get the unhorsed cowboy, because it's a great combo, but all the burgers that they cook are fresh every time. Most combos are not too expensive, and the employees are always nice and helpful. I only took off one star because it's such a small place, but the food and overall quality are great!
author: Sean F.

description: Best burger in the neighborhood. Great place. Kind staff.
author: Josh F.

description:
I stumbled into this joint after a long walk through Golden Gate Park and an even longer session of pool at pub a block down. 

I am very happy that this was the first burger joint I decided to try since moving to the Richmond because it's freakin' delicious. The french fries are probably my favorite, they're seasoned just to my liking so I have the option to forgo ketchup if I so choose. Not to mention that my burger, I'm a traditionalist, was tasty tasty.
author: Liliana Q.

description: Yummy! I'm not too big on fast food generally because its unhealthy but I heard so many great reviews from this place and I must say I was more than satisfied with my order! I've only been here twice but the employees are always super friendly and patient with me while I sit and try to decide what I want. the sauces are delish and I love their location ( on my way home from work) not to mention there's always parking! Yay thanks for being awesome uncle boys!
author: Julie F.

description:
Relief. Finally a non-Asian food spot on our block. Open late. Simple, stripped-down menu. Burgers, wings, fries. Perfect for the late night boozer or the afternoon bong session.

I had a go at the burger and have zero complaints. And I can guarantee that once that new grill gets seasoned up its going to be even better. The simplicity really ties in here. Everything is fresh as hell and basic. No faffing off trying to decide on what to eat. I still have the wings to try, but I'm looking forward to it.

The place is small though. And it was packed with a bunch of loud kids that seemed to know someone working there. If i went there with a bunch of friends, I'd be pretty annoyed, especially after drinking all night.

Other than that, this a new business that this block NEEDS!  Its about time someone came in and did something different. All the best to these guys.
author: aidan m.

description:
I lived 2 blocks away from here and ordered from here quite a bit, I'm not gonna lie.  BUTTTT it was only because it's open late and I ordered it when I was drunk because Nizarrio's wouldn't deliver but Uncle Boy's did because my drunk ass did not want to walk 2 blocks after coming home and being too stupid to pick up food on the way.  

The burger is always a hit or miss which is why I keep getting it, hoping it'll be a hit because when it is, it's pretty good - and that's not the drunk me talking.  It's the "I sobered up because it took kinda longer than I thought it would" me talking.  But I'm not complaining too much because I'm sure they hate me for making them deliver even though I lived 2 blocks away.  The fries are good too - pretty darn crispy.  

I want to write more about this place, but that's basically the only memorable stuff about them.  Burgers are good when they're good, bad when they're bad.
author: Anna C.

description:
I have been a proud customer of Uncle Boys ever since a friend introduced me a couple months ago. Every other visit it seems like the owners get friendlier and friendlier. The discouraging comments on some of the other reviews were very hard to read in that Uncle Boys is only trying to get better and improve their quality of food and service. 

There are many attributes that are worthy of praise. First of all, the prices are very reasonable, like no other place around it. Secondly, free delivery to anywhere in the surrounding neighborhoods?! 

It is apparent that the food can be better, but its pretty easy to tell that all they want to do is satisfy their customers. 

All I can say is I'm hooked to Uncle Boys. From their friendly atmosphere to the cheap prices- Keep it up.
author: Eugene G.

description:
I see what the other folks are talking about with there being a few "kinks" to work out.  When I went there today the soda dispenser was out of Coke syrup (no biggie, I just had Fanta), there was no clear place to put the baskets they serve your food in when you're done, and the mat on the bathroom floor was a little slippery.

But that aside, the food was great!  I had a "Boy's Nephew" burger with a side of cheese sticks.  It came with fries.  A little on the pricey side... think it came to about $15.  And I couldn't find street parking even though it was a slow time of day, and fed the meter an additional $1.50.

But all in all, enjoyed the meal.  Would go back.
author: Christopher M.

description: Omg!!! I order the hot mess and it was absolutely amazing.  For those who love spicy food.  The burger was fille with hot sauce and jalapeño. Mmmmm mmmmm good.  I also thought the hot wings was really good but my friend said it was a little bit salty. I didn't think so.  I thought it was hot n fresh.  Well if your ever around the neighborhood you gotta try it. Also they serve beer and they also open til 3 am for those drunk ass after the club.  Plus plus
author: Jenny C.

description:
Looks like it opened on Dec. 1. Seen it from the bus a few times while it was under construction. Will check it out shortly.
 - - -

Checked it out. Super simple place -- simple in a good way. Just a few items (burger, chicken sandwich, wings, nuggets, bacon-hotdog), and fries and onion rings. Burger was tasty -- flame grill. Fries, which are hand cut right there, are, too.  The nuggets were prepackaged, and could benefit from a quality upgrade.

 - - -

January 23, 2010 update, replying to reply from business -- Sorry for my delay. Everything I ate there was good, except the nuggets. I think when you have grilled burgers, and hand-cut fries, you're setting a relatively high standard that generic chicken nuggets aren't going to match. The nuggets tasted like processed food, which is what they are. Is there a better grade of nuggets you could get?
author: OuterLands X.

description:
You are reading the words of a man that is now sold on Uncle Boy's. 

The Owner messaged me right after I griped about the credit card limit, and promised to make an adjustment. What a stand up guy, right? 

Places like this need to stay around, show your support. Eat here!!!!
author: kenton y.

description:
I love this place, I go here more than my arteries would like. I do wish they would go back to hand cut fries though and bring back lumpia. WHY NO MORE LUMPIA WHYY?! :[

I also really love the new special burgers. I got the "unhorsed cowboy" last week, bacon cheese beef onion rings and a deeelish sauce. Totally rocked my life. My boyfriend got the big popper or something... it had jalapeño poppers and cheese and sour cream. snagged a bite, though i liked my cowboy more his was still good.

If you haven't tried uncle boys yet, you're missing out. I love having an option other than chinese and pizza. Yeah they're open late, but go at a normal time when you'll actually remember how good the food was the next day.
author: Jenn F.

description: Great burgers, great fries, great price. We ordered the Unhorsed Cowboy, Pool Boy and fries. The flavor combinations were fantastic. Great burgers, great toppings, and the seasoned fries were also great. Do not expect a fancy restaurant, white glove service or white linens - just great food at a very reasonable price.
author: Jim H.

description:
Based on the reviews here, I really wanted to like this place. No frills menus unabashedly trying to give you a heart attack are generally the key to my heart.

When I arrived I was the only person in the place, and there was confusion over whether or not I had even ordered, followed by a debate over who was going to go on break.

This though, didn't contribute to my rating, since it's a new place I figure they're obviously working things out, and it's not like I was in a hurry anyway.

But the food...the fries were a soggy mess, with wings to match, even though they were prepared in front of me. The wings tasted like something out of a frozen food package; the fries like wet salt logs.

Maybe I just hit a bad day, or should've ordered a burger, but right now I'm not excited to go try again.
author: Preston G.

description:
I just had to post this review because of how incredible the burger is.  My wife are foodies... we could care less about ambience etc and if you just want a really good burger, this is the place to go.  

Their menu has a good burger for anyone... enough options for different tastes while not being ovewhelming.  The meat is fresh and perfectly cooked and every burger we ordered was extremely flavorful.  It was filling and we just could not put down the burger.  The fries were steak fries that were excellent and we ate them cold (because of our dilly-dallying) just because we were too impatient to re-heat them.  

I have no idea how anyone can complain about the prices when you get such quality food and decent portions.  I don't give 5 stars easily... but this just became our favorite burger joint in the city!
author: Anan K.

description:
Well I just found a new favorite burger spot. I'm fairly certain that I just had the best burger in my life here a few minutes ago. Bacon monterey jack cheese burger w/ fries and a coke for $10.35. Oh. And the bacon is deep fried. Huh? WHAT!?

This is easily one of those places where you can eat yourself stupid. "huh, what just happened? where'd my burger go? i want moarr."

So fucking good.
author: Jon U.

description:
If you're looking to grub on a well-made tasty burger this is your place.  Girls, this is not the place to bring your new "diet."  Let loose--they make a mean burger & they are masters with the deep fryer.   

I've had a few burgers from this place, both were good.  The HOT Mess is my favorite.  It's a spicy sauced topped creation with bacon.... Well, not just any kind of bacon, deep fried to a crispy, yummy, textural surprise when you bite into your pile of messy meaty goodness.  The Cowboy also has deep fried bacon, but adds deep fried onion rings to the stack.  The fries come from a bag in the freezer, but are well cooked by a nice staff behind the counter.
author: Jolie N.

description: Good place. Burger was juicy and tasty and the fries were crispy. I got the Pool Boy and was very satisfied. I would definitely return again. However, I do hope the male employees do not talk about man-scaping again like they did when I was there with my girlfriend. It made every chew a bit awkward.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
Burgers  available up to 3:00am! 

Located in a isolated part of  Richmond District semi-residential area!

Limited menu. 

The zuchinni fries was not greasy and spiced just right.


Strong points
  - Open Late Nite
  - Sells hamburger (healthier and bored of pizza at late hours)
  - ? I think their fries are hand cutted ... will double check 
  - Very friendly staff and owner
  - Lot of potential in standing above the rest
                  (will attract more customer outside the area)


Potential hit if improve on...
     Hamburger buns are too thick
     Oil or butter brushed buns grilled  (not the electric griddle)
     Offer options like thicker patty (more juicier)(willing to pay more)
     Need timer so medium rare is medium rare ..fully cooked 5 times
                                                rare is rare .... came fully cooked 4 times
     TV tuned for customer sitting around waiting... not themselves
                I saw bored customer with nothing to do
                make it more customer friendly... 1 for sports 
                                                                            2nd  ... depend on customer
      Move non important stuff out of the dining area and out of sight
      

Friendly advice to owner
      Need metal shelves to keep organized and look professional
      Need to keep listening to advises, 
                      be aware of hidden customer opinion facial expression,
                (people are too polite to dish out critical opinion)
                "It's perfect" ...ordered medium rare...ended up fully cooked
                                      ...dry buns
                                      ...overly thick buns
                 Read all the post on this site...  

Place got hidden potential...
      Pay attention to negative comments posted here and other places
author: S.K. Y.

description:
I was a little disappointed when I came in asking for a mushroom burger and they didn't have mushrooms, but my disappointment dissipated after he explained that they were a fairly new establishment. 

Looking at their menu, it's pretty extensive and great as hangover food - jalapeno poppers and cheese sticks in burgers? Yum! 

I decided to go with their chicken burger in the end (trying to be healthy) but unfortunately, it didn't live up to my expectations. I think I should have splurged and went with a real beef burger because my boyfriend's burger was pretty good. The onion rings and fries are great but nothing out of the ordinary.

It is a great neighborhood spot and the people working the place are really friendly! I love friendly neighborhood spots and this place definitely gets my thumbs up. They also deliver... burgers DELIVERED! Another thumbs up!
author: Christina B.

description: I'm fortunate that this little gem is within walking distance of my home. I stop in and grab a burger or chicken sandwich every couple of weeks. Their fries rock too!
author: Onllwyn D.

description:
I wish there were more uncle boys, I was so sad when had to move to the east bay. The food is amazing best burgers in the city hands down.
Some must tries
Hip Popper (add bacon)
Unhorsed Cowboy 
Hot Mess (make it a double)
Tweety and Porky (awesome chicken sandwich)

The hot link sandwiches are rocking.
author: Jay S.

description:
I've been looking for a good burger place ever since moving here. Still no luck. We just picked up food from here, and I can honestly say I've never had a worse fast food experience.

1. We ordered two burgers, one with bacon & lettuce and the other with bacon & ketchup. We sat down and the guy immediately put our fries in the bag. Ten minutes later he put the burgers in the bag. The fries were already cold.

2. We get back to the car and check the burgers. No patties. Yeah, I'm not kidding. We march back and state nicely that there are no patties. The dude argues with us that we didn't order patties. Why on earth would we go to a burger place and just order bacon in patties (and pay $11 per person for the privilege)??

3. They made two other groups' orders before making our patties. They did not remake our fries. Everything is in the oven as I write this, and we only live a 2-minute drive from the burger joint.

Won't ever be coming here again. The quest for a decent SF burger joint continues.
author: Henny B.

description:
Man, boy did this suck!! Came in today at around 7:40pm, and didn't see the usual smiling John there. That should had been a bad sign for me because the first time I went there, the burger was alright, but the fries were really good. 

THIS TIME, the burger was way overcooked and burnt, the fries were super salty and over fried as well, and damn....even my Coke tasted burnt for some reason. You guys need to be consistent even when Johny boy isn't there! 

I got curios when I saw chicken nuggets and of course what was I thinking!! They tasted like the stuff you got when you were in 5th grade at the cafeteria. 

Anyways, it really sucked this time!!
author: Run Sing M.

description: Uncle Boys.  I like your burgers and your fries.  But you guys pick up your phone like one in every 4 times I call.  I'm often on my way to/from your neighborhood and want to pick something up on my way.  If you picked up your phone every time we'd do a lot more business.  No problems with the food just with no phone pickup.  Take my business, you are appreciated in this area but you must pickup your phone.
author: Molly C.

description:
Close to USF, tasty, and delivers! 

Definitely recommend the bacon link. Crispy bacon, plump hot link in a toasted bun with all the dressing. With fries with our meal puts it about $10 a person. Hamburger patties are hand made and thick as well! 

Place is small, but its fine as a to-go burger place. The owner was super nice and very conversational, even hooked us up with free drinks that night!
author: Katrina H.

description: If you're out in the Richmond District, and in the mood for a good ole burger, hit up Uncle Boy's. I had the Unhorsed Cowboy, and enjoyed every bite of that burger! Fries are OK, I'm not really a french fry fan though. The burger is good - not an award winning "Best of the Bay" type hamburgers, but very good! Bacon, American Cheese, 2 Onion Rings, and special BBQ "cowboy" sauce...you will not leave hungry!
author: James P.

description:
By far the nicest workers you'll ever meet. Super friendly, kind, good sense of humor... They made every customer feel important. The food was above average, lots of fixin's on the burgers. Price is spot on and the whole place is really clean. Best of all, it is right around the corner from home. 

Wear Giants gear and get 10% off!!
author: J M.

description:
A burger place that delivers? Why don't we do this every week?

The food was good! Burgers and Fries and Drinks, oh my!

I loved their onion rings. The burgers were solid and large. Fries were a little on the cold side, so they weren't as good as they would clearly have been hot.
author: Elsa E.

description:
woah! 

a good buddy of mine introduced me to this place just the other day and having lived in the inner richmond district since 1993 i was blown away to find out that i've passed this place dozens of times without really ever realizing it. 

going inside its a bit cramped. every seat (of the about 8-10) was taken so i decided to order my food to go and had to stand while i waited. kinda a pain but really no big deal. this place does the most with what they've got and the food i got was delicious. i wasnt really in the mood for a burger so i got the wings and was delighted. not too spicey (which was to my liking). my friend says the burgers are top notch. 

this is for sure a place i will be hitting up more in the future since i live pretty close by. 

ps... im a bit suprised to see that this place has been labled "hipster" and "trendy". this looks to me like a place made by local SF guys. nothing but giants/49er stuff on the walls and the clients all seem like regular neighborhood people. far different from a spot like say... the 540 club?
author: Andrew D.

description:
i never should have eaten here because i'm not supposed to eat gluten or dairy, however, i couldn't resist. my friend Kirk and I went and this very unassuming place was just amazing. there was one cook, 5 people waiting and i figured it'd be forever until we got our food. amazingly, not only did it only take a few minutes to get delicious juicy burgers and fries, but it wasn't a plateful of anger from a sour worker. this guy was cheerful and smiling and asked us twice how it was. i'm lazy and i rarely write reviews although i always say i'm going to, so this was a rare thing for me to be that happy that i come home to do this. 

a+++++++ uncle boy's. i will be back.
author: scott r.

description:
Walked by this place countless times, not realizing it was even there!

Based on some quick iphone action on the bus, this place came up in a Yelp search for great burgers. So, we tried it. 

The verdict: Not amazing but a very pleasant surprise! 

This place is a tiny hole in the wall that seems to be run by young, fun loving guys (a single gals dream)! Burgers are made to order, fresh, big, juicy, good! My only complaint was that the buns were too thick. I ended up taking the top bun off completely.

All in all, satisfying, fun, social place to get a burger if you're in the 'hood. I'm sure I'll be back soon after a late commute.
author: Rachel L.

description: Great service, really good vibe.  Love the chicken nuggets.
author: Charles G.

description:
I was really excited when I noticed this place on one of my runs and told my bf about it. We decided to give this place a try sometime since he's such a burger lover. So we finally decide to try this place. I settled for some chicken wings because I LOVEEEEEEE chicken wings and bf got a burger. 

I was really unimpressed by the chicken wings. I wasn't sure if they were supposed to be crunchy or soggy... because it came out being both. In the description it said "deep fried to a crunch outside"... hm... As for the burger, I didn't try it but bf didn't really like it. I guess we'll come back only if we're desperate for some burgers.
author: Eugenia G.

description: The O. G with fries hits the spot.  Great burgers, super small place.
author: Sandy P.

description:
I came to this place cus of all the good reviews. I was in-between. Not only is there no parking around this restuarant at all but the food wasn't as good as people made it out to be. Their burgers were dry, buns too thick and the fries were soggy. Although I did order their tiring (deep fried banana & jackfruit)  that was delicious. 

I gave them 3 start cus their customer service is awesome. The guys are really chill. I think I'll go back to see if I like something else better.
author: Loraine E.

description:
OK, So I soooo wanted to hate on this place. I wanted to say this place was an atrocity.  Another reason I hate the BA.  One less place to worry about after "the big one".  But after eating here I found it difficult to because...

1.) simple menu that doesn't pretend to be something it;s not.
2.) Price to flavor ratio is good. I got the Hamburger meal with bacon for like $9.  The meal without bacon is $7 something.
3.) Solid Hamburger build.
4.) Fresh cut fries
5.) Pretty quick service even though they were in the weeds.
6.) Solid flavor

Cons
1.) burgers don't do well with Diced onions, rings usually work better.
2.) the cooks are better than the idiots at rosemunde but still don't know how to work a grill effectively - the result is that is they try to temp the meat it will more than likely be OD'd.
author: Spanky M.

description:
Man, everybody's talking 'bout "work out the kinks" this and that. I've seen places down in Mission and TL that ought to be condemned; as far as I'm concerned Uncle Boy's sets its sights at just the right height and hits all the targets. Burgers made right there at the counter, lots of toppings, cooks an counter guys that actually pay attention to you, for a lower than Mel's, higher than Burger King price and quality. For a simple burger shop to get take-out dinner for two, that's great.

But the kicker?

DELIVERY.

That's right, burgers delivered right to your door! Who'd 'a thunk it? Now on a wintery San Fran night you don't have to worry about your fingers turning blue-black and dropping off just because you want junk food and you're tired of chow mein or a large pepperoni.
