Though I know this is old news overseas, this is freakin' incredible to me! Let's hope they're here to stay!
author: Andrew B.

description:
Place is awesome, I live down the street so I come here after work for a quick, big, cheap meal.

You have to try the mama mia - cheeseburger with 4 mozarella sticks on top and marinara sauce, definitely an experience.
author: James M.

description:
At first I was very skeptical about the place and passed by a few times on the way to school. Uncle Boy's didn't leave an impression at first, but I revisited not too long ago and everyone was very warm and welcoming, not that they weren't at first.

I ordered take-out and got my drink with the combo while waiting. The burger is pretty good and fried are made there...awesome. It's like In-n-Out fries but twice the size and actually cooked perfectly.

Good to hear they're starting delivery and a PLUS...open 'til 3am!!!
The place is growing on me and looking forward to many more burgers there.
author: Elle T.

description:
Ok for the price.  Nothing special.  As the other reviews have said, the burger has a super charred crust(due to cooking on the hot spot on the grill). =amateur cooks!  I also saw one cook break for a cigarette and didn't wash his hands right after coming back inside. (makes you wonder if they wash their hands after the bathroom?)

Fries are straight out of the bag, guess they are ok for what they are.  If these guys took the 5 extra minutes in hand forming burgers and cutting their own fries,  this place would shine.  But it is what it is and it probably will never be anything special.
author: frizzle-fry e.

description:
I went back in a couple nights ago.  Everything was perfect.  They even gave me a small side of fries while I waited.

Good job Uncle Boy's.  I'll be back.
author: benjamin d.

description: Just moved in near this small, yet clean hole-in-the-wall, and can already tell I'm going to be a regular!  Relaxed atmosphere with friendly staff. I can tell that this place will be my go-to for game nights and hangover cures. Loved the chicken sandwich with jalapeño poppers, but can't wait to try a burger!
author: Bridget B.

description:
Ok, so I just finished my third trip to Uncle Boy's and am a little disappointed by my recent venture. First two experiences were phenomenal, as the burger was nicely(if not a tad well) cooked, and the fries were fantastic. The latter was the tipping point for me making this my go-to burger joint in the Richmond. I am a sucker for real, skin-on, salt n' pepper french fries.

However, much to my disappointment, these fried delights are no more. Furthermore, the cook was not on his game. I noticed that the condiments on my toasted buns were not what I ordered. As I politely pointed out the error, and second, correct bun was being prepped, I noticed my burger charring on the grill. YIKES! I understand he was a new cook, but really killed the hamburger. Ta boot, there was no ice available. Charring and lack of ice is tolerable, but will likely not return unless fry situation is alleviated.

The employee/owner I have encountered twice has been a joy, and is evident he hopes this business thrives. Changes like this will not help his case.

Oh yeah, last thing... Ya had cheddar last week, and it was a good thing. Make regular, please

UPDATE: It sucks to see a local business, start solid and just keep on sliding. Even though I pledged to not return until the reinstatement of fresh-cut fries, I broke last week and called for sunday lunch to-go. My call-in was returned with "We are out of fries, would you like..." NO! I want what I ordered! This is how you lose return/local patrons. Delivery minimum, ATM minimum that can't cover a 'combo' meal, twice had no delivery driver, etc.

Only eat there if you end up in front, between midnight and 2am...
author: Kevin Q.

description:
We had to try this place since we live close to Clement and tire of Chinese food.  We don't even have to eat it, we smell it all day long.

I thought the fries were great, love the pepper!

The burger was very good although I thought the bun a little too big, but my neighbors loved it.

We had some fairly complicated orders, as far as who wanted what on each burger, and the cook got it right.

The owner is very friendly and he seems to want to make the place a success.

We ate in and it was a little chilly inside so maybe next time we'll have them deliver since they deliver to the Richmond district.
author: Madeline M.

description: Great little place. Prices are awesome and so is the food. I went with the Mama Mia, and it was good, but my buddies got the Cowboy and I was a little envious. I'll have to return to try it.
author: Alfredo A.

description: This is one of our favorite places to go get our burger fix before heading to the movie. The chef (gorge?) is extremely friendly, he remembers our order as soon as we walk into Uncle Boy's. The owner should feel lucky to have him running his place, he really treats Uncle Boy's like it is his own business. Their food is really good, their menu improved since their first opening month. I always get the original burger. I have tried their lumpia when they first opened and wish they would have them again. I make my own lumpia now but it's nice to know if we can buy them there again since it's a pain to fry things at home. We are very loyal customers so I will always support this place as long as we live in in SF! Thank godness for SF preserving small businesses like this.
author: Wine L.

description: good fast burgers cooked infront of you. Nothing more to say. Its not fancy but its worth the low prices and then some.
author: E.N. C.

description: even though I was unable to finish my burger due to it being so BIG...it was The best Burger I have had in a long time! I ordered    the HOT MESS...2 strips of bacon, 1 slice of cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions, and jalapenos topped with our hot mess sauce all in a toasted bun. The staff is so friendly, I also had the fried Mozzarella sticks...no joke ...they where so YUMMY!  Everyone was happy with their order. I will most defenitly eat here again.
author: karen g.

description: Not my favorite. The onion rings, which I read as a must get, were frozen and greasy. Though the burger was assembled with care, the meat lacked flavor and tasted old. This place is probably awesome after a night of drinking.
author: Hunter S.

description:
I love Uncle Boys. I LOVE THEM. They make great food, they are open late and they deliver, free. Unless you live in the Richmond you have no idea how great it is to have an alternative to Video Cafe. Not only is Uncle Boys open late, but they DELIVER. Since the first day I lived in San Francisco I hoped and prayed for a burger place that was open late and delivers. But here is the kicker. The burgers that Uncle Boys makes are OFF THE CHAIN. It would be one thing to get a shitty burger drunk at 2am, but Uncle Boys said "NO. Night Owls deserve great burgers too!"

I've recently started to branch out from the standard "Burger and Fries" and i've found that the Bacon Link Sandwich is FLAVOR INSANITY. It is a painful experience to call Uncle Boys and not order a burger, but the Bacon Link Sandwich is worth it. The fries are good enough, plus they have the good kind of onion rings, however the best possible side is the lumpia. Trust me, get the lumpia with your burger you will not regret it. They are little egg rolls with chicken and peas and corn and other veggies and they are crazy with flavor. 

Basically I have nothing bad to say about Uncle Boys. I have wanted to move from the Richmond for a long time, but Uncle Boys is the one thing that makes that a difficult decision. How can I give up a late night burger joint with free delivery that makes great food??
author: Ryan S.

description: Yep.  A solid burger for a great price.  Fairly easy street parking.  Fast and simple.
author: Mel B.

description: Delicious. I had the cowboy, and it was great. Bacon was perfectly crisp, not too much sauce, meat was done nicely, yummy onion rings. Their fries are good too, perfect balance of salt and pepper. Highly recommend :)
author: Milla K.

description:
A good friend of mine lives around the corner.  So after a 4:20 session at dudes house, i was in search of the perfect burger.  what do you know, i found it! 

ordered the mozzeralla sticks,and the OG burger(get it--OG....OG kush haha).  Holy shit!!!!  Best burger ever.  I ate it in literally 60 seconds.  the employees couldnt believe it.  i think i should get a reward or sumthing...right???  maybe a free burger......lol

thanks uncleboys for the best burger i have had since i can remember last......which is not that long...lol
author: Josh S.

description: My wife and I were taken here by some friends while visiting SF and were quite pleased with it. I had the "Mama-Mia" Burger - featuring Angus beef, jack cheese, mozzarella sticks and marinara sauce. The flavors really worked well together and the ingredients were quality. I'd definitely recommend it.
author: Kevin S.

description: Yum-yum-yum! I've been coming to Uncle Boy's for about a year now and I continue to be amazed at the consistatentcy & quality of their food! If hour looking to quinch a 'BURGER ATTACK' this is the place! I took my sister there yesterday and she was blown away with her burger, stating 'why didn't you take me here the last time I was in town? I told her 'I only found this place earlier this year by using a Truebates voucher'. Boy that was one of the best vouchers I've bought this year! The staff is friendly & efficient. I'm always welcomed with big smiles; thanks Jessie & Denisha for making my sister & me the BEST ever burger yesterday! And no, I'm not a personal friend of any employee's at Uncle Boy's...CHECK THEM OUT!
author: Gwenn B.

description:
Update:

At this point, I'd give these guys negative stars. I just received the following message from "Carl B.":

"Ur a fucking idiot. Hope u choke on someones food!"

Considering that his only published review is a ridiculously effusive one of Uncle Boy's, I imagine that this is one of the staff. Way to run a business, kids.


They used to make their french fries from fresh potatoes and fry them in vegetable oil.  Now they've switched to cheap shortening (hydrogenated oil), frozen fries, and cheap buns. I was told that the owner decided that serving actual food was 'too expensive'.

To to honest, this place has always  been amateur hour but at least they used to serve something resembling food.

At this point you're paying $8 for something a notch below McDonald's. Brilliant.

Edit after comments received from John E, along with responses:

**
hi there, thanks for the input, but just so you know..

 1. we changed our buns because too many people complained : 
about them being too thick when we had them fresh made and the 
bakery could not change it.
**

There are other bakeries in the city I'm sure that will provide appropriately thick (or thin) buns.

**
 2.we changed our fries because the fresh cut failed to be crispy 
enough for most people and no vendor was able to provide us with kenebec potatoes that did not have half the bag rotten.

**
This sounds like a lousy excuse. Somehow other establishments manage to make fresh fries. Either they're all dealing with half-rotten bags and still managing to turn a profit or they have found suppliers who sell non-rotten potatoes.

Also, they weren't 'crispy enough' because you don't know how to deep fry properly. Proper french fries are fried twice. I can send you some links about French Fry making if you're want to know how it's done.

**
3.both frying oils you mentioned are the same price only the vegetable oil took longer in cooking and could not handle frying up heavy amounts of food at a time.
**

Fry less food per batch. You're not a high volume operation anyway.

**
I am just trying to improve our services.
**

The fact that you're fielding the responses here is a good sign but making excuses for why you're using inferior ingredients and cooking methods isn't 'improving' anything.
author: Peter B.

description: The cheeseburger was delicious. And the fries had the perfect amount of salt. Not to mention they give you a very generous amount of fries. I'll definitely be going back!
author: Katie K.

description: Pretty good burger place. Nothing fancy but they make good burgers and the prices are good.
author: Darius A.

description: Love this place. Fries are some of the best, seasoned to perfection. The burgers are also really good. Service is quick and friendly.
author: Spencer D.

description: Great service late at night. I'm pretty sure the owner was operating the register. My bf always gets some version of a hot dog. I had a chicken parm type sandwich. We also got onion rings and lumpia. The lumpia I would pass on as it seemed rather bland. The rest of the food was fine. The staff were plenty friendly and food order was ready in a timely manner. It's convenient and open late at night.
author: Roberta B.

description: First Time enjoying Uncle Boy's last night and I will say their O.G. angus beef patty burger is some good eating. Their fries perfectly compliment the burger and best part of them is that they are actually seasoned with good taste! I usually go to Buffalo Burgers but most definitely consider this neighborhood restaurant in my choosing of dinner options. Also the fact that they are open unitl 3am on Fri, Sat is a HUGE plus as I ordered around 11pm when most other restaurant are already closed.
author: Avjji A.

description: I ordered an O.G. Burger with cheddar cheese, everything on it, it totally hit the spot. I was starving! It was juicy and delicious. Usually I'm picky about my fries, they were the perfect size and fried to french fry perfection!!
author: Jay K.

description: So good.  The meat looks like the patties my dad pulled off the gril in the 60's.  And the fries are so crispy!!!!   The place is so small it's crazy but last time I was there a dad with two young girls had them step over to watch their food cooking.  ANTICIPATION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Amy M.

description: small place definitely worth going some of the best burgers I've had in the city by a long shot. The burgers are juicy and their fries and onion rings are awesome.
author: Rodolfo E.

description: HUGE burgers, great service and open late.  Definitely recommend getting the Cowboy burger with onion rings, bacon and bbq sauce!
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Yesterday i was craving a burger, so a friend of mine took me here. The Mama Mia burger was DELICIOUS. So filling and great, just to die for. The place is small and only one person is working, so it takes a while to get the burger. But it doesnt taste like those fast food places.
author: Nikita K.

description: This place sells lumpia...Both veggie and chicken...both made by the Lumpia Cart dude. And it's really delicious. It's a pretty simple place with some great drunk/munchie options...The burgers are supposedly rad but I've been allllll about the lumpia here. It's all really affordable and cheap and pretty quick with great service. Definitely glad it's in the area!
author: Lauren S.

description:
got the onion bring hamburger i forget the name and it was super good. 
also tried the hotmess burger, it was spicy and good.
fries were good
guy who was cooking was super nice
all of the orders were take out. 

price for burgers is like 6.50ish? and then for the meal is 8.50ish? 
get the meal its totally worth it.

tip: get SCOUTMOB on ur iphone/andriod and get 50% off until may2011ish
or show ur school ID and get 10% off.
author: just k.

description: Do you like Costco? Do you like Costco frozen foods? How about paying 200% markup for it? If you answer yes to all then you'll love this place. Personally I love Costco and Costco frozen foods, but I'm not down with paying $9.50 for 8 dwarf wings and fries.
author: Brian H.

description: Love this place.  Fresh fries with salt and pepper, great burgers and personable staff.  The burgers are so good!  I honestly think the fries might give In-n-out a run for their money.  I need to get out to Inner Richmond more often...
author: Alex K.

description: Sunday morning, foggy and cold... Walk in and a guy with a baby on his chest has sauce dripping down his chin as he devours the wings.  He narrowly avoids dripping hot sauce on the baby.  Told the wife - sure he'd walk the baby... Everyone's happy.  Anyway back to my burger... My daughter told be about this spot.  Lots of choices, but I like my burger classic.  OG all the way.  Didn't disappoint..  Don't go for the ambience but the burgers (and evidently the wings) are pretty tasty,
author: Gail D.

description:
The recent surge of new burger joints and the obvious interest in consuming them has put new bounce in my step, so thanks all you lovers of this universal meal in some form of wrap.  I learned about Uncle Boy's on Yelp, my favorite place to look, learn and divulge MY feelings about so many things, but for me Burgers, as well as to read what the rest of you have to say.  It's kind of new, and Balboa is a neighborhood that offers little foliage and distinction so this little gem stands out.  I walked in about 4:00 PM on a recent weekday and was greeted by one of the nicest young counter men I've ever ordered anything from, and he could easily pass for an Abercrombie model, whew.  I surveyed the back wall menu and decided on the Niman Cheeseburger with fries and a soda for just under $10.00, such a deal.  It's a small, rectangular storefront with plate glass windows looking out on several contractors businesses and some three story apartments that feel kind of sad.  There are maybe a half dozen tables, a three stool window counter, a clean black and white tile floor and white walls sporting some NFL and NBL memorabilia and little else.  Soon enough that guy at the counter handed me a red plastic basket with my burger and fries, wrapped as neat and tidy as a baby in diapers.  The burger was cooked perfect, I was elated that they new how to faithfully cook to order good chopped beef.  The cheese was melted and a pretty as a picture and the fixings were portrait quality too.  The fries, I dove in immediately, were hot and crisp, lightly salted and so nice, a generous portion too.  
Why do some people get it with burgers and others don't have a clue?  It's baffling to me that anyone would order steak cooked to order, a potato and salad and marvel when it comes out the way they want it, and yet have so little to say about the much more intricate and complicated burger that contains just about the whole nutrition tree and requires skill and timing to cook and assemble with distinction.  This small place reminds me of Pearl's, one of my absolute favorite burger places, on Post Street where burger making is an art form.  Back to my burger, the 1/3 lb. meat patty was obviously hand formed and fresh, the seeded bun was toasted, the cheese was a generous slice or two and draped beautifully over the scrumptious meat, and the lettuce, tomato, onion and pickle were fresh, copious and cold for crunch and taste.  The owner came in during my meal and I asked a couple of questions leading off with where the name came from.  He said that in the Philippines, like here, it is common to call family friends uncle and auntie and it was that simple, a warm and familial salutation and invitation to try the Uncle Boy's very good grub.  I also asked why burgers, and he told me he wanted to own his own business and after studying the market and neighborhood, a high quality, reasonably priced burger place made sense and hence we're now graced with Uncle Boy's on Balboa.  A sweet addition to our burger line-up.
author: Stu S.

description: So this place was great, open till 3am on a Tuesday night and they deliver!!!! My boyfriend and I ordered the combo veggie burger!!! It came with a veggie burger, fries, and a drink!! The veggie burger was pretty good ( defiently not the best but pretty good for a place called Uncle Boy's), the fries were pretty good as well ( they were defiently fresh cut, I found a few of them to have tooo much seasoning on them for my sensitive tongue)!! The only reason I'm giving them four stars instead of five is because I really wanted a milkshake and they don't make them ( how silly is that a burger place that doesn't sell milkshakes) so hopefully They will get on that and start making shakes!!! If your up and feeling to lazy to go out, defiently try this place though!!
author: Noelle L.

description: Thanks to Angela A. for the reference. It's nice to have another late-night burger spot other than your usual fast food joints. For those hanging out late in the Richmond District, head over to Uncle Boy's for a good ol'  flame-grilled burger. Nothing out of the ordinary, everything is well seasoned including the fries. Uncle Boy's is new to the block and it seems there's still room for more.
author: Leroid D.

description: Great place to get a late night burger for a very fair price. For under $10 you get a fresh delish burger of your choice fries &drink. I had the mama Mia burger and enjoyed every bite.
author: Josh V.

description: Just a darn good straight-up cheese burger made to order in the inner Richmond. Fries are good, but better if twice-fried for crispiness, but the onion rings were just right. Plan to hit up some of the other menu items later - corn dogs?Sure, why not. Sort of a mini diner-like counter and tables, they'll have to work out the decor later along with the high bright kitchen lighting. As take-out, they pack it great and it stays hot. It'll be a regular for a burger fix close by.
author: Tristan C.

description:
Goodness: this place is just like the "old days" when they really cared about customer service. The respect towards customer's wishes are shown and highly appreciated.
I was doubtful at first because the owner seemed so young, but he shows a serious business side where the customer's wishes are his concern. I really hope he succeeds amidst the overabundant Asian restaurants in the Inner Richmond. 
Last but not least, next time I go, I plan to be hungrier because their burgers are heavier than a quarter pounder.
author: susan t.

description:
You guys must be kidding with the positive reviews. The only good thing I can say is that the cheeseburger came with bacon. We did take-out and I got there just as things were being packaged up.

1. Cheeseburger cooked to DEATH. 
2. Fries so salty we couldn't eat them
3. Wings were cold and soggy
4. Didn't give me the drinks that come with the combo
5. Shockingly expensive.

Really, it's a bust. Glad to see a new biz in the hood, but the quality of the food is total crap.
author: dave r.

description: Mmmm... I just finished eating my burger meal a little while ago. I got my food to-go since I live right down the street, however, they do have some seating available. The burger was juicy and the fries were amazing, I love that they're fresh and have seasoning on them. They were nearly out of fries (although it was enough fries for me), so I just got charged for the burger, which was a nice gesture. Friendly service and delicious food, definitely a perfect combination : ) I'm sure I'll come back whenever I need my burger fix.
author: Paige C.

description:
Late last year while riding the 31 bus home, I spied an unfamiliar marquee on the south side of Balboa between 3rd & 4th Ave.  The giant burger on the sign was a good indicator as to what type of place it was (or was going to be), but what the heck is an Uncle Boy?  A posting on my favorite neighborhood blog (free plug for richmondsfblog.com) soon cleared up my cultural ignorance, as well as let me know they were up and running.  So being a.) a burger fan, b). always up for trying new things, and c). an avid supporter of new and local business, especially in my beloved Richmond District, I decided to give them a try.

First impressions on walking in?  The place is immaculately clean.  It's got that "new business smell".  Actually, it smells like they make food there, and surprise, they do!  There are a few tables, a little bit of counter space, and two flat screens.  But enough about the decor and facilities.

The gentleman behind the counter (and it was just him when I went) is a warm and friendly guy who goes the extra mile to make sure his patrons are welcome, and more importantly, that the order is accurate, as he demonstrated with the family of four that was just ahead of me.  When it came my turn, I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger (hold the ketchup) combo meal, which comes with fries and a fountain drink.  It took a little while for my food to be ready, but it was quite understandable considering it was just him doing everything.

So the food arrives, and as I often do (because I've been burned on this many a time), I check for ketchup.  No ketchup!  Automatic points for order accuracy!  The burger itself is piled high with the usual fixings, a HEAPING (no way that's two slices) pile of bacon, all nestled in a bun.  The fries are piping hot, medium cut (thicker than shoestring, thinner than steak cut), and peppered.  Descriptions done.  Time to eat!

Uncle Boy's slogan is "Small menu, big taste".  This statement is accurate.  The burger was flavorful and juicy, the fixings were crisp, fresh, and generous (especially the bacon), and the bun fluffy.  But what really stood out for me were the fries.  I mentioned earlier they were peppered, but what they did not seem to be were salted, and this is a good thing.  The pepper flavor, aside from being a refreshing change of pace, was strong, but not too strong that it overpowered the potatoes.  A perfect balance.  The salt that you can add yourself hardly seemed necessary.

While thoroughly pleased with my meal, I believe there is room for improvement here.  In my opinion, the burger patty should reach or slightly stick out from the edges of the bun, ensuring there is beef in every bite.  My recollection is that it got a bit lost in there, and my last couple bites were burger-free (but since there was so much bacon, it wasn't as big of an issue).  If they added an extra ounce to the patties or used slightly smaller buns, this could probably be resolved.  Second, and this is more a matter of personal taste, they use a golden brown mustard versus the classic yellow.  Since I'm more of a yellow mustard guy, this was unexpected, and while my burger was great, I think it would have been better with French's classic.

When I went to pay, the proprietor was genuinely interested in how I enjoyed my meal, and if I had any feedback, positive OR negative, as did one of his partners who joined him later.  We discussed the menu for a bit.  Apparently, they'll make pretty much anything the way you want it, provided they have the ingredients.  Make it a double?  Sure.  Add onion rings and barbecue sauce to make it a western?  Absolutely.  Their menu is indeed small, so they can't fit all the secret goodies on there, but these folks will practically bend over backwards to accommodate your more gluttonous desires.  Also, check out their website, as they've now put the entire menu (with pricing) up, including the extra patty option.  Because the only thing better than a bacon cheeseburger is a bacon double cheeseburger.

In short, this place is well on its way to becoming a neighborhood favorite, and considering the dearth of "regular" burger joints in this city, I welcome you with open arms and an empty stomach.  And the delivery option doesn't hurt either (for Richmonders only, sorry Mission hipsters, you have to ride your fixies).

And now, to try the wings...

PS:  Any chance of adding mushrooms, either as a topping or a deep fried side?
author: N. P.

description: One Word: YUM!!! Everything Ive had so far, from the side chick to the dog in heat (yes, the names are entertainement in itself) are AMAZING.  Creative names, creative combinations, completely juicy and yumminess, and the best part......very affordable. Not one of these places in the city that rip you off for an average burger, this place puts a unique twist on your basic burger and doesnt try to rob your pockets.  I definately will be coming back again n again.  Thanks Uncle Boys!
author: Justine S.

description: When this place first opened I was excited because it was local and the food looked great. But, I initially had some serious repeated issues with their astoundingly inept, intermittent, and entirely unreliable delivery service - - which I see now they have wisely given up on  - - that definitely turned me off for awhile. The fare, however, was pretty solid, somewhat classed-up but not pretentious, American food (burgers and fries) with some independent touches and extras, so I am willing to drive and give them a second chance at some point. Based on my previous experiences, if you order pick-up, mIght be a good idea to double check they have your order right.
author: Sean M.

description: The sushi place nearby was awful, so my date and I headed to Uncle Boys for a last minute chance to save our bellies! We walked two blocks to Uncle Boy's and ordered what ended up being an incredible sandwich! With only a dozen items on the menu, who would of thought this hole-in-the-wall was the real night's success! Bring your student ID and get 10% off!
author: Allison B.

description: This is a local favorite of mine. As a burger lover, I am always on the look out for a good burger joint. Uncle Boys is cheap, quick and delicious. The owner is a great guy who I always strike up a conversation with. While the burgers may be simple, the quality ingredients always hit the spot. If you are ever in the Richmond or at GG Park and are craving a good burger, Uncle Boys is the spot for you!
author: Robbie M.

description: Yelpers, you did me wrong.  We got a few different burger meals from here and they were all dry, the meat was overcooked and the fries were blah.  Where's the juicy beef and crispy fries??  Soooo, not worth it.
author: b t.

description: I've lived in the neighborhood for 14 months and have walked passed Uncle Boy's everyday wondering what it was like inside and who in the world goes there. The time had come and my buddy and I ventured inside and the spot was clean, the cook was congenial and the fries were pretty solid. The cook served me a burger after I asked for a chix sandwich, but was very apologetic. Many sauces, and during the course of the hour, I counted 20 people come in and grab food. I can't say I've been to a burger joint at all the past 3 years, but I was pleasantly surprised here.
author: Jeff S.

description: Great to see something new, and different, in the neighborhood. The staff is very friendly and the food is simple and delicious!  The bacon cheeseburger was done just right, as were the onion rings.
author: Michael L.

description: Went here with a friend the other night.  The place is quite small and parking was difficult in that area.  The burgers were decent just wished they had an option to add avocado.
author: JACOB L.

description: Husband came home with burger & fries. I tasted 1 fry and had that "someone hasn't changed the oil" aftertaste. I didn't try the burger but he said "Burger King, but $10".
author: A H.

description: I'm really impressed how the people at Uncle Boy's read all the reviews and take the time to thank their customers and are open to suggestions...shows that they really care what we think =)
author: Angela A.

description: Darn good burgers... and they deliver? Makes me a happy boy.
author: james H.

description:
Great Food, Large Portions, Good Prices, Open Late.

Excellent Friendly Service, Big Screens While You Wait.
author: Josh B.

description:
I Absolutely LOVE Uncle Boys. Easily the best late night place for young people from Van Ness to Ocean  Beach.  I had an Unhorsed Cowboy meal and it was fantastic. I was especially impressed by the guy at the cashier, I think his name was Allan (maybe not) You'd think with such limited space and so many people things would be hectic but he kept everything moving smoothly, from keeping all the sacues filled, the tables clean and ready and giving out excellent recommendations on what food was right for the moment. Wish I could have his ploiteness and effiency at every place in the city.

Only down side was the wait (who would have thought a place could be packed at 2am) but the staff was entertaining the food was more then worth than worth it. Keep up the great work Uncle boys, boys. I will definitely be back
author: Eric R.

description: Best fries in the city, not sure what they do to them to make them so good.  Definitely not the wimpy, shoestring stuff that is rampant in SF.  It's really great to see a small business that shows care and pride in what they do....one of the things that makes this a great place to live.  Keep up the good work, Uncle Boy!
author: Erick M.

description: This place is such a charming hole in the wall. I believe it is run by a couple of friends? Anyway, my friend and i came here to try the place out and it was such a pleasant experience. The food was not "out of this world", but it was good in a "homey" sense. The service we got was a big plus. They were all so genuine and you knew that this is what they love...feeding people great food. I've only tried the cheeseburger but i am definitely going back to try the chicken sandwich.
author: Suzan L.

description: Fries were good..Nicely seasoned and came with a generous amount for the price. However, they could have been a little crispier, as the consistency reminded me of In N Out fries. I'll definitely be back to try the burgers though!
author: Brian L.

description: Alright, I REALLY want to try this place because late night burgers delivered or picked up are right up my ally. But I first tried to order online, through grub hub, but they say don't deliver to me, even though I'm right across the park from the richmond, literally. Lincoln. So I figured I'd call so I have now tried both the number from grub hub and their website, about 10 times, and no answer!!!! Do they take phone orders??? They have supposed to have been open for an hour at this point. I WANT TO ORDER YOUR FOOD BUT YOU WON"T LET ME!!!! Happy to update this once I actually receive service.
author: Parker H.

description: Tonight was the first time I made it in to Uncle Boy's since I moved to the neighborhood a few months ago.  Honestly, I had been putting it off because the place looked a little questionable from the outside.  I am so glad I finally gave it a try.  My hubby and I split the grilled chicken sandwich, which was really juicy and flavorful, with lots of drippiness from the sauce.  The fries were plentiful, hot and perfectly crispy.  We also split an order of the fried jalapenos, which were unfortunately fairly average.  Not to be deterred - I'm going for a burger next time!  The service was great, which I was surprised by - somehow I expected a surly burger-flipper behind the counter.  The guy who made our food was super friendly and really personable.  We will definitely head back and recommend UB's to our peeps.
author: Jamie M.

description: Uncle Boys gets 5 stars just for the excellent customer service. Just tried the place for the first time with a couple friends the other day who live in the neighborhood. The menu is small but has a good combination of hangover food / comfort food. Mostly fried stuff and burgers but everything was delicious. These guys said "we appreciate you" at least 3 times. The customer service will for sure bring me back.
author: theresa b.

description:
10% off when you wear Giants Gear!!!  And who isn't wearing Giants gear these days?  Except those dirty Phillies and Dodger Fans.  BOOOO.  Another small little place in the Richmond District I've been missing for a long time.  Open way late for those drunken munchies.  I made it there after watching the Giants game the other day, WOW!!!  BIGGGGG Burgers, lots of fries and a fountain drink for $10??  No more late night Jack in the Crack for me.  I had a burger with onion rings, cheese, bacon, and a hefty burger.  You can get fries and a drink for like $2 more.  Get it well worth it.  Your not gonna be moving after one of these burgers anyway, mind as well just forget about it and go for the full on heart attack instead of just a slight clog.  They've got a couple TV's so you don't miss any of the game you happen to be watching while you grab your grub.  The only problem I had was that my burger was cooked medium.  And if you're drunk or hung over like I was, my mind isn't working at full capacity and need a little assistance on just being asked how I'd like it.  Might have been that he forgot, not that big of a deal.  I'll be back when my arteries get cleaned out. LOL
Matsbaseballtrip.blogspot.com
author: Mat F.

description:
It's Friday night, 11:30. Hubby and I are watching TV when a commercial for fast-food came up, this massive hamburger filling up our screen. Hubby is suddenly craving a hamburger and I, being highly suggestible, pregnant and hormonal, decide that I must have one, too. Just so you know, I'm not really a hamburger person. The only hamburgers I'll eat are from In N Out. 

So, there's a McDonald's that's a 3 minute walk from our place and hubby, the wonderful obliging guy he is, rushes over there to get 2 whoppers, only to find out they were closed. What?!? It's Friday night?!

In comes Yelp where I found Uncle Boy's. They were the only burger place open that got decent reviews (open till 3 AM!), so we drive our asses up to Inner Richmond. We get a hamburger, a cheese burger and an order of fries. 

The burgers were soooo yummy (and I know it's not just the hormones talking since my husband thought so, too). It it was a decent-sized piece of meat, too (6 oz, I believe). It was grilled perfectly, well without any pinkness, but still moist and not at all greasy. The guy working the register was also the cook.

The fries were okay, but I think it's just my personal preference. I like thin fries, not steak fries and these fries where right in between as far as size. They were still tasty (salt & peppered, which I liked) and I still inhaled it all.

We'll definitely be coming back when the craving comes up again.
author: S. C.

description: I love that they're open til 3 in the morning & so close to the USF campus. It's a great spot, especially for us college kids who've been up all night... studying. :)
author: Danika H.

description:
okay the staff are pleasant .. sort of.
but the food is not good and special orders are not their specialty... we ordered three burger today and one had only lettuce, one had no onion, and the third was standard. we watched one employee explain shorthand .. .that when something is circled it means only that ingredient... the guy making our burger took a good ten minutes to prepare our burgers and i saw him check and triple check his work and then we got our burgers and he explained that one was the only one with lettuce.... which was supposed to be only lettuce and the other two ALSO had lettuce... didn't make sense.... and the burgers weren't good. 

we will never eat here again.... it's definitely not worth the price...
author: Angela M.

description: Ordered the hip-popper burger, a good unique and tasty burger with jalapeno poppers for a reasonable price. I'd show a picture of it, but it's digesting in my stomach right now. Line was somewhat long, but what do you expect in a busy restaurant. Got my food to-go so i couldn't tell you what the setting was like. There aren't too many tables and chairs, so it's not good for large groups..
author: Tony L.

description: This place is great.  Burgers are really good, fries are spicy.
author: Ethan S.

description:
definitely one of my better bad decisions!

ordered the unhorsed cowboy, thought the meat was a little small, but the combination of bacon, onion rings and whatever else was on there was awesome.  that and it wasn't very filling 

tiny mom and pop joint with hardly any room to sit. Call in and order for pick up
author: James C.

description: Very satisfying!  First, the food is exactly what they say it is and prepared the way they say its prepared. This should seem ordinary but few fast food joints rarely do this. When they say something on the menu is crunchy and delicious they really mean it. Second, the price is more than fair for the generous portions they give you. I'm a big dude and I was definitely satisfied after finishing my meal. Lastly, I ordered my food online and they came 20 minutes earlier than the estimated time of arrival. Good food and even better service!
author: Noah M.

description:
Great that we finally have a real burger place nearby.  I like the name.  It's a good burger, but a little too much bun 

NEED a cheddar cheese option; only american and jack now

suggestion: would be good to have a double slop burger with fried onions, mushrooms, bacon, double meat, double cheese, extra ketchup, mustard, mayo, pickles, lettuce, tomatos, hot sauce

good fries - salt and pepper

free refills.
author: Thomas B.

description: SO MUCH BETTER! When this place first opened the burgers were consistently overcooked and the quality of the ingredients were terrible. I decided to give uncle boys one more shot and to my surprise my burger was perfectly cooked and the ingredients looked fresh and delicious. They had even dropped the prices! Since then I've gone to uncle boys probably once a week. Its not just me, the yelp reviews on this place used to be abysmal and now people are really loving this spot. Thanks Uncle Boy's for listening to your customers and taking our criticism to heart.
author: john f.

description: We love this place. It's cheap, open late, and serves quality burgers, fries, and general greasy goodness with a smile and clean, mellow environment.  Highly recommended.
author: Mary C.

description:
Great burger with great tasting fries.  What a nice change from the heavily Asian influenced restaurants.  John  the owner is really nice and I hope for the best for you guys!  Parking is difficult though.  

Lawrence
author: lawjenn w.

description: I just ate at Uncle Boy's tonight, and I have to say.. Thank god a burger joint finally opened in this neighborhood that delivers! The owner is super personable and the burger was great. I'd love to see this place succeed. They're open late, so if your drinking spots on Clement or Geary near 4th, stop in and soak up that beer with delicious food!
author: Charmelle P.

description:
It's my first review on Yelp and I'm coming out of the gate swinging! 

I really, really, REALLY wanted to like Uncle Boys. They are only a few blocks from my house, have great hours, and they are a small fledgling business. Unfortunately, while the service is great and the employees are nice, the food just doesn't cut it.

I've eaten here 3 times in hopes that my previous visits were flukes. They weren't. The fries are soggy, the burger buns are bland, and the meat is only average. I thought it was just me the first time, but my girlfriend agreed and so did my neighbor.

I'm not going to completely swear them off, but until I've heard that their quality and taste has improved, I'm going to get my burger elsewhere.
author: Mike D.

description:
More than the food or the decor, I like the guys that work here. They're personable, friendly, and the guy even gave me a few extra zucchini sticks ;) Speaking of the zucchini sticks, they're so far my favorite side on the menu. I also like their fries, they're like the perfect blend of salt and pepper, no flamboyant out-there seasonings or anything--simply delicious. 

So far, these are the items that I've tried: 
Cheeseburger--not the best, but still pretty good and fair priced. 
Chicken Sandwich: Tasted kind of burnt, but it was worth the price especially if you like that taste-of-the-grill. 
Onion Rings: deliciouss. 
Zucchini sticks: Like i said, my favorite. 
Veggie burger: my favorite burger!!

Next time, I want to try their Turon (fried banana and jackfruit wrapped in a lumpia wrapper, coated with melted brown sugar), and their Lumpia. 

I will definitely come back here, especially since it's so close by and THEY DELIVER for FREE between 12-2! :)
author: Jenna R.

description: I am from Ohio and visited some friends for a week in the city.  We ended up stopping at Uncle Boy's nearly every night.  The Hot Mess is an incredible sandwich, and they have some of the cheapest beer in the city. If you haven't stopped into this crammed shop yet, you need to
author: Benjamin D.

description: Awesome. Reasonable prices, great food, friendly staff. I ordered take-out- I live 2 blocks away and it was ready within a couple of minutes of me getting there. The fries and the burgers were fresh and delicious. I'll be back. Probably too much.
author: Molly Z.

description:
These guys are fantastic! Their fries are really good. They are fresh cut fries with perfect amount of salt and pepper. I'm a vegetarian and they had a veggie burger which was nothing special but it was good and even better that they had that option for vegetarians. 

However, the customer service is great! I will come back just because of it. I went there once with two friends of mine and they were super nice. Also, they delivered to me my meal which was only 10 bucks even though there is 15 dollar min. required for delivery. The guy told me not to worry about it and that it wasn't a big deal. They are so so so super nice!
author: Ranjana K.

description: Exactly as a burger joint should be in the richmond: quality, simple, and totally unpretentious. The owners obviously know and understand the neighborhood. Thanks for a great tasting relevant addition!
author: Brennan W.

description: first place i ate at when i became a student in the city, great little joint. no A/C which sucked cause it was a hot day and it has a small area to make hot burgers.. but great to sit out of the little place and people watch while eating a low priced meal.
author: Taelor S.

description: A delightful reception, tasty burgers, and exquisite fries are what one may expect from the establishment known as 'Uncle Boy's'. The menu is simple but straightforward, and one may even add fromage to everything the heart desires. A combo meal is available for purchase at circa 10 American dollars. Simplicity is the key attribute to this burger resto.
author: LaMouche M.

description:
1) NO PARKING, so plan ahead if you want to come. You might end up walking a few blocks. 

2) Food was decent, tasted fine...but over-priced. I am not going to pay $10.00 for a meal. In fact, the "meal deal" or "make it a meal" or whatever he calls it, is really not a deal at all. The prices just add up the ala carte items. It would be nice to save $1 or $2 for the meal. 

Overall, tasty food if you like things coming out of the freezer. But not worth it. Loud and bright too...
author: Ato Z.

description: I cannot begin to describe how tasty their O.G. burger is. I would go there every single day if I could! Even though the wait is long, and the place is super tiny.. their burgers are deffinetely worth it! The staff are SUPER friendly and their buns are so fresh. The beef is perfectly cooked for the OG burger, it's too bad that I shared it with a friend cause I would've eaten 10 burgers if I knew it was that good! Way to go guys.. hope you could expand your branch in the near future!
author: Sarah A.

description: Burgers are pretty good but these guys don't deliver any more which was the whole reason I tried them in the first place. They are open late but need to get delivery back on the menue!
author: kathy c.

description: 5 star burger #79 really no words needed grab a bite of the mama mia never tasted anything else no need i can eat one of these everyday
author: James D.

description: This place was great. It just opened and its a cool little place. Trust me its really small but the burgers are great. Not to complicated. I guess you could say its one of those burgers that you put in your mouth and it tastes like heaven. The service was friendly too. I defenetly recommend this place to anyone that wants a good burger. I would for sure go back to this place. Its just so cute...Dident try much of anything else...OH and the fries are amazing they are fresh not frozen. I guess they cut  them there everyday...That is so awsome.
author: Amanda F.

description: Great late night grub and munchie hub. I had a veggie burger and mozzarella sticks. If you are heading there as the bars close leave a few minutes before everyone else makes the trek or the wait can be a bit long.
author: Dre D.

description: Good late night food for friday and sats since they open til 3am. The burger prices are alright (cheapest one is about 5.45 or so). The addition of fries with a burger is only a dollar so I'd recommend that. The service is a bit slow and they give the orders out of order for some reason. Overall a good place I'd go back to if I don't feel like eating fast food, dennys or ihop late night.
author: Bobby J.

description: Food was good as always, but the hour delivery wait for two burgers when I live less than a mile away? Jeez! That sucked, plus after all that time, the burgers were cold... :( I don't think I'll order delivery again...
author: Nico S.

description: Love this place! So nice to have a burger place in the neighborhood staffed by nice people who just want to make your eating experience pleasant. Everything we've had there (and it's almost everything) has been tasty.
author: sfmarzan o.

description: 4 star rating factors in 50% off scoutmob discount. google it. got two unhorsed cowboy combos for $10. without the coupon i'd probably give this place 3 stars. the unhorsed cowboy tasted very similar to a western bacon cheeseburger at carls jr. fries were piping hot. the side of lumpia my sister ordered was not very good. cashier and cook we both really friendly. it may take a while to get your food when this place gets busy.
author: B Y.

description: My roommate and I tried this place last night while searching through yelp for a delivery restaurant that we hadn't already eaten in the last few weeks. The menu is simple but good none the less, I had a corn dog meal (yep, I love the things) and she had a chicken sandwich. We got both as meals with fries and sodas and were both VERY satisfied with our orders. The corndogs were perfectly made and the fries with their pepper topping were delicious. I was a little nervous ordering friend food for delivery but both meals came very quickly and were still warm and tasty! We asked for ketchup with our order and were given the perfect amount (not too little like some places in the area) and even the fountain sodas weren't too watery like they'd been sitting around too long. The meal was affordable and our experience was really good. I highly recommend this as a quick, cheap delivery (or pick up) option in the inner Richmond area!
author: Amber E.

description: The corn dog is the best I've eaten so far.  The burger was pretty tasty and their fries are homemade.  Overall, a good and cozy place to eat at and the owner and workers are super friendly.
author: Mary L.

description: I had a cheeseburger at Uncle Boy's this evening and it was delicious, juicy and so tasty.  It was perfectly cooked and fresh.  The customer service here is always great, the staff are very friendly.  They now have a new menu with some great looking burgers on it.  I can't wait to try them out.  This place never lets me down when I'm looking for comforting, wholesome food.  Great burgers, great customer service.  I would definitely recommend it and will definitely be back to try some of the new burgers.
author: Joanne G.

description: If I'm going to eat a big ol' cheeseburger, I want it to be a mighty fine cheeseburger. I ended up at Uncle Boy's because my wife was craving good ol' comfort food. The guys at Uncle Boy's whipped up cheeseburgers and fries in no time. I had to carry the food eight or so blocks and it was still awesome when my wife and I sat down to eat. We got the basics - cheeseburgers and fries, and they were mighty, might fine. I was able to pay with a credit card (hooray for airline miles). I was worried I was settling for drab starchiness, but I was oh so wrong. If you want a juicy burger, and hot salty fries, this is the place.
author: Charlie T.

description:
My dear friend and I were craving cheeseburgers last night and made our first (of many, I'm sure) trek down to Uncle Boy's. We both ordered cheeseburgers and fries, the one man working was very thorough about what veggies and sauces we wanted or didn't want, or needed extra of...you get the point. Anyway, he whipped up our burgers pretty fast and we enjoyed chatting with him as he did, super pleasant man. 
Now, I suppose I should mention that, as I am not supposed to be eating gluten, it is a very rare occasion when I do indulge in the hamburger bun, but this night, looking at the juicy, cozily wrapped burger, I just had to. Oh and even this morning I believe it was worth it (still wish there were more gluten free buns out there). 
The cheeseburgers were cooked perfectly. I read some reviews that they were overcooked and on this occasion I would disagree. Plus having a close friend with a food science degree, I would really rather not eat any ground meat not cooked completely, but beside the point. The lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, onion situation was well proportioned, and the condiments didn't tried to attack as soon as the burger was lifted up. Overall a great burger and a pretty cheap one at that!
author: Brittany B.

description: went a few weeks ago after returning from the holiday break, and was incredibly impressed. first off, a burger joint in the inner richmond?.. love it! way to take some risk and bring something new to the neighborhood. they serve up big portions - a big burger, lots of fresh fries, exactly what you're looking for when you're in a burger mood. also, it's run by a great group. they're friendly, young, motivated... showing exactly the type of love you should get when you walk into a boutique food spot. you can tell they love what they're doing and it shows in the food they produce. keep killin it, john!
author: Adam H.

description: I just ate the best burger I have ever eaten! THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! I walked in wanting something to fill me up. The place is a little hole in the wall that I have passed by a million times but never realized it was there. When I walked in the two guys there were extremely friendly. I ordered a cheeseburger meal for something like 8.50. As my burger was being made the other guy and I started a convo about the place. The burger was amazing and juicy. It looked exactly like the sign (something that never happens).  Cooked to perfection. The bread was good. The fries were nice and crispy (even tho they were not fresh cut like the menu says). As I left completely satisfied with my burger the guys told me to have a nice day and insisted I leave the stuff on the table. That is what this neighborhood needed. A place where not only you can get a good burger but where you can sit and chat and have a great time. Thank you uncle boys!
author: Carl B.

description: I never write reviews, but I ordered from grubhub and these guys never even confirmed the order, and they still refuse to pick up the phone 30 minutes later.  I've spent so much money on grubhub it's gross, and this is the first time this has even happened.
author: Andrew G.

description: I just tried the cheeseburger and onion rings, it's delicious. Workers here are so friendly. What I love about this new business is they support workers with disability. I hope other employers do the same thing. You guys rock. I will continue ordering and eating here.
author: Jose A.

description: THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE!!! when i first tried this place out 5 months ago it was pretty good, then the next 2 times it was pure garbage. THEY CHANGED THE BUN!!! into some kind of asian/philipino type bun that tastes like rubber. then they start burning all of theyre burgers for some reason as if it tastes good burnt YUCK!!!! and then theyre fries became soggy and had too much salt and pepper. ANYBODY WHO ENJOYS A REAL AMERICAN BURGER SHOULD NEVER STEP IN THAT GARBAGE HOLE. the owner is nice but has a bunch of weed smoking losers work for him. (oh yeah and one time they had flat sodas)
author: michael w.

description: Went here the other night to satisfy a junk food craving. The guys working were super chill and friendly..new faces from when I was there last a while back. I was glad to see the the menu had a couple new things on it as well as a pretty decent price cut which is always nice...especially since those couple extra dollars were what was keeping me from going there since it didn't seem worth it. I ordered the veggie lumpia and onion rings. I was the only one there and the guy working made my food promptly and was really careful when packing up my food and getting the sauces in containers, not just thrown in the bag. Everything was really good except that the oil they fry stuff in seemed like it kinda needed to be changed and 2 of my 5 lumpias were pork/shrimp when I ordered the veggie ones, which was kinda unfortunate since I don't like pork or shrimp much. Otherwise this place is pretty decent and open laaate.
author: Cathleen M.

description: delicious! open late, they deliver, AND have bacon wrapped hot links? umm amazing!
author: laura c.
